loans.name: Onofrio

texts.es: Onofrio, de 45 años; esta casado con Zenaida (46) y juntos tienen cinco  hijos, habitan su vivienda propia que esta situada en el distrito de San Francisco.Onofrio, es una persona con mucho ahínco que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Se dedica al transporte fluvial, y brinda el servicio de transporte surcando  los ríos con su bote, y  transborda personas e mercaderías.  De esta manera viene trabajando 20 años como motorista emergiendo su bote bajo las inmensas aguas del Río Apurimac; en la travesía lo acompaña un ayudante quien se encarga de medir con un asta la profundidad del agua. No se queja de su trabajo al contrario se siente  feliz  por el servicio que presta, pues gracias a su labor  paga la escolaridad de sus hijos y  a la vez ha logrado comprar  tierras para  cultivar. Los  planes a futuro  que tiene para su negocio es adquirir otra canoa para brindarla en alquiler y así obtener mayor ingresos económicos; ademas de empezar a cultivar en mayor cantidad.Es el  13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos puntualmente, además esta satisfecho  con el desempeño de los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues todos son muy solidarios.Onofrio tiene planeado invertir los  dos mil soles solicitados, en la compra de  semillas y de esta manera espera mejorar la producción de sus tierras.
texts.en: Onofrio is 45 years old. He is married to Zenaida who is 46 years old and together they have five children. They live in their own home which is located in the district of San Francisco. Onofrio is a person who puts a lot of effort and who fights for the well being of his family. He is dedicated to waterway transport, plying the river with his boat and ferrying people and goods. He has been living this way for 20 years as a motorist emerging from his boat on the vast waters of the Apurimac River.  He is accompanied in this passage by an assistant who is in charge of using a pole to measure water depth. He does not complain about his work but rather he is happy for the service he provides. Thanks to his work he pays for his children's schooling and has managed to buy land to farm. The future plans he has for his business are to buy another canoe to provide it for rent and get more income and to start farming in greater quantities. This is the 13th loan he has received from field partner MFP for which he pledges to continue making his scheduled payments on time. In addition, he is satisfied with the performance of the members of the community bank, they are all very united. Onofrio plans to invest the two thousand soles requested in the purchase of seeds and thus expects to improve production of his land.

loans.use: Purchase seeds to plant his crops.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann B. is 22 years old, married, and has three school-aged children.  She lives in the village of Poblacion, Talakag, Bukidnon. To make a living, Mary Ann makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as rice and cheese cakes in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and acquire working capital. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, eggs, and milk. This loan will be Mary Ann's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients such as flour, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Phylis Akalale

texts.en:
Phylis Alalale E. is a 26-year-old woman, married and the mother of three children. They live in Napetet, on the outskirts of Lodwar. She has been running a retail shop in the area for three years now. Her monthly income is 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This will be Phylis's first loan from KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc., for her shop. She is going to plough additional income back into the business. In the future she wants to become a great business lady in Lodwar and also fully meet her needs.

loans.use: To add stock like rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mary Cristina

texts.es:
Mary Cristina Barón Q. empezó su panadería al lado de su familia, pues después de que su padre trabajara durante años en una mina de carbón y después de sufrir una tragedia en la que murieron muchos de sus compañeros decidieron emprender un camino difrente para salir adelante y superar las dificultades. 

Fu entonces cuando Mary en compañía de su padre y su madre se dedicaron a este oficio, el cual aprendieron para cubrir los gastos familiares. De domingo a domingo esta constante familia se dedica a hacer panes, galletas y otros productos  propios de la panadería. 

Actualmente, necesitan de un préstamo para comprar insumos, así aumentarán la producción e irán creciendo poco a poco hasta convertirse en una gran panadería.
texts.en:
Mary Cristina Barón Q. began her bakery business together with her family.  After her father had worked for several years as a coal miner and suffered through a tragedy in which many of his co-workers were killed, the family decided to go a different route to get ahead and surmount their difficulties.  

That's when Mary and her parents decided to learn how to run a bakery to cover household expenses. From Sunday to Sunday this indefatigable family works making bread, cookies and other baked goods.  

They plan to use the loan to buy ingredients so they can increase production and grow into an even bigger bakery.

loans.use: To buy bakery ingredients

loans.name: Djromahuton Senadé Group

texts.en:
The Djromahuton Senadé Group consists of nine women who are all in the same product sales. They have agreed to support each other in business and in loan repayments, and this is the first loan they are taking from ALIDE.

Séraphine is the leader of the group (pictured with her hand raised), and was born in 1969 in Cotonou, Benin's largest city and economic center. She is married with three children, all of whom are schooled. For the last three years she has run a stall selling household products in front of the local town hall. She will use this loan to purchase additional goods from Chinese importers, for her to resell at her stall. Her long term aim is to expand her business and support a larger product line.

She believes her dynamism is her strong point as a saleswoman.

loans.use: to purchase Chinese imports to resell

loans.name: Emma Elibeth

texts.es: Emma Elibeth ha recibido diferentes golpes de la vida, quien al lado de su hijo de ocho años ha salido adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de manera ambulante y en su vivienda, es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes y de proporcionar ingresos a su hogar. Ella en vista de las necesidades que han afrontado ha sido una luchadora incansable. Es por eso que ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como aguacate, mangos, sandias, nísperos entre otras frutas.
texts.en: Emma Elibeth has met with many of life's difficulties, and, alongside her eight year old son, has moved forward.  She works selling fruit in the streets and in her home.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman who enjoys talking with her customers and budgeting her earnings for her home's expenses.  In view of the struggles she has encountered, she has been a tireless fighter.  For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy avocados, mangoes, watermelon, nísperos, and other fruits.

loans.use: to buy avocado, mangoes, watermelon, nísperos, and other fruits

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza is a talented cook and hardworking mother who came to the United States from Ecuador to create a more prosperous life for her family.  This will be her fourth loan from Grameen America to support her ambition of cooking and selling traditional Ecuadorian food.  Tereza used her first three loans to successfully grow her food cart business, where her most popular dishes include chicken, potatoes and empanadas.  Tereza will use her latest Grameen America loan to acquire space and purchase inventory to open a grocery store.  Running her own store will not only help Tereza earn greater profits, but it will also allow her to work regular Monday through Friday hours, instead of working all weekend like she does at the food cart.  This is especially important given how devoted Tereza is to her four children and her nine nieces and nephews.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and the rent space she needs to open a grocery store

loans.name: Yanyan Assana

texts.fr: Agée de 55ans, Mme Assana est mère de 03 enfants et est veuve.  Elle vend les produits chimiques depuis 12ans à Hédzranawoé  après achat à SPROCA (une société de vente de produits chimiques).   Elle veut  assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants vue quelle est veuve, avoir son  propre terrain et plus tard sa propre maison et ajouter une autre activité à la première.
texts.en: Mrs Assana is 55 years old, she is the mother of 03 children and a widow. She has been selling chemicals for 12 years at Hédzranawoé  having purchased them at SPROCA ( a company that sells chemical products).She wants to  provide a better future for her children because she is a widow, obtain her own land and later on her own house and add a another business activity to the first commerce.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 29-year-old wife and mother of one son. Her husband who is photographed here instead of her as she is a religious woman has a photography studio.

Ola's husband wanted to purchase a new and modern  printing machine for pictures that would enhance the pictures' quality and make the work faster to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.use: Purchase a modern printing machine for pictures.

loans.name: Tirigot

texts.en:
Tirigot is 26 years old and married with two children. He has been a farmer for five years. He learned about KADET Ltd. through an advertisement by KADET staff.

Tirigot requests a loan of KES 40,000 that he will use to buy farm supplies.  This loan will be his third from Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  Tirigot plans to invest the proceeds from the loan back into his farm. He is an honest man who strives hard to achieve.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Soforal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. les femmes qui forment le groupe habitent toutes dans le même quartier. Elles mènent comme activité la vente de crevette, des produits de cueillette, d'arachide et de balai.

madame félicité qui est à droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est veuve et a en charge six enfants. 

Elle s'active dans la vente de crevettes, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années. Secteur d 'activité qu'elle maitrise parfaitement.

Le prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité.

les profits lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on October 19, 2001. The women who make up the group all live in the same neighborhood. Their business is selling shrimp, edibles gathered from the fields and forests, peanuts and brooms. 

Madame Félicité, who is on the right in the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 60 years old, a widow, and raising six children. 

She has a small business selling shrimp, which she has been doing for several years. This is a field she is quite knowledgeable in. The loan will allow her to bolster her business. 

The profit will allow her to pay the expenditures for food for the family.

loans.use: to buy shrimp.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 32 years old and lives in the small village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of five school-age dependents. Jelly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. She developed her vacant land for a vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been planting and selling vegetables like root crops, green and leafy vegetables, squash, and eggplant for three years. She earns PHP 1,500 every month in cultivation. Jelly requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay the labor costs for plowing her land.

Jelly has been a member of GDMPC for more than one year.  In the future, Jelly hopes to expand her vegetable farm and generate more income.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for plowing her land

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in Sansar are of Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His mother-in-law babysits his two children, aged 1 and 4 years old. 

Altansuh manages a clothing trading business with the help of his wife at a rented stall at a Narantuul, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. They started their business in 2006 and have gained much experience. They attribute their business success to a good location of their stall. Altansuh used to help to his mother's business while he was a teenager. At that time, he learned much about business operation and the fundamentals of business management. He is an honest man who is planning to expand his business in the future. He says, "I want to have my own apartment in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos aún estudiando.  Cuenta con estudios de primaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de ceviche (comida típica).  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de ceviche.
Con éste nuevo crédito de  S/ 2,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará 30 kilos de pescado, camote, maíz, papa, cebolla, limón, condimentos como cilandro, rocoto, etc. Nos cuenta que su negocio está ubicado en un mercado de la zona.
Su sueño es continuar con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción,  conversar con las socias e intercambiar experiencias.
texts.en:
Lucía is a member of the “Niño Jesús de Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 45 years old, married and has five children still in school.  She went to elementary school.

She sells ceviche (typical food) with her husband.  She’s worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 10 years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her ceviche business.  She will use this new, 2500 new sol, loan to buy 30 kilograms of fish, sweet potatoes, corn, potatoes, onions, lemons and condiments like cilantro and chili peppers.  She tells us that her business is located in a local market.

Her dream is to stay in business and improve her income.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because they are a distraction for her, to chat with the members and share experiences.

loans.use: to buy 30 kilograms of fish, sweet potatoes, corn, potatoes, onions, lemons, and condiments like cilantro, chili peppers, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been practicing mixed farming in his hometown of Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya for the last seven years. His farm produces vegetables, milk and maize for the local market. He is married with three children between 10 and 5 years old.

Joseph has made a loan request of 62,400 KES with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that he will use the income to purchase a pedigree dairy cow as his farming business grows. He adds it will also provide a sustainable source of income for the family.

Joseph sees common droughts as the challenge in farming, especially for the dairy farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to repair machines and metalwork materials.

loans.name: Lolita Hipolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been managing her rice farming business for 30 years. She is 51 years old and has two school-age children. Lolita’s husband is a security guard in one of the institutions in the Philippines. She wants to uplift their family living.

Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for the labor cost in farming. She will also use the loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for farming. She hopes that she can earn higher income with each crop to further sustain her children's needs in school. She is doing her best to see that her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming for the last four years. She is 24 years old, and she and her husband Antony have one child.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. Since she paid all of her previous loans well and on time, she has been loaned 50,000 KES. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, Eunice hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Patience and hard work are the key to attaining success in life says Elizabeth. During the three years she has operated her retail shop business, Elizabeth has experienced both ups and downs. Aside from her sari-sari (variety) store, she has also been engaged in a hog-raising business for one year. Elizabeth is married and has five children who are studying at a public school in her community. She is thankful because her husband helps her in maintaining her retail business. He is also in charge of their rice farming and fish vending businesses. Elizabeth hopes that she is able to improve their businesses in order to be able to support her children to the higher level of education. 
With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergent soap for her general store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to enlarge the store, offer more services to her customers and earn a higher income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar ,cooking oil, milk and detergent soap for her general store.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Mwanasha has a house with no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a grocery for the past two years. In addition, she also runs a leso (Khanga's) selling business. (Khangas are a traditional Kenyan woman's wrap, as pictured here.)  Her potential customers are the neighbors. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase one box of tomatoes, twenty kilos of sugar and thirty pieces of lesos (Khanga's) for sale. She decided to join Yehu to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase one box of tomatoes, twenty kilos of sugar and thirty pieces of lesos (Khanga's) for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 27 años es un hombre alegre. Vive en compañía de Noemi, su esposa desde hace 9 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Joel y Jocelyn, a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Huaytacorral. A diferencia de los demás agricultores, él cuenta con terrenos propios, que le fueron heredados por su madre. Son 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas,  donde siembra papa, maca y cebada en gran cantidad. Ya tiene 9 años de experiencia en la agricultura y lo que más le gusta son las temporadas de cosecha, pues ve como el tiempo de esfuerzo y trabajo dan fruto. Además ya cuenta con clientes fijos, quienes le comprar a buen precio los alimentos maduros que produce. Como siembra una vez al año, comparte su actividad con la crianza de vacas, que producen leche fresca, que vende a los pobladores de su localidad. Ahora tendrá una becerrita, pues una de sus vacas está preñada. Desea para su futuro tener más animales y mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas, de esa manera obtendrá un dinero extra. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “Los ángeles” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Wilfredo de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 kilos de semilla de maca y si el dinero le alcanza, pagará a los peones que le ayuden a voltear la tierra para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 27, is a cheerful man.  He lives with Noemí, his wife of nine years.  They have two children: Joel and Jocelyn.  They care for them in their own house located in Huaytacorral.  Unlike other farmers, he owns his land which was passed down to him by his mother.  It’s four hectares of farmland where he grows potatoes, maca root and barley in large quantities.  He has nine years’ experience in farming and what he likes is harvest season because he sees the fruits of his labors.  He has steady customers who pay good prices for the mature foodstuffs he produces.

Because he plants just once a year, he also raises cows that produce fresh milk that he sells to local residents.  He will soon have a calf because one of his cows is pregnant.  In the future, he’d like to have more animals and to improve the quality of his crops to obtain extra money.

He belongs to the “Los Ángeles” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan where he hopes to have support from all of you to continue with his objectives.  He promises to be punctual with his installment payments.  If Wilfredo were to receive your support, he’ll use the requested funds to buy three kilograms of maca root seeds and if there’s enough money he’ll pay day laborers to help him till the soil for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy maca root seeds and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Prisilla

texts.en:
Prisilla is a mother of two children who are 11 and 7 years old. She has been in farming for 16 years with her current production of milk being sold at the local market. She retails tea sourced from other farmers in the area at the local market.

Prisilla has requested a loan of 40.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a dairy unit for her animals. She says the good care for the animals will improve her farming income and boost the family well-being.

Prisilla says Juhudi Kilimo is providing great help to farmers but notes poor prices for the milk remain a challenge.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 32 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos, aquines adora y son el motivo de querer progresar. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, inmueble que logró construir en conjunto con su pareja. La actividad que realiza, es la venta de abarrotes en general, para lo cual cuenta con una pequeña tienda, que acondicionó en su propia casa. Viendo las necesidades de sus vecinos y es que incursionó en este negocio, hoy ha logrado captar mayor clientela y eso le da ventaja en sus ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que está en casa y cerca de sus hijos, además que genera ganancias para contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Su plan es comprar más productos y variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus vecinos. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad que le dan. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más variedad de abarrotes como: conservas, leches en polvo, aceite, arroz.
texts.en:
María, 32, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman.  She lives with her spouse and three children who she adores and are the reason why she wants to progress.  They live together in their own house, an asset she was able to build with her spouse.  The activity she carries out is grocery selling.  She has a small, home-based grocery store to do so.  Seeing her neighbors’ need she decided to go into this business and today she’s managed to secure more customers and that’s an advantage for her profits.  What she likes about her work is that it’s at home and she can be near her children in addition to its earning profits to help with household expenses.  Her plan is to buy a wider selection of products to have a better response from her neighbors.  

This would be her first MFP loan and she feels happy with the opportunity she’s being given.  She will use the requested amount to buy more variety of groceries like canned goods, powdered milk, oil and rice.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has been unsuccessful in finishing her education because of poverty. Consequently, a 46 year old is not privileged to find a high standard job. Despite that, she thought of a business that would be able to lift her living condition. So Zenaida built her own business where she cooks peanuts and eggs and then packs them into plastic. She also makes coco juice as additional good for sale. Her husband is the one who sell her processed food every day. Her business usually goes this way.

Because she wants to earn a higher income, this has caused her to ask for a loan amount P12,000 to buy peanuts, eggs, plastic cups and coconut. She hopes through this business, they will improve their poor living condition.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, eggs, plastic cups and coconut.

loans.name: Agnes Mutete

texts.en:
Agnes earns a living by selling used clothing. She has applied for her third loan of KES 85,000, from KADET Ltd, after paying back the previous loans consistently and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more ladies' clothes, particularly blouses and skirts, to offer for sale.

She will invest the anticipated profits back into the business. She hopes to grow her business and own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to add fresh inventory of blouses and skirts to offer for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 42, married and has four children aged 19, 16, 12 and 9. In 1999, she established her local food-stuff business, which she started in order to assist her husband in running the home. It is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,000,000 every month from this business. Doris has already received, and successfully repaid, her first loans and now requires a new loan of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy garri,bulgur, beans and palm oil. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Doris plans to own her own store, to own a house, and to give her children quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri, bulgur, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 39, is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Lan and her husband support their family by running a general store in front of her house. They started this business fourteen years ago. They sell sugar, candy, shampoo, and other household items to people in their community. 

Lan is requesting a loan to expand the business by buying a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to stock the store and better satisfy customers. She hopes the business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 43 years old with 2 children. She deals in fresh food. She is hard working and dedicated to her business despite the challenges of price fluctuations. Her family goal is to build a permanent family house and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. Amina needs a loan to buy rice, beans, and ground nuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 43 years old, married, and has four children age 2, 4, 5 and 9. 

She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns extra income from her kiosk business. 

She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 KES to buy a blow dry machine.

loans.use: To  buy a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is twenty-seven years of age and is married with three children.

Tina owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Tina needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase frozen goods or meat such as mutton, chicken, and sausages to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 850 talas or US $354 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tina's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase frozen goods or meat such as mutton, chicken, and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a pub to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Charity has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy five crates of beer.

loans.use: To buy five crates of beer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married with six children. He lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. Charles keeps Cows and Chickens as his business. He supplies milk and eggs to retailers. He is in the process of increaseing the flock of animals, especially broilers.

Along side animal keeping, Charles grows vegetables and fruits of which he sells in wholesale and in retail. Droppings from animals are used as manure for the farm. He needs USD 550 to buy some insectsides for treating his farm and increaseing the flock of chickens. Charles has expectations that one day he will become a big supplier of farm products in his region.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Agil

texts.en: Agil is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region, settled in Sumgait city. This 27-year-old man has been engaged in his business for 7 years. Agil sells jean clothes. He supports his family with this business. Agil needs a loan amounting $1200 to be busy with selling the goods.

loans.use: To be busy with selling the industrial goods

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone Kyalo M. is a 31-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Mlolongo, an informal settlement along the Mombasa-Nairobi highway. Kyalo also takes care of his aging mother and two children from his paternal uncle, who is unemployed and cannot take care of them. Kyalo has to make sure that his uncle’s children go to school, are clothed, and eat healthy food daily.

Kyalo started his business in 2005 after 4 years of working at the Kulshan tailoring shop in Nairobi. During this period (2000-2005), Kyalo was employed by an Indian national, and his job was to sew round buttonholes. After some time, Kyalo realized that sewing round buttonholes was a dead-end job, and he approached a colleague, asking to be trained as a tailor. His colleague accepted, provided Kyalo paid for the training. Kyalo trained for 3 years and became an expert tailor.

In April 2005, Kyalo decided that it was no longer worthwhile to stay in his job, and he left to start his own business. Armed with Ksh. 15,000 (USD 214) that he had saved over time, Kyalo bought a second-hand sewing machine and some cloth, and he started tailoring skirts and dresses for small girls. He took these dresses to the open-air market, where they sold like hot cakes. The business is doing well.

Now Kyalo wants to expand his business, because he gets more clients every day. He now employs 3 helpers, creating employment opportunities in the community.

Johnston Kyalo is kindly asking for a loan of USD 525. With the loan, he intends to purchase more cloth and other materials, including zippers, hooks, thread, canvas, shoulder pads, buttons, and lining materials. He hopes to set a shining example of self-employment. He intends to pay back the loan, within 8 to 14 months.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, zippers, hooks, threads, and buttons

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita has been making foods for five years. She is married and has a young son. She began her business when she needed a source of income because her husband lost his job. She began selling tamales and cheeses to businesses in her area, and she later added tortillas. Her greatest demand has been for tortillas, which is why she has increased production. The good quality of the foods she makes and her desire to get ahead have been the reasons for the success of this business.

In order for her business to continue growing, Juanita is requesting a loan of $200.00, which she will use to buy ingredients and to remodel her kitchen. This will help her to keep up with demand and to offer better service to her customers. She will return the loan in 3 months. Be a part of Juanita’s achievements and help her in her business. She and her family are very thankful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años Juanita se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, inició su negocio ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso ya que su esposo se encontraba desempleado. Comenzó vendiendo tamales y quesos en las empresas, posteriormente incorporó la venta de tortillas, en donde ha tenido una mayor demanda, por lo que ha incrementado su producción. La buena calidad de los alimentos que prepara y los deseos de salir adelante han sido unos de los motivos del éxito de este negocio.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, Juanita solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos y en la remodelación de su local, para cubrir las demandas y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella esta dispuesta a retornar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte de los logros de Juanita y ayúdala en su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and to remodel her kitchen

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is the father of 5 children. He is 42 years old and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has his own shop where he sells spare parts and so he manages to support his family. He has run this business for 4 years now.

Eldaniz is requesting a loan of US$1200 to buy spare parts to expand his inventory and better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to diversify his inventory

loans.name: Soledad Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Soledad is a humble and courageous mother who throughout her life has had to confront many difficulties. She immerses herself in her daily tasks and agricultural activities. She recalls that her husband abandoned her 10 years ago, leaving her to care and maintain their six children.

She continues to work in a self-sacrificing manner, dividing her time between the fields and the care of her lambs and chickens, with which she tries to feed and care for her large family. The truth is that she has often felt ready to give up but because of her immense maternal love she has continued persevering with the struggle.

With this impetus, she wants to increase the quantity and quality of her agricultural products and also be able to acquire more livestock, with which she will increase the household’s income. For this project she is asking for a loan of $375 dollars. Le us help this noble and brave mother to continue along this difficult path.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva volunteer

La señora Soledad, es una humilde y valerosa madre de familia que a lo largo de su vida, tuvo que afrontar muchas circunstancias duras. Sumida en sus quehaceres y actividades agrícolas diariamente, recuerda como hace 10 años su esposo la abandonó, dejándola al cuidado y manutención de sus 6 hijos.

Viene realizando de un modo abnegado y compartiendo su tiempo entre el campo y la crianza de ovejitas y gallinas, con los que trata de alimentar y cuidar a su numerosa familia; la verdad es que muchas veces ha sentido claudicar, pero es por el amor inmenso de madre, que siempre sigue perseverando en esta lucha.

Con este ímpetu desea incrementar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos agrícolas y así también poder adquirir algunos animalitos más, con los cuales aumentará los ingresos de su hogar, para lo cual solicita la suma de 375 dólares. Ayudemos a esta noble y valiente madre de familia a continuar su camino por tan dura senda.

loans.use: Increase her seed and livestock in order to improve sales

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María T. M. is a single mother of two children, one of whom is in the United States and the other has returned to live with her. María lived in the United States for many years. However, after María’s mother began her illness because of her old age and could not take care of herself anymore, María decided to return to her home town, Sabinas Hidalgo. And with the small amount of money she was able to save, she bought a small sewing machine and began to offer dressmaking services. Little by little she became well-known in her town and, now, she has more clients than ever.

Apart from her services, she also sells merchandise. She is seeking a loan of $325 because she does not a large inventory. She plans to repay the loan in four months and with the money, María will be able to buy more merchandise to have a greater variety to offer to her customers because with the Christmas season approaching, more people are beginning to do handcrafted work. With your help, María can help her mother live her last few years with dignity and help her to progress in Mexico.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

María T. M., es madre soltera de dos hijos uno de los cuales se encuentra en Estados Unidos estudiando y su hija se regresó con ella. María vivió durante mucho tiempo en Estados Unidos sin embargo la mamá de María comenzó a enfermar debido a la avanzada edad y ya no se podía cuidar sola es por es oque María decide regresarse a su pueblo natal Sabinas Hidalgo. Y con los pocos ahorritos que había hecho compró una máquina de coser y comenzó a ofrecer, adaptaciones, costura de prendas y arreglarlas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia y ahora ya tiene más clientes.

Sin embargo aparte de hacer prendas, vende productos de mercería, y no tiene mucho surtido es por es oque está solicitando un crédito de US $325 para poder pagarlo en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad ahora que muchas amas de casa comienzan a hacer manualidades para la temporada navideña. Con tu ayuda María podrá ayudar a su mamá que está ya muy grande a vivir con dignidad sus últimos años y ayudará a ue su hija salga adelante en México país del que no debió haber salido.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to fix clothings.

loans.name: Inah

texts.en: Inah is a 25 year old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things.  She is able to earn $6 per day due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock.  Inah is requesting a $125 loan to fill her shop with more inventory.  Her husband, E., has no fixed income so she has to work hard for her children's education.  She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shp

loans.name: Eneyda

texts.es:
Mrs. Eneyda R. has worked selling clothing for 10 years, in her own stand at the market of Bisne, located in the city of Chinandega. She started in this business because of her need to support her young son, because she is the only source of income in her home because she is a single mother.

Because of the difficult financial situation of Mrs. Eneyda, the clothing is placed on a wooden table, because she has not been able to save enough money to build shelves. For this reason, she has worked with Ceprodel, and been offered great opportunities to improve her business. Through these loans she has been able to acquire a greater volume of clothing to sell, and has also been able to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eneyda R. se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años en un tramo propio del mercado el Bisne ubicado en la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio por la necesidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo por la razón de que ella es el único sustento de su hogar ya que es madre soltera.

Por la difícil situación económica de la señora Eneyda, la ropa es colocada en una mesa de madera ya que no ha logrado ahorrar para construir un estante. Por este motivo, ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos créditos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de su hijo.

loans.use: Buying clothes (Compra de la ropa)

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen was born in 1948, is married, and a mother of six children. Given the little commitment of her husband to provide food and education for her children, and her inability to support her husband, she sought assistance from GHAPE in 2004. Since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans amounting to $150 and the profits from this loan have helped support her and her husband.

Given a loan, she plans to buy a grinding mill and Koki beans. She believes her business is going to succeed because there is no grinding machine in her area and she is well known for selling Koki in her area.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months.

loans.use: Farming of vegetables and selling of Koki beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw materials and an oxygen-acetylene welder

loans.name: Kankallay Ii Group

texts.en:
Saccoh M. is 55 years old and the father of 6 children. His livelihood depends on farming and he has been farming since he was a boy.

Saccoh and the other 4 members of the group organized themselves so that they can access loans for their farm activities. As the leader of the group. and also village leader, he plays an important role in assuring repayment of the loan, since each member guarantees one another. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) to expand their farm activities.

The members of the Kankallay II group have strategically organized themselves so that they would be able to access the much needed loans for their farms. This is an achievement for them and shows their committment to the farming enterprises as well as excellence.

loans.use: To expand their farms

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children. Her children are currently in school. Tomatoes are in high demand, as they are one of the main fruits used by almost all Ghanaians in the home for cooking. Florence wants to use her loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes to avoid price hikes as we enter the planting season and to increase inventory. She is a member of the group called Believers. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Sam Orl

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Orl C. is a villager in Kraing Brosvay Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Phat Tith, are subsistence farmers. Mrs. Sam Orl C. used a previous loan from AMK to buy fertilizer when her field had sterile soil.

Mrs. Sam Orl C. is 56 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom work in a garment factory. The other child attends the local school. Although the family members have different businesses, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Among other restrictions, they live in a very old house. Thus, Mrs. Sam Orl C. is asking for a loan to buy timber to build a new house.

Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Fernando António

texts.pt:
Fernando António B. is 48 years old and a native of the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. He is married and the father of 5 children with ages 28, 26, twins at 19 and the youngest is 9 years old. One is at home, 3 are still students, and one works for the RSA.

Fernando went to school until the 9th grade. He stopped for his obligatory military service that caused him to travel a lot. He lived with his parents until he was 16 when he moved to Maputo after finishing the 4th grade. He stayed in Maputo through the 9th grade and later enrolled in the S.M.O.

In 1982 he got married. He lives in his own home. He has worked as a soldier since 1977 from the hours of 7:30am to 3:30pm. He has a salary of 11,330MT and does not save any money.

This is his third loan through Hluvuku, and he had a loan with the International Bank of Mozambique for 31,000MT. All of the loans were applied to purchasing construction materials. Fernando came to know Hluvuku through colleagues that were already clients, and he selected it because of the advantages offered. He has a dream to own his own car with the help from loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer Fernando António B. tem 48 anos de idade e natural da provincial de gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Casado e pai de 5 filhos com idades entre 28, 26, dois gêmios com 19 anos e ultimo com 9 anos respectivamente, uma está no lar, tres ainda estudantes e uma trabalha na RSA. Fernando estudou até Nona classe, parou por serviço militar obrigatório que lhe fez viajar muito. Viveu com os pais até aos 16 anos de idade e dai mudou se para maputo quando conclui a Quarta classe, e veio continuar em Maputo até Nona classe e mais tarde ingressou nos S.M.O e em 1982 casou-se. Vive numa casa própria. Trabalha como militar desde 1977, o seu horário é das 7:30 às 15:30h, tem um salário de 11.330,00mt e não consegue poupar. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e teve um empréstimo no BIM (banco internacional de Moçambique) no valor de 31.000,00mt e todos os emprestimos foram aplicados na compra de material de construção. E conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas que já eram clientes, tendo optado por esta esta IMF pelas vantagens oferecidas. Tem como sonho é ter seu próprio carro e isso conta com ajuda de empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam's First loan

Miriam is a member of the Kallpanchik Communal Bank, which means Our Strength in quechua. Miriam has a live-in partner, is 24 years old, and has a 1 year old son. Miriam sells vegetables and tubers in a rented space in Nazarenas market, located in the Jesús Nazareno district. She acquires her products from the supply market in Ayacucho city, where she goes everyday in the early morning hours. Miram opens her stand from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. In addition, Mriram and her husband own a motortaxi that her husband drives, providing transportation in Ayucucho city.

Miriam needs a loan for 1600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potato, celery, tomato, and pumpkin.

Miriam dreams of having her own home, providing the best education for her son, stabilizing herself economically and getting married.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El primer préstamo de Miriam

Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua. Miriam es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo pequeño, Miriam vende verduras, tubérculos en un puesto alquilado del mercado Nazarenas, ubicado en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abasto de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde va todos los días por las madrugadas, Miriam abre su puesto a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Además Miriam y su esposo tienen una mototaxi que conduce su esposo haciendo transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, apio, tomate, zapallo.

Los sueños de Miriam son tener casa propia, brindar la mejor educación a su hijo, estabilizarse económicamente y casarse.

loans.use: Miriam needs a loan of 1600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of potato, celery, tomato, and pumpkin.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou D., 46 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants et 03 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut  renforcer son commerce de fruits locaux comme les pastèques, les mangues, les oranges, les mandarines et clémentines selon la saison. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Astou D., 46, is married with two children and is responsible for three others. She has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for seven and a half years. She wants to bolster her fruit business selling such local fruits as watermelons, mangos, oranges, mandarine oranges, and clementines, according to the season. Her income allows her to improve living conditions for her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sales of local fruit

loans.name: Ghullam

texts.en:
Ghullam H. is 48 years old. He is married and the father of nine children. He lives in the district of Behsood in Jalalabad city and he is an uneducated man. He has his own land and he is a hard worker, working for a long time on this land.

Ghullam grows different kinds of vegetables and wheat on his land and he brings the vegetables to the bazaar to sell. However, his current income of $10 per day is not enough for his household. He wants to increase his income to purchase stock and some seeds for his land; therefore, he requested a 30000AF individual loan from AFGS for 24 months. He thanks his lenders in advance.

loans.use: To buy seeds of wheat and vegetables

loans.name: Zarnishan

texts.en: Zarnishan H. was born in 1979 and is the mother of two (2) children. She has been in the business of selling bed sheets and linen cloth for the past 6 years. Zarnishan is requesting a loan of 970 AZN to purchase a supply of sheets and linen cloth items to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets and linen cloth items

loans.name: Clément

texts.fr: Agé de 28 ans, D. Clément est un producteur agricole, marié et père de deux enfants dont un scolarisé.  Il réside dans l’arrondissement de HOUEDOME, un des 4 arrondissements enclavés que compte la commune de DANGBO et précisément dans le village AHOVILEKOME. Il  travaille son champ après le retrait de la crue. Son  activité principale est la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. En générale, la population s’adonne à la production vivrière après la  décrue et pendant  la saison pluvieuse. La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il sollicite un prêt de 250 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 2hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Clément D., 28, is a farmer, married and the father of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves in the township of Dangbo, more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. In general the population works growing market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it bankrupts them. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 250,000 FCFA to farm about 2 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 2 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng S. K., 45, is married and currently lives in Prey Chor, Kampong Cham province about 120 miles southeast of the capital, Phnom Penh, with her husband, two of her children, and her elderly mother. She and her husband Chhum Seang Hean, 58, together work their rice field and raise fish to earn a living and are able to make a combined amount of around US$ 5 a day. Besides doing this work, her husband is a government teacher in the village. He has been teaching since 1980.

Yeng would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to help open a mechanics shop for one of her sons who lives outside the family home. This son is already married and currently is about to start up a garage but needs capital to run this business.

loans.use: To allow her son, a mechanic, to open a garage

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Ngel Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Run village in the Takeo province comprise this village bank loan. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chan N. is the village bank president.

Mrs. Chan N. is 28 years old and is the mother of four children; three are attending the local school and the other is too young to work or study. She is also a farmer and owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pheim Oun is a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Chan N. is requesting a loan to buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in.

One member in this group has a loan that is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
This is Amidu J., Mabinty K., Isatu C., and Mamusu K.. They named their group Kamuyu, a Temne phrase for “Be patient.” They are local entrepreneurs from the village of Makump, five miles from Makeni. They buy their goods either from Makeni or the other villages surrounding Makump.

This is the group's sixth request for a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of them in the group received a loan of 800,000 SLL. That loan had meaningful impacts on the lives of these people. They were able to use the loans to pay for their children’s school fees. They were also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a loan of about $330 (1,000,000 SLL) each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Amidu (right) is the leader of the group. He is 60 years of age and was born in Makump village. He is married to 3 wives and they have 19 children. The eldest is 26 and the youngest is over 1 year old. His wives too are businesswomen; they joined him in the business. Amidu has been a businessman for over 30 years now.

Amidu sells palm kernels. He and his wives walk around the surrounding villages to search for and buy the palm kernels and then sell the palm kernels in Makeni. A pan of palm kernel costs him 1,000 SLL. With his loan, he will be able to buy 30 bags of palm kernels.

Amidu and his wives faces one challenge in their palm-kernel business and it is that of transporting the kernels from the villages to Makump village. Since these are villages, there are no vehicles around to help them transport the kernels. Apart from this, Amidu is doing fine is his business and he enjoys doing it. Your loan will help boost his business, having money in his hands will make him feel good and have piece of mind.

loans.use: Buy at least 30 bags of palm kernels

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto mayor de edad con 47 años, vive en la Avenida Florida, se encuentra casado, se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en taxi. Trabaja con una movilidad que es de su propiedad. Roberto trabaja para su esposa y sus dos hijos. Tiene una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. La familia vive en casa que es propia.El destino del crédito es para inversión en su movilidad. No tiene antecedentes negativos.
texts.en:
Roberto, at the old age of 47, lives on Avenida Florida and is married. He works as a taxi driver, and owns his own cab. Roberto works for his wife and their two children. He has 10 years of experience in this field. The family lives in a house that they own. The loan will be used to invest in his cab. He has no negative credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin was born in 1977.  He is married and has three children.  Aladdin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  He settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Alikhanli village.  Three years ago he started a sheep breeding business.  Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 15 sheep to improve his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: Buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Саиджон проживает в городе Вахдат в возрасте 40-а лет, женат имеет пятерых днтей.Образование среднее, клиен занимается бизнесом уже более 5 лет, он имеет арендуюмую торговую точку, которая находится на центральном рынке города Вахдат.Клиент занимается изготовлением и продажей деревянных изделий. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет закупить древесину.От полученного дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Saidjon M. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 40 years old, married and has five children. He has a secondary education and has been an entrepreneur for over 5 years. He leases a retail store located at the central market in the city of Vahdat. Saidjon makes and sells wood craft products. He wants to use this loan in order to purchase wood supplies. The resulting profits will help him support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood

loans.name: Masumahon

texts.ru: Несмотря на свой возраст Маъсумахон занимается торговлей. Ей сейчас 56 лет, она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Ее сын уже обзавелся своей семьей и живет отдельно от родителей. Маъсумахон продает продукты питания и в основоном покупает их у местных оптовиков. Доход небольшой, но это очень хорошая прибавка к ее пенсии. С МикроИнвест она сотрудничает уже больше 1,5 лет и с займами значительно улучшила свой бизнес. Сейчас она планирует получить очередной займ и увеличить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Despite her age Masumahon works in sales. She is 56 years old right now, is married and has 1 child. Her son has his own family and lives separately from his parents. Masumahon sells food products and mostly purchases them from local wholesalers. Her income is not large, but it is a very good addition to her pension. She has been working with MicroInvest for more than 1.5 years and has greatly improved her business with the loans. Now she plans to get another loan and increase her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: B. Germaine est née le 29/05/1975 à Adjohoun dans la Valée de l'Ouémé. Germaine est mère de quatre enfants dont un est déjà majeur. Germaine est veuve depuis deux ans environ. Germaine vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Germaine est dans le secteur de la restauration. C'est à Cotonou au quartier appelé Zone des Ambassades que Germaine a ouvert son restaurant. Germaine a une clientèle importante et fidèle mais Germaine manque de moyens financiers nécessaire pour développer son restaurant. C'est pourquoi Germaine sollicite le soutient financier de ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
B. Germaine was born on May 29, 1975 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé Valley. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is of age. Germaine has been a widow for about two years. She lives with her children in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is in the restaurant business. There, in Cotonou in a district called Zone des Ambassades, she opened her restaurant. She has a sizable and loyal customer base, but she lacks the financial means necessary to develop her restaurant. This is why she's requesting financial support from ALIDÉ to do so.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 5-kg sacks of Gino rice, three 500-mg boxes of Gino spaghetti, a box of canned tomatoes, five cases of brewery drinks, and some sauce condiments

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, de la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos, tiene estudios de educación superior (Profesora de educaron primaria), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru Nº 604.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal e inicio su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, con el cuál compró artefactos.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio de compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos. 

Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno y poder construir su casa, luego quiere comprar un carro para que pueda llevar su negocio a diferentes ferias de la zona en general.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, sobre todo las reuniones de su banco comunal ya que ha logrado hacer nuevas amistades.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the “Cristo Blanco” Communal Bank in the city of Juliaca, in San Román Province, in the Puno Region of Peru. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and is a mother of 2 children. She has completed post-secondary studies (in primary school education) and lives in the Tupac Amaru neighbourhood at Nº 604.
She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years and is a founding member of her communal bank. She started her business with an initial loan of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase electronic devices.
She is now requesting a 1500 PEN loan to invest in her business of buying and selling electronics.
Her greatest wish is to purchase land and to build a house. In the future she would like to buy a car so that she can bring her business to the different markets in the general area.
She likes the savings she makes through her communal bank, and above all, their meetings because she has made new friendships.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronics

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She sells second clothes. Victoria hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Remie

texts.en:
Remie D. is from the village of Danao. She is 36 years old. Remie is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Remie owns and operates a fishing business in which she harvests ocean-caught fish and sells them to the local community. Remie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Remie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. 

Remie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Remie's 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Miler

texts.es: Miler de 36 años, es un hombre muy dinámico y de buen carácter. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Desde niño se dedicó al cultivo de papas, arvejas y en menor cantidad, de maíz. Ahora, ya de adulto, obtiene ingresos extras arando las chacras de sus vecinos con los toros de sus suegros, donde le pagan por jornada entre 50 a 60 soles dependiendo del terreno. Y de esas ganancias, a pesar que sus suegros las quieren distribuir en partes iguales, Miler sólo les recibe la tercera parte, pues aprendió a ser agradecido con sus ellos, quienes reiteradamente le brindan su apoyo con sus chacras y sus toros. Por ello, ara todas las chacras de sus vecinos alegremente y en menor tiempo, por lo que tiene mayor disponibilidad para realizar otros trabajos en los cultivos de sus vecinos y cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado una responsabilidad digna de imitar, más aun cuando era el tesorero de su banco comunal, al que tiene mucho aprecio, pues todos los integrantes se llevan muy bien y le gusta ahorrar. Por todos estos motivos se siente muy feliz con su grupo y con su trabajo. El dinero que viene solicitado los piensa invertir en la compra de una bolsa de arvejas y 5 sacos de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Miler is 36 years old and is a very dynamic man with a good character. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 4 children. Since he was a child, he has grown potatoes, peas, and, in a smaller quantity, corn. Now, as an adult, he earns extra income by plowing his neighbors’ farms with his in-laws’ bulls. The activity earns him between 50 to 60 soles per day, depending on the land. From these earnings, which are distributed evenly between Miler and his in-laws, Miler only receives a third. This is because his in-laws offer him their support with their farms and their bulls. He plows all of his neighbors’ farms happily and quickly, so that he is available to pursue other work with his neighbors’ crops and to cover his household expenses. This is his fifth loan with MFP, where he has demonstrated a dignified responsibility. He is grateful for his community bank, where he was the treasurer. All of the members do very well and enjoy saving. For all of these reasons, he is very happy with his group and with his work. The money that he is requesting will be invested to buy a bag of peas and 5 sacks of chemical fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel H. is from the village of Unidos. She is 29, married and has 2 school-aged children. Marizel owns & operates a general store, from which she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Marizel has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Marizel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marizel repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase new items to expand her products. Marizel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Marizel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is a small-business Tanzanian married woman. She runs a clothes shop business at Kiwalani Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both secondhand and new clothes for both men and women and has been running the business for the past six years.

Gloria purchases her stock from the Karume secondhand-clothes city market center and Kariakoo city market shopping center. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anita Lucia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hermano Miguel se formó  hace ocho  años en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad muy hermosa y considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, ya que tiene muchos lugares hermosos y arquitectónicos para visitar, su gente es cordial y amable, éste banco comunal está conformada por 11 socias responsables,  alegres, colaboradoras y unidas, dispuestas a superarse en la vida  para bienestar propio y de su familia, en cada inicio de ciclo preparan un almuerzo para compartir un momento de amistad y alegría entre las socias.

La señora Anita Lucia  A. C. es socia del  Banco Comunal Hermano Miguel, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10, 8 años,  no tienen casa propia, su esposo trabaja como chofer para una empresa, entre los dos unen esfuerzos  económicos  para sacar adelante su hogar.

Anita lleva trabajando 12 años en su negocio de manualidades  realiza pintura en tela, bordados, adornos para el hogar,  recuerdos y tortas para todo compromiso social sólo bajo pedido,  le va muy bien porque cuenta con su clientela fija.

Anita trabaja junto a su banco comunal desde que inicio hace 8 años, y nos cuenta que gracias a los préstamos obtenidos de la fundación ha podido sobresalir en su negocio y también ayudarse para los estudios de sus hijos.

Con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  va a invertir  en la compra de  materia prima  para su negocio como: hilos, tela,encajes,  pitnura, lana para chompa, etc. E incrementar su negocio con otros productos para el hogar.

Su mayor sueño es de tener un local propio para su negocio porque hasta ahora trabaja en su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Hermano Miguel” (Brother Michael) was formed 8 years ago in the city of Cuenca. It is a very beautiful city that is designated a World Heritage Site (a title awarded by UNESCO). There are many picturesque sites and architectural buildings to visit. The people are welcoming and friendly. This Communal Bank consists of 11 members who are responsible, cheerful, cooperative, and united. They are willing to overcome obstacles in life for the benefit of their family as well as themselves. At the beginning of each loan cycle, they prepare a lunch to share a moment of friendship and joy with one another.

Sra. Anita Lucia A. C. is a member of the Communal Bank “Hermano Miguel” and lives in Cuenca. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children (ages 15, 10, and 8). She lives in her own home and her husband works as a company driver. They have joined together in order to get ahead financially.

Anita has operated a craft business in which she makes painted fabrics, embroideries, home decorations, and mementos. She designs these items by request for different social occasions. The business is doing well because she has regular customers.

Anita has been working with her Communal Bank since it started 8 years ago. Thanks to the loan from the Foundation, she was able to excel in her business and also help her children with their education. With this new loan from Fundación Espoir, she will invest in raw materials for her business such as thread, fabric, lace, paint, wool for making sweaters, etc. She plans to expand her business by making more home décor products.

Her biggest dream is to open a shop for her business because she currently works from home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials such as thread, fabric, wool, paint, lace, etc.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали Худойбердиев проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Курбонали более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. Кредитуется повторно. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Kurbonali H. lives in the Yavan region. He is 40 years old. He is married and has six children. Kurbonali has been doing animal husbandry for more than five years. He feeds and sells large cattle. This is his second loan. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta C. is from the village of Mialem. She is 54 years old, is married, and has six children. Julieta owns and operates a hog fattening business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna C. is from the village of Talisay. She is 29 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of her family and the education of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old married man and father of two children. He has owned an air conditioner repair shop since 2008 with fifteen years of experience in this field.

Today, Ahmad is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase newly-developed tools and to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase newly-developed tools and to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mr. Meas P. is 47 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than nine years. He is married with four kids:one of them is married and lives separately, while the other three are single. His wife stays at home to do the housework and also helps him sell fish.
