Recently, Meas P.’s motorcycle is often broken. Since he uses it to transport his fish to the market, this affects his profit. Therefore, Meas P. decided to seek a loan to repair his old motor.
Meas P. was not available when the photo taken, so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To repair his old motor

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr: A. Rosine est née en 1973 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Mariée à MEGNON Honorat, un agent de la SBEE (Société Béninoise d'Electricité et d'Eau), Rosine est mère de trois enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Rosine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Dogoudo à Allada, depuis environs 5 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Rosine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Rosine fabrique et vend du savon local (fait à base de soude, de soja et d'huile de palme) à Houègbo à Allada. Rosine s'approvisionne à Bohicon, dans le département du Zou, et aussi à Allada au Bénin. C'est depuis 14 ans que Rosine mène cette activité. Rosine a déjà obtenu deux fois de crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Rosine voudrait augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, mais elle manque de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est pourquoi Rosine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Rosine was born in 1973 in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin. She is married to Megnon Honorat, who works for the SBEE (Société Béninoise d'Electricité et d'Eau). Rosine has three children, some of whom are educated. Rosine has lived with her family in Dogoudo, in Allada, for roughly 5 years. She and her husband provide for the family.
Rosine did not attend school. To make a living, Rosine makes and sells local soap (made out of soda, soy and palm oil) in Houègbo, in Allada. Rosine stocks up in Bohicon, in the Zou Department, and also in Allada. Rosine has been in this business for 14 years.
Rosine has already received and repaid two Alidé loans. Rosine would like to increase her stock to better satisfy her customers, but she does not have the necessary means. This is why Rosine is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 8 bags of soda, 34 kg of soy and 5 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Mirembe Kikooza Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Annet is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 39 years old and a widow with five children aged 25 to 27 years of age.  She also takes care of her parents.  Annet has a bar business in Kikooza that she has been running for eight years and she is grateful that with the help of loans, she is able to make 210,000 Ugandan shillings as weekly profits which was not the case before the loans.

Annet sells beer, soda, wine and other brews and she hopes to expand her business further to be able to make more profits that will enable her build her own house as well as continue educating her children. Annet needs a loan to be able to restock her bar with more crates of beer, soda, mineral water and wines.

(N. Annet is pictured in the small inset photo. She is also in the group photo, but she cannot be clearly seen. A few members of the group are not pictured.)

loans.use: Restocking a bar with more beer, soda and other drinks.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old and married with four children, ages 19, 21, 25, and 28; two of her children are still attending school. She's a dairy farmer in the Nyamira area of Nyanza province of Kenya and has been farming since 1982. She sells milk locally and also earns income from tea farming. She says that the main challenge to her business is marketing her milk products.

She requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 40,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Grace says that the income from the added dairy cow will help her to be able to pay for her children's school fees.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
Luís Humberto M. M. tiene 67 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Luís trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz y también cría de aves.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel y en su casa.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero y le gusta reunirse con sus amigos en la casa y cantar.

Luís solicita el crédito para comprar de fertilizantes y semillas para el trabajo del campo.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Luís Humberto M. M. is 67-years-old, single, and has no children. He lives in the district of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. This partner is a member of the "Calzado Solidario" (Footwear Solidarity) rural development group, which is located in a precinct fifteen minutes from the district of San Miguel along the coast. There are 19 members in all, the majority of whom work in farming and raising livestock.

Luís works in farming in order to increase his family's income. His most successful crops are corn as well as poultry breeding. He sells his products both at the San Miguel fair and from his home. The most popular cultural event in the area is Carnaval, which is celebrated each year in February and is known for friends getting together at one another's homes to sing.

Luís is requesting a loan so he can buy fertilizer and seeds for his fields. His goal is to improve his family's livelihood. The challenges that he faces include bad weather and diseases that affect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
"I have a two hectare farm. I focus a lot on farming since I don't have a family yet. It was May 2008 that I started having a business. I like the CEVI program because it has the lowest interest rate. It also has other benefits aside from loans like a hospitalization package and savings," says Bernardo G. a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato.

Bernardo would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow his crop.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motorbike taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of ginger to plant

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es: Marlita vive en su casa propia y a sus 42 años es una mujer muy trabajadora y así ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo de 23 años. Ella desde muy joven ha venido trabajando en la venta de ropa a domicilio, actividad en la que ganado mucha experiencia y también buenos clientes. Su forma de trabajo consiste en comprar ropa al por mayor en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de su ciudad y entregarla por pedidos a su clientela de casa en casa. Marlita se siente contenta con lo que hace, porque se siente muy útil, aunque algunas veces es muy agotador, aún así ella piensa mejorar su negocio.  En un futuro desea instalar un negocio más estable y así evitar caminar tanto, de esa manera pueda sacar adelante a su hijo. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy puntual en todos pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más ropa, puesto que tiene mucho pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
42-year-old Marlita lives in her own home and supports her 23-year-old son. From a young age, Marlita has been selling clothes. She has gained a lot of experienece and plenty of good customers along the way. He business works something like this: she buys clothing from one of the busiest markets in her city and delivers it to her customers, door-to-door, on foot. Overall, Marlita is happy with what she does, because it's useful work. It can be quite tiring, however, which is why she wants to improve her business. She wants to make her business more stable and avoid walking quite so much, which will give her more time to spend with her son. This is Marlita's third loan with MFP, and she has pledged to repay it promptly. With this loan, she plans to buy more clothing because she has many orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more clothing.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en: Mrs. Sinuon R. is 38 years old and lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one and a half hectares of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sinuon R. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for a water machine. Aside from farming she also sells cakes in the local village which also earns a small income to support her family. Mrs. Sinuon R. is a widow with two children who are both students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for water machine.

loans.name: Poi

texts.en: Poi C. is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and six of his children in the Battambang province. He is a policeman with a salary of US$90 per month. His wife stays at home to look after the children and to raise pigs for additional income. On average, she makes US$1 a day. All of the children are in school. Poi C. is asking for a loan of US$1200 for his wife to raise more pigs. The photo shows Poi C. with his wife at their home.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Rosalinda De Constancia Group

texts.es:
Reynalda, es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Reynalda pertenece al Banco Comunal Rosalinda D. Constancia el cual queda en el Distrito D. Constancia, ubicado en el departamento Huancavelica, donD. se desempeña como Presidente D. la Junta Directiva.
Reynalda, se dedicaba a la venta D. tubérculos; gracias a la ayuda D. sus ahorros y su préstamos ahora se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales, como vacas, toros, caballos, etc. lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Reynalda, requiere D. un nuevo préstamo para la compra D. vacas y animales mayores, con el cual incrementara aún más su negocio. 
Pensando en su futuro y en el D. su familia, Reynalda quiere establecer otro negocio como la compra y venta  D. cereales y granos. Y que sus ganancias y ahorros le sirvan para la educación D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reynalda is married and has 7 children. Reynalda belongs to the communal bank Rosalinda D. Constancia where she serves as chairperson of the board; it is located in Huancavelica, a sub district of Constancia. Reynalda used to sell potatoes but thanks to her savings and loans she now buys and sells livestock such as: cows, bulls, horses, etc., which generates higher income. Reynalda requires a new loan to purchase cows and larger animals, which will increase her current business even more. In thinking about her future and her family's future, Reynalda would like to initiate another business like the purchase of grains and cereals so her earnings and her savings can be put towards her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.en:
Claudia is a 29 year old woman living in the Colombian capital of Bogotá. She sells small merchandise such as diaper bags, toys, baby perfume, and various disposable goods. Claudia has always wanted to be independent and self-sufficient. At the age of 23, she started a clothing business in neighboring Ecuador. Ten months ago she moved to Colombia and has brought her business with her. She's helped out by her sister so that she can study during the week to become a junior accountant. Claudia's trying hard to grow her business, searching for strategies to increase sales, and it's this dynamic character that brought her to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has requested a micro-loan to stock up on inventory such as baby bottles, perfumes, carrying cases, towels (all goods that fly off the shelves), and movies to show at her store. Looking forward, she hopes to finish her studies and to apply her skills as an accountant to make her business even more profitable.

[EN ESPANOL]

Claudia Milena Pajajaoy de 29 años vive en Bogotá la capital de Colombia, ella es una joven que  se dedica a la comercialización  de mercancías  como pañaleras, juguetería, colonias para bebes y  desechables en general.  Claudia Milena siempre ha estado interesada en ser   independiente y autosuficiente, por eso desde sus 23 años se inició como empresaria  en  Ecuador, un país vecino de Colombia,  en él que se dedicó a la comercialización  de ropa y desde hace 10 meses inició su miscelánea en el conjunto residencial donde vive en la ciudad de Bogotá; su negocio es atendido por su hermana y por ella, que lo hace los fines de semana, porque estudia la carrera técnica de auxiliar contable. Tiene como su principal meta  ampliar más su negocio, buscando estrategias para incrementar las ventas, por eso con el dinamismo que la caracteriza, acudió a la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, donde esta aplicando por un crédito por valor de  $700.000 COP, con él va a  comprar  mercancías como teteros, colonias, estuches, paños y películas para surtir su negocio con esta mercancía que tiene una muy buena rotación. Más adelante su meta es terminar su carrera y aplicar los conocimientos a su negocio para hacerlo cada vez más rentable.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory such as baby bottles, perfumes, carrying cases, towels.

loans.name: Mary Mae

texts.en:
Mary Mae L. is from the village of Upper Lamac Oroquieta City. She is 18 years old and married. To make a living, Mary Mae cultivates fruit trees and harvests mangos for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1820 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Mary Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Cerrito Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de Cerrito de la Ciudad de Benjamín  Aceval Chaco. Actualmente se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo y todas la socias se encuentran satisfechas con los trabajos que cada una realiza.
El chaco es una región Paraguaya muy desfavorecida por el ecosistema caracterizado por ser muy seco, por ello es muy sacrificado realizar cualquier actividad, además hay poca población por lo que para vender cualquier producto se debe viajar hasta otras ciudades en buses.
 La señora Elizabeth es una de las integrantes y se dedica a varias actividades, cría de animales como cerdos y gallinas para consumo familiar, pero su actividad principal es la venta de juegos de azar en la zona céntrica.
Ella todos los días sale para vender sus juegos y de esa forma obtiene ingreso diario, pero está muy interesada en alquilar un salón en el mercado de Asunción.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para algunos gastos que posee en su casa, alimentación y vestimenta especialmente.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras de Cerrito” (Enterprising Women of Cerrito) group is from the city of Benhamín Aceval, Chaco. They are currently in their seventh cycle. All of the members are pleased with the work that they do. El Chaco is a Paraguayan region that is disadvantaged because it is very dry. Hence, it takes a lot a sacrifice for any business. Also, there is a small population. In order to sell any product you need to travel to other cities on buses. Elizabeth is one of the members. She dedicates herself to various activities. She raises animals like pigs and chickens for the family’s consumption. Her primary activity is selling games of chance in the central area. She leaves everyday to sell her games. That is how she gets daily income. She is very interested in renting a place in the Asunción market. She is currently requesting a loan for some house expenses, for food, and especially for clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food and clothing expenses

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is currently in school. Jackie has a business selling clothes, which she has had for less than one year. To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jackie hopes to generate greater profits and treat her cancer sickness. In the future, Jackie hopes to own a shop and educate her child. Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance. Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Jehova Jihere Group

texts.es:
EL BMC JEHOVA JHIRE  SE CREO CON  AYUDA DE UNA SEÑORA QUE YA HABIA  ESTADO EN OTRO BANCO DE CONFIANZA DE  FAPE, SE FORMO HACE DOS MESES CON DIEZ INTEGRANTES.
LA ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL DE LAS SOCIAS ES EL COMERCIO ENTRE ELLOS ESTAN, VENTA DE ZAPATOS, HUEVOS, ROPA, TAMALES, TORTILLAS,LEÑA,PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA, VIDRERIA, FRUTAS Y VERDURAS.
 
BLANCA Z. ES PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO TIENE 40 AÑOS ES CASADA TIENE 6 HIJOS Y CINCO DE ELLOS ESTUDIAN EN UNA ESCUELA DE LA LOCALIDAD.  ELLA VIVIE EN UNA COMUNIDAD URBANO-MARGINAL GRANDE  Y SE HA CATALOGADO COMO AREA ROJA  PERO QUE GRACIAS A DIOS  NUNCA LA HAN EXTORCIONADO  Y HA PODIDO SALIR ADELANTE CON SU NEGOCIO.         EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE QUE TIENE ELLA ES QUE SUS HIJOS SE GRADUEN DE  LA UNIVERSIDAD Y SEAN PERSONAS DE BIEN.
 
EL NEGOCIO DE ELLA ES  VENTA DE LEÑA EL CUAL LO INICIO HACE 19 AÑOS. ELLA SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS  PRODUCTO.  YA QUE LA MAYORIA DE LAS PERSONAS DE LA COMUNIDAD ELABORAN SUS PROPIAS TORTILLAS Y LAS COCINAN CON LEÑA.
EL SUEÑO DE ELLA ES QUE SU NEGOCIO CRESCA Y PUEDA EXPANDIRSE EN TODA LA COMUNIDAD DONDE VIVE.
texts.en:
The Jehova Jhire communal bank was created with help from a woman who had already been a member of a FAPE communal bank. It was formed two months ago with ten members. Commerce is the main activity of the members among which are: shoe sales, egg sales, clothing sales, tamales sales, tortilla sales, firewood sales, beauty product sales, glazier services, fruit and vegetables sales. Blanca Z. is group president. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children five of whom go a local school. She lives in a large marginal urban area which has been classified as a red zone. Fortunately, though, thanks to God, she’s never been harassed and has managed to have a successful business. Her greatest wish is that her children graduate from university and become upstanding citizens. For 19 years she has been in the firewood sales business. She is asking for funds to buy more firewood because most of the people in her community make their own tortillas and they cook them with firewood. Her dream is that her business grows and she can expand it throughout the community where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is a 46-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store business.  She lives in Prk. Santan I, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 4000. 

Gloria is now borrowing PHP 15000 so that she could  purchase more products to sell in her Sari-sari store.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well eing by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mercy Yovani

texts.es:
Mercy es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hija en el sector El Nazareno, una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, es a su vez el distrito con mayores índices de pobreza, es una zona comercial y con bastante movimiento de transporte. Está ubicado a cinco minutos del centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja como mecánico automotriz y para ayudarlo con los gastos de la economía familiar ella trabaja vendiendo cosméticos. Empezó hace ocho años y al principio sólo los vendía por catálogo, ganando comisiones de acuerdo a su volumen de ventas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocido y actualmente ella realiza sus propios pedidos para vender los productos en un pequeño establecimiento ubicado en su domicilio. Su negocio siempre cuenta con demanda por lo que siempre tiene que renovar sus productos.

Mercy desea adquirir mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar su stock e incrementar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en el logro de su objetivo.

Mercy es una mujer dinámica y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mercy is a 33 year old mother living with her husband and a her small daughter in the El Nazareno section, a marginal urban area of the district José Leonardo Ortiz.  The district is the most populated one of the Lambayeque region and at the same time is the one with the most poverty.  It is a commercial area with quite a lot of traffic.  It is located five minutes from the center of the city of Chiclayo.  

Her husband works as an auto mechanic and to help him with the family expenses, she works at selling cosmetics.  She started this eight years ago and at first only sold from catalogs, making a commission based on her sales volume.  Little by little she became known and currently she gets her own orders and sells her products in a small space located in her home.  There is always a demand for her products and she is always needing to replenish her inventory.  

Mercy wants to get more products and thus increase her supply and increase her level of sales and profit..  For this reason she is requesting her first loan through Edpyme Alternativa, a loan of 1000 new soles, which she will use to attain her goal.

Mercy is a dynamic and enterprising woman.  Her major wish is to continue to grow as an businesswoman and help her family to get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to increase sales from her home.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk S., 26, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells fruit, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Her husband sells vegetables, earning an income of about 6 USD per day. The family has to spend 83 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, and 20 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui, tiene 31 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 12-7- 2 años.
Sonia se dedica a la venta de quesos en Soqiaccato, El crédito de s/.900.00 que solicita es para comprar más queso y vender, asi tener más ingresos
A Sonia le gustan las reuniones de su bancomunal porque aprendió a trabajar y ahorrar en las charlas de negocios, tambien ha aprendido los derechos de las mujeres.
El sueño de Sonia es que su negocio crezca y comprarse un terrenito para que viva con su familia.
texts.en: Sonia belongs to the Yana Nahui community bank.  She is 31-years old and partnered with 3 children, 12-, 7- and 2-years old, respectively.  Sonia operates a business selling cheeses in Soquiaccato.  She is applying for a S/.900 loan to buy more cheese to stock her business and increase her income.  Sonia very much likes her meetings with the community bank because she has learned from others there how better to work and save.  She has also learned about the rights of women.  Sonia's dream is for her business to grow and to buy a small bit of land where she can live with her family.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma V. is a married woman who lives in Purok Suyac, Brgy Taba-ao, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a general store, carinderia / eatery and fishing businesses.  Her husband Raclito V., who is 63 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have 10 children who are 24 to 45 years old with 8 of them having their own family.  Their other child is currently employed.  

Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifted her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to fund the business operations so that she could continue to save up for the family's needs. 

Emma V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the business operations.

loans.name: Elizabeth Akinyi

texts.en:
Elizabeth Akinyi O. is 44 years old. She is married to Erick Odeny who is employed. Her business is a source of additional income for the family. They have four children, ages 23, 20, 16 and 12 years old. 

Elizabeth sells second-hand clothes door-to-door ("hawking"). This has been her work for the past 15 years and she earns a monthly profit of KES. 20,000.

Elizabeth learned about KADET LTD through a marketing awareness campaign in the area. She is applying for her first loan of KES. 43,000. She intends to restock her clothes business and build a temporary boutique stall. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase a plot of land.

In the future, Elizabeth wishes to expand her business by buying more bales of clothes and also to have rental houses. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To restock her clothing business and build a temporary boutique stall

loans.name: Eric Vahn

texts.en:
Eric Vahn A. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 41 years old. Eric Vahn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eric Vahn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eric Vahn has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eric Vahn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eric Vahn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Eric Vahn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Eric Vahn from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Valens' Group

texts.en:
Valens J. is from the village of Disimuray, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Valens is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Valens is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Valens owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Valens has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP every four months.

In 2010, Valens joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Valens has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Valens is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd  loan taken out by Valens from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, D. 50 años, es viuda y tiene dos  jóvenes hijos, Freddy  y Deysi; juntos habitan en su casa que es propia, y esta ubicada en el distrito D. Quimbiri.Su edad no es impedimento para luchar por el bienestar D. sus hijos. Y por esta razón trabaja a diario en su  negocio D. venta D. verduras, cuenta con un puesto en el mercado del distrito D. Quimbiri. Trabaja hace 25 años en este negocio, antes vendía sus productos D. manera ambulatoria; pero ahora lo realiza en un puesto fijo, desD. que la municipalidad D. su zona empezó con la construcción del  mercado modelo. Gracias a ello Sabina y varios  comerciantes en la actualidad  ofrecen sus mercaderías cumpliendo con el reglamento D. las ordenanzas municipales. La venta D. verduras le proporciona buenas ganancias, y para esto cuenta con el apoyo incondicional D. sus hijos quienes están pendientes D. las exigencias D. sus consumidores. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar otro puesto  donD. pueda vender abarrotes y así espera continuar progresando.Es el quinto crédito con MFP, por  lo cual  se compromete en seguir pagando sus cuotas  durante las fechas establecidas, además está contenta  D.  trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que le otorga muchos beneficios.Sabina tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado  en la compra D. mercadería, con el propósito D. abastecer su puesto D. verduras, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabina is 50 years old, widowed, and has two young children, Freddy and Deysi.  They live together in their own home which is located in Quimbiri district.  Sabina's age is no obstacle to her working hard for the well-being of her children.  For this reason, she works every day in her business selling vegetables.  She has a stall in Quimbiri district market.  Sabina has been in this business for 25 years.  She used to sell her products as an itinerant street vendor but now she has a fixed sales location which she has had since the local municipality started building the model market.  This means that Sabrina and several other salespeople can currently offer their merchandise for sale whilst complying with the regulations and municipal ordinances.

Selling vegetables provides Sabina with good profits and she has the unconditional support of her children who are always looking out to meet her customers' demands.  In the future, Sabina plans to buy another stall where she can sell groceries and she thereby hopes to continue making progress.

This is Sabina's fifth loan with MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  She is happy to be working with her community bank since she receives a lot of benefits from it.  Sabina plans to invest her loan money in buying merchandise with the goal of stocking her vegetable stall.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Mam

texts.en: From Kompong Thom province, Mam N. is a 57-year-old married woman. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops and they are growing well almost every season. She has other financial support from her husband who is a classical Khmer musician at the mobile place. The couple has only one kid who works in the farming business also. Earlier she hired a few domestic laborers to harvest her rice crop. Now is the time for paying back to them. But her saving is not enough to pay them. So Mam N. is seeking a loan to pay the harvesting fee.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 18. Bernadette sells shoes from her store, where she works very hard. Her business is well organized. Bernadette has been in this business for five years. The hours of her business are from 8am to 7pm every day except Sunday. 

Bernadette has requested a loan in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With any profit, Bernadette will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Dame  Edoh   est  couturière  de  profession.  Elle a 30 ans  et  est  née  à  Baguida.  Elle  a  2 enfants à charge.   Elle  a  commencé  en  1996  et  s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé.  Elle   a son  atelier  en  face  du chef  du  quartier. Elle  demande  un  prêt  pour  acheter  une  machine  à coudre.
texts.en: Madam Edoh is a professional dressmaker.  She is 30 years old and was born in Baguida.  She supports two children.  She began in 1996 and re-stocks at the Grand Market of Lomé.  Her workshop is located in front of the neighborhood chief.  She is asking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Yoan

texts.en:
YoA. A., age 64, is elderly womA. who is living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. She stays at home to do some duties such as cooking delicious meal for her kids and managing the cash flow in the family. She is a widow and her husband died of senility many years ago and left her with six children. Four of them are employed in a variety of jobs. They always share their income with YoA. A. to support the family. 

Currently, her fence is broken and she wants to fix it, but she has a problem with financial factor. Therefore, YoA. A. has decided to take out a loA. from Kiva to build the new fence.

loans.use: To build a new fence.

loans.name: Rebeca Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” VILCANOTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rebeca Yolanda; la socia tiene 67 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. manualidades ella elabora lo que son manteles, bordados, pisos D. alfombra entre otros más, la socia trabaja desD. su casa y venD. sus trabajos D. forma independiente y trabaja a pedido vendiendo sus trabajos a sus amistades, la socia es profesora cesante y se dedico a este negocio que D. paso le sirve D. distracción la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar D. material para su negocio como hilos, telas, entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "VILCANOTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Rebeca Yolanda is 67 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her embroidery business in which she makes tablecloths, embroidered linens, rug accessories, etc.  She works from home and sells her products on an order basis to friends.  Since this member is a retired teacher her job keeps her occupied.  She is a cheerful person and determined to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting is to buy thread, fabric and other supplies.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric and other supplies

loans.name: Jose Eladio

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia La ciudad de Chiclayo capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Tiene junto a su esposa un puesto de venta de verduras. Todos los días ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de legumbres y tubérculos frescos los cuales adquiere em el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ayuda a la família.
El negocio siempre cuenta con clientes que prefieren su buen trato y amabilidad. 

Él desea adquirir más mercadería, por ello há creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles. 

José es uma persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old, married, and lives together with his family in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

José and his wife own a vegetable stall.  Every day they offer their customers a variety of fresh vegetables and tubers which they acquire in the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo.  This business is an important source of help for their family.  The business always has loyal customers who prefer to buy from them because of their good customer service and kindness.

José would like to acquire more merchandise.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

José is a hard-working man who is committed to his family.  His biggest wish is to continue growing as a businessman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks for his business and top-up cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Beishekan's Group

texts.en:
Beishekan A., 60, is the leader of this group. During one of the evening conversations at the family table, after a hard workday in the field, Beishekan and her husband, a tractor driver, were thinking about government regulations in the country’s agriculture that would certainly affect their family, too. It was the year 1996, a period when new independent countries, including Kyrgyzstan, were privatizing land, which used to be collective farms during the Soviet Union. 

Beishekan saw advantages like having an opportunity to manage the business on her own behalf without participation of the government. But there were also risks of facing thorough competition and lack of experience in supplying the products. For the following fifteen years Beishekan has been running a dairy business, while her husband is most of the time in fieldwork. Several head of livestock yield up to six liters of milk daily, which Beishekan delivers immediately to local consumers for 11 soms per liter. 

Beishekan is also a proud mother of nine kids, most of whom already live on their own. For her the most successful accomplishment in her entire lifetime is giving her kids broader opportunities to choose who they want to be. Since agriculture is a seasonal business, during slow times the only source of income is the dairy business. Beishekan used a start-up capital of 3 000 soms. Now her business generates 2 000 soms of monthly income. The purpose of the loan is the purchase of 1 ton of potato seeds. The fieldwork season has started, so Beishekan says the seeds have to be sown as soon as possible.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Jectone

texts.en:
Jectone is 37 years old and single.  He does welding to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eleven years.  Apart from welding, he operates a motorbike transport business.  

Jectone hopes to pursue a bachelors degree in mechanical engineering in the future.  He also dreams of expanding his business so that he may employ more people.  He has requested 25,000 Kes to buy cables, metal bars and bulbs.

loans.use: to buy cables, metal bars and bulbs.

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.en:
Nasimjon lives in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has a daughter. From the region of Spitamen, he transports fine and coarse gravel 1-2 times a day. After being in this business for four years, he has gained experience.  Before, he rented a truck but now he bought his own truck. The business is stable and generates considerable income for Nasimjon’s family, allowing improved living conditions. Currently Nasimjon wants to expand business. That’s why he needs a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase another truck. Nasimjon thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a truck

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 32 years old and married with four children: a daughter and three sons. Her husband is a bus driver and provides transport services to passengers. Two of her sons are rickshaw drivers while the 3rd one is a cobbler.  

Kosar is very supportive by nature. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients for profits. The income she earns helps her to manage other household expenses. She also performs her household duties very well along with her business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who is also a rickshaw driver. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw to be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers. He is 24 years of age and Kosar is hopeful that with the increased profits she will be able to save some money for his marriage in the near future. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Mu´ssha Group

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia es originaria de la localidad de Francisco Serrato ubicado en el estado de Michoacán,  una localidad rica en pinos y con una hermosa vista a sus bosques, ahí predomina el lenguaje y la vestimenta mazahua. Doña Aurelia comenta que ella es artesana se dedica a hacer accesorios para dama como pulseras de madera, aretes de madera, pulseras de hilo, vestidos, morrales de lana y bordados. Ella vende sus accesorios en el jardín de Zitacuaro Michoacán y también las ofrece en las calles y también elabora piezas de ocochal como canastitas, platos, canastas grandes, tortilleras etc. Ella dice que tiene 4 años con esta actividad y que le gusta mucho realizar estas artesanías, ya que son accesorios que sus antepasados usaban, dice que hace 10 años su mama le enseño a  hacer esas artesanías, Doña Aurelia es viuda. Comenta que el préstamo le beneficiara ya que podrá comprar otro tipo de accesorios para dama y tendrá mas surtido su puesto. La meta que tiene la señora Aurelia es comprar blusas para la temporada de calor para damas.
Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Venancio, Josefa, Elpidio y Maria Eduviges ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlos en la compra carpintería, abarrotes y elaboración de prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Aurelia is originally from the community of Francisco Serrato, located in the state of Michoacan. It is a locality that is rich in pine trees and it has a beautiful view of its forests. Here, the Mazahua language and clothing are predominant. Aurelia says that she is an artisan who produces ladies' accessories, such as wooden bracelets, wooden earrings, weaved bracelets, dresses, wool hand bags, and embroidery. she sells her accessories in the Zitacuaro Michoacan gardens and she also sells them along the streets. She also makes straw articles such as baskets, plates, large baskets, tortilla baskets, etc. She says that she has been in business for 4 years and she loves making these crafts. These are articles that her ancestors used. She says that 10 years ago her mother showed her how to make these crafts. Aurelia is a widow. She says that the loan will help her because she will be able to purchase other types of ladies' accessories to add more variety to her stand. Aurelia's goal is to purchase ladies' summer blouses. 

The other members of the group are Venancio, Josefa, Elpidio, and Maria Eduviges. They request a loan to invest in the purchase of wood, groceries, and to help in the crafting of traditional garments.

loans.use: to craft traditional garments for sale.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Los Emprendedores” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre estos se encuentran minimarket, almacenes, artesanía, venta de artículos de aseo entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Puente Alto, ciudad de Santiago. 
Paola quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo, de izquierda a derecha, usa una chasquilla hacia el lado y aros de perla. Ella se dedica a la cosmetología desde hace 6 años, los servicios que realiza son pedicura, manicure, maquillaje, depilación, peinados, entre otros. Sus clientes solicitan sus servicios y ella va directamente a sus domicilios. Para captar clientes ocupa diversas estrategias, entre ellas avisos en el periódico y promociona sus servicios conversando con novias que tienen charlas prenupciales en la parroquia. Su horario de atención es relativo, ya que depende de su clientela. 
Sus insumos los compra en un laboratorio y en una distribuidora que vende productos capilares, prefiere utilizar marcas reconocidas y de buena calidad. Con el credito comprará productos cosmetológicos. Sus metas en su negocio son expandir e innovar con nuevos productos y servicios, entre estos comprar una camilla que pueda llevar a domicilio, tratamientos de depilación con la última tecnología, incorporar además servicios de postura de uñas acrílicas y extensiones para el cabello. Junto con esto perfeccionarse en cada área. 
Paola vive junto a su hermana y sus dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, uno de sus sueños es obtener su casa propia, para esto solo le queda esperar el llamado, ya que postuló hace 2 años aproximadamente. 
Paola se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, principalmente por el planteamiento de los valores de la institución, ya que potencian en todo sentido a los emprendedores. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal, comenta que las socias son comprometidas, responsables e innovadoras con sus respectivos negocios. 
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneur Community Bank is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who perform different types of work. Among them is an owner of a minimart, an order of a small store, a maker of folk crafts, and a seller of cleaning supplies as well are other types of entrepreneurs. All of them live in the Puente Alto neighborhood in Santiago.
Paola is in the back of the photo, on the left. She has bangs that are pushed to the side and is wearing pearl earrings. She has been working as a cosmetologist for the past six years. She does manicures, pedicures, makeup, hair removal, haircuts and as well as other services. Her customers call her for her services and she performs them in the customer’s home. In order to obtain customers she uses different strategies. She buys advertising in the local paper and she speaks with women who are attending prenuptial classes at the local church. Her work hours are dependent on her customer requests. 
She buys the items she needs from a laboratory and from a distributor that sells beauty products. She prefers to use products that are well known and of good quality. With this loan she will buy cosmological products. Her business goals are to expand her business and provide innovative products and services. She would like to buy a beauty parlor chair for her house, buy the most up to date depilatory products, and provide acrylic nails and hair extensions. With these skills she can improve her business in every area. 
Paola lives with her sister and her two children, ages nine and seven. One of her dreams is to have her own house. She needs to wait a bit to achieve this goal. She thinks it will take about two years.
Paola is very happy and grateful for the support of “Fondo Esperanza” (The Hope Fund). She appreciates the values of the institution as they help entrepreneurs reach their full potential. She has a lot of respect for the group at the Community Bank. The members are committed, responsible and innovative with their businesses. 
Puente Alto is a community located in the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile. It was originally a small rural community, founded at the end of the nineteenth century. It has been growing since then. It now has one of the largest populations in Chile, over 600,000 inhabitants. It is the entryway to the Andes from the metropolitan region. It is also known as “Cajón de Maipo”, an area with trails, cable cars and rafting, among other activities. There are many hotels and restaurants.

loans.use: to buy cosmetology products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is twenty-seven years old, married and has one child aged two years old. She operates an shop in which she does printing and photocopying at Kahawa Sukari and she is served by the Thika Branch of SMEP. She has been in this business for one year now and says that the challenge she has are financial constraints. 

She is using her loan of Kes. 70,000 to purchase a photocopy machine to grow her business. She hopes that in future she will have the best shop in Kahawa Sukari. She describes herself as patient.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy home construction materials (stone, cement, sand, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roxanne is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Roxanne has a business buying and selling home products in the Philippines. Roxanne requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more home products to sell.

Roxanne has been in this business for 10 years. Roxanne would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last five years. He is 48 years old and married to Wanjiru. They have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Esmaelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Esmaelita has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es de la ciudad Concepción, tiene 26 años y  está cursando el primer año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería de la Universidad Politécnica y Artística del Paraguay.
Marcial recibe apoyo de su mamá que está en España, la cual le envía dinero desde allí para sus gastos de estudio y demás.
El dice que su sueño es poder terminar su carrera para que de esa forma pueda tener su propio ingreso y además de eso por medio de su trabajo pueda ayudar a las personas que necesitan de su servicio.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar. Agradece a la Fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan para seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcial is from the city of Concepción.  He is 26 years old and is studying to become a licensed nurse.  He is in his first year of a program at the Polytechnic and Artistic University of Paraguay.  Marcial receives support from his mother, who is in Spain.  She sends him money to help with his educational and other expenses.

He says that his dream is to be able to finish his course so that he can earn his own money.  Further, through his work he wants to be able to help people who need his services.  He is seeking this loan in order to meet his monthly schooling expenses and to buy books that he needs for his studies.  He wishes to thank Fundación Paraguaya  and Kiva for giving him the opportunity to continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy books and meet his monthly expenses.

loans.name: Celsa Silvia

texts.es:
Celsa Silvia tiene cincuenta años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de dieciocho, dieciséis y veintiún años en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.
Celsa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder cambiar y tener un buen rendimiento de los ingresos para el bienestar de la familia y negocio.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir produciendo y tener una mejor calidad de vida. En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar deporte y jugar gallos.
texts.en:
Celsa Silvia is 50 years old and is in a common-law marriage with two children.  She lives with her husband and children, ages 18, 16 and 21 in the Ventanas canton in the province of Ríos.  The communal bank San Nicolás is located in the San Nicolás precinct in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of this bank work in agriculture growing short-cycle crops such as corn. 

Celsa works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and beans.  She does her buying and selling in San Jacinto.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte [an herbicide], fertilizers and weedkiller to keep her crops in good condition so she can sell them for a good price.  The loan will help her greatly to change and have a good income for the well-being of her family and business.  The challenges she frequently faces are: competition and insects.  Her dream is to continue producing and to have a better quality of life.  In her free time, she likes cockfighting and to practice sports.

loans.use: buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte [an herbicide], fertilizers and weedkiller.

loans.name: Iris Maricela

texts.es: Iris Maricela de 24 años, una mujer trabajadora que con la ayuda de sus amigas que la inspiraron salió adelante. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva fue por cuenta propia que ella trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche. Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y la compra de mercadería como pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos y camisolas.Su deseo es agrandar su negocio, mejorar su vivienda y que su hija pueda ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Iris Maricela, age 24, is a hard-working woman.  With the help of her friends, who inspired her, she was successful.  

Her business is selling new clothes.  She works on her own from seven in the morning until nine at night.

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business.  She will buy merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and tops.  Her wish is to expand her business, to improve her home, and that her daughter is able to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, dresses, and tops.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy fuerte, amable y sobre todo responsable. Es madre soltera de dos hijos de 12 y 3 años. Juntos habitan en casa de su madre, en compñía de ella y de dos hermanas. EL trabajo de Haydee consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, teniendo como espacio de venta en la casa de su madre. Ahí ofrece los prodcutos que son de comsumo diario así como bebidas, tanto gaseosas y cervezas; del mismo modo tiene una copiadora, donde realiza tipeos de documentos e impresiones. Lleva por más de siete años, y gracias a la ayuda de su hermana y su madre puede salir adelante en su trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un espacio libre para estar a lado de sus menores hijos, quienes necesitan mucho de su cuidado, además le esta yendo bien en el negocio y espera mantenerlo pues en el futuro desea montar una ferretería. Este será el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, la primera vez le fue muy bien y esto le dio a confianza para seguir trabajando con el grupo al que pertenece, espera poder seguir trabajando juntos ya que le es de mucha ayuda los préstamos que le otorgan en los desembolsos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para su negocio, aparte desea comprar una congeladora para así mantener las bebidas frescas.
texts.en:
Haydee, 38, is a very strong, kind and, above all, responsible woman.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 12 and 3 years old.  They live together in her mother’s house with her and her two sisters.  Haydee’s work consists in grocery and staple items sales; she has her sales area set up in her mother’s house.  She stocks basic daily consumption items like beverages like soft-drinks and beer.  She also has a photocopier where she does document typing and photocopying.  She’s been working for over seven years and thanks to help from her sister and her mother she’s able to get ahead with her work.  

What she likes about it is that it leaves free time to be with her minor children who very much need her care.  She is doing well in the business and hopes to keep it that way because in the future she wants to open a hardware store.

This will be her second MFP loan.  The first time she did very well and this gave her the confidence to continue working with the group she belongs to.  She hopes to be able to continue working together because the loans obtained are very helpful.  She will use the requested amount to buy more merchandise for her store.  In addition, she’d like to buy a freezer to keep her beverages cool.

loans.use: to buy more staple items and a freezer.

loans.name: Karani

texts.en:
Karani is a 36-year-old father of three children. He is a poultry farmer in Mariakani, who has practiced this farming for the last four years. He has been doing great.

This marks his fifth borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to expand the chicken house and buy additional chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. His clients are majorly from Mombasa and Mariakani hotels.

With the anticipated profits he hopes to repay KADET loans and expand his business. He hopes to have his poultry farm be prosperous and sustainable.

loans.use: to expand the chicken house and buy additional chicks

loans.name: Saint Luc Group

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata Pascaline est la représentante du groupe SAINT LUC. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 1an 02 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est tisseuse depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy.ses clients sont les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter une balle de fils de tisse.

Mme économise ses bénéfices et met une partie dans les charges familiales. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande vendeuse de fils de tisse et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Pascaline is the leader of the SAINT LUC group. Married, she is the mother of 04 children. The oldest is 11 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. 2 go to school and she has 4 people in her care.

She has been a weaver for 4 years. She stocks up on supplies at the Pissy market. Her clients are men.

She wants to buy herself a bale of yarn to weave.

She saves her profit and puts a part of it toward the family expenses. She aims to become a great yarn saleswoman and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy herself a bale of yarn to weave

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es:
En el mercado de la ciudad de Granada donde la afluencia de compradores y vendedores es constante encontramos a doña Silvia, de 45 años, comerciante vende cosméticos y artículos de bisutería, casada, tiene 3 hijos. Inicio su negocio a los 25 años de edad con tan solo un canasto pequeño en el cual exhibía bisuterías antes no tenía un lugar fijo de vender pero al pasar el tiempo e ir ganando clientes fue que logro  obtener un pequeño tramo  donde vende cosméticos de uso popular esta ha sido su primer negocio. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra cosméticos tales como lápiz labial, estuche de sombra, delineadores, cremas, colonias, shampoo, jabones perfumados. Pues se acerca la temporada donde el número de compradores es mas frecuente y necesita mercadería para ofrecer. Poe lo pronto uno de sus  objetivos más cercanos es mejorar la estructura de su tramo para guardar su mercadería y no pagar alquiler de bodega.
texts.en:
In the Granada city market, where there is constant interaction between buyers and sellers, we find Doña Silvia. She's a 45-year-old merchant selling cosmetics and costume jewelry, and is married with 3 children. She started her business when she was 25-years-old with just a single little basket from which she sold costume jewelry. At that time, she didn't have a fixed location, but in time she went on gaining customers and managed to secure a small site where she sells popular cosmetics. This has been her first business. 

She's requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as lipliner, eye shadow, eyeliner, creams, cologne, shampoo, and scented soaps.As the season is coming up where the number of buyers is greatest, she needs more merchandise to offer. One of her most immediate objectives is to improve the structure she sells out of so she can keep her merchandise safe and not have to pay to rent storage space.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lipliner, eye shadow, eyeliner, creams, cologne, shampoo, and scented soaps.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and married. She has four children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Grace has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Grace aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La lucia o mejor conocida como Lucí es una señora trabajadora, amable, creativa se dedica a la venta de limones desde hace  tres años.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de semilla para la siembra de limones y también para la compra de desinfectantes para sus platanales.
Le da las gracias s fundación por apoyarla en lo que necesarita para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucía, or as she is better known, Lucí, is a hard-working, friendly, and creative woman. She has been selling lemons for three years. 

She asked for the loan in order to buy seeds for growing lemons, and also to buy disinfectants for her banana trees.

She thanks the Foundation for supporting her with what she needs to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy seeds for growing lemons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags for resale.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Gema has a shop where she sells fish such as sardines and trout. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fish to sell.

Gema has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
I have been making and seling tortillas for three years. Prior to this I worked for a houese cleaning company. I became ill and was asked to leave the house cleaning company at which point I began my tortilla selling business that has allowed me to support my family and take care of my health.

Loan Use: Buy corn lime and firewood

Me dedico a la elaboracion y ventas de tortillas, desde hace tres años. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de limpieza, enferme y me despidieron por lo que comence con mi negocio del que estoy contenta porque he obtenido ingresos para sostener a mi familia y tener para cuidar de mi salud.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, cal, leña.

loans.name: Syed Ibrahem Shah

texts.en:
S. Ibrahem S. has been working for 5 years in this business. He sells all types of groceries such as sugar, tea, rice, milk, ghee, flour, jam, etc.

S. Ibrahem S. was born in 1973, and lives in a household of 5  in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 34 years old and married, his wife works in her own tailoring shop. They are a very close couple who have worked hard ever since they married. With their income they have been able to own their house and make improvements to it.

They hope to get ahead with their businesses and to keep working.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, ghee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Evans  M.

texts.en:
Evans is married with four children all in primary school. He has not undertaken any training but hopes to join college soon.

He sells bicycle spare parts to service the large number of bicycles in this local environment. He started his business in 2000 in order to support his family.

With a loan from PEMCI, Evans intends to improve on his stock and be able to supply goods to other shopkeepers in the area. Through his business, he has been able to supply the local bodabodas (cyclists) with cheap spare parts.

loans.use: To boost his stock

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen T. O., 46 years old, lives in a peaceful village in Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. Her husband is three years older than she. They have 3 children aged 22, 24 and 26. The first child is at Music College and the second one is at Medical Equipment College. The third one graduated from Medical School some months ago. Supporting three children going to school, she and her husband have done plenty of work to earn money. Her husband has been working in the field and raising pigs and chickens. She has been running a general store with different kinds of goods such as souvenirs, mash and consumer goods for 7 years. Every month her profit is $31.3, which is not enough for her family. That is why she wants to borrow $325.00 to buy 1 ton of mash for her store. She hopes that this kind of product will sell like hot cakes and she will earn more money.

loans.use: She wants to buy 1 ton of mash for her store.

loans.name: Khudayar

texts.en:
Khudayar is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Salyan region in Yenikand village. He has 10 years of experience in farming.
Khudayar needs a loan of $725 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en: Alfa started his business with the loans from SMT on a very small scale and was selling few tins of lotions, creams, and artificial hair outside the market.  With subsequent loans and profit, Alfa rented a small shop for his business and has had good sales.  He will complete his loan installment next month and he would like to access more loans to increase his stock.  Alfa is 28 years old and married with a child.

loans.use: Increase his stock of cosmetic items for sale to produce additional profits.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng B., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To cover her family’s expenses, she works as a tailor at home, earning around $5/day in revenue.  Her husband, meanwhile, is self-employed as a construction foreman, earning about $2/day.  Mrs. Leng B. has requested a loan to purchase a new sewing machine to make her business more productive, faster and easier.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to make her business more productive, faster and easier.

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
Julia has been selling fruit for the past 22 years. She started her business with her own savings and a loan. She decided to start this business after finding herself unemployed. Her family runs a small stand in the market. This has been the only means they have found for earning a living. The financial assistance of CEPRODEL would allow Julia to develop her business by purchasing in bulk. She could thereby offer a better price for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Julia se dedica a la actividad de venta de frutas desde hace 22 años inicia su negocio con sus ahorros y un préstamo .

Decide el iniciar su propio negocio al quedarse sin empleo ademas de que su familia tiene sus pequeños negocios en el mercado por ser la unica forma que encuentran de ganarse su sustento diario.

Con los financiamientos de CEPRODEL le permiten el desarrollo de su negocio, compra de contado y ofrece a un mejor precio sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina Céspedes is from the city of General Aquino. She is a fifty five year old mother with four grown children.  For eight years she has owned a grocery store in a great location in the neighborhood and serves a large number of clientèle.  With a great reputation and business, Justina feels that it is time to take the next step in increasing her business. 

With a loan, Justina will buy a greater amount of goods to sell in her store, increase her earnings, and have a better quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Martin Kang

texts.en:
Martin is married and a father of five children, all of whom are in school. His greatest wish is to see all his children become responsible citizens in future. Unable to raise adequate business capital, he decided to join GHAPE in 2004 and received his first loan of $40 which he used for rearing pigs.

Given a loan of $800, he plans to rear pigs on a larger scale and sell food items like corn and palm oil. He is confident his business will succeed as these items are basic commodities and therefore have a large market.

He plans to repay the loan in 18 months.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, feed, and corn

loans.name: Olga Romelia

texts.es:
Olga O. is married and is the mother of a family with two teenagers, who are 15- and 13-years-old.
