Three years ago, she had some health problems, and this is when she began to use a line of natural products that helped her recover her health. This is what motivated her to sell these products. The income was also attractive. She started selling among friends, neighbors, and family members, using her experience with these products as an example. Today she sells significant quantities, and she moves the products in her car.

Now she needs a credt of $475, which she is willing to pay back in 6 months, to have maintenance done on her car, which is one of her work tools. She goes to nearby towns to sell her products. With your support, Olga will be able to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Olga O. es casada y madre de familia de 2 adolescentes de 15 y 13 años, hace 3 años tuvo algunos problemas de salud, fue cuando empezó a consumir una línea de productos naturistas, que le ayudaron a recuperar la salud, lo que le la motivo a dedicarse a la venta de estos, además los ingresos eran atractivos, inicio vendiendo entre amigos, vecinos y familiares utilizando como ejemplo su experiencia con estos productos, hoy en día vende en cantidades importantes, y moviliza los productos en su automóvil.

Ahora necesita un crédito de US $475 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para darle mantenimiento mayor a su auto, que es una de sus herramientas de trabajo, ya que pretende salir a vender a los pueblos cercanos a su comunidad. Con tu apoyo Olga podrá hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To invest in her tool for work

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga sells spare parts for motorbikes and bicycles, and some building materials. The Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) loan program made it possible for him to diversify the business. Being one of the few spare parts shops in Kabala, the demand for the items is high and many small village retailers buy from him.

Kanga is no requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 ($1200) to increase his stock to supply his customers and increase his profit. Kanga is serving a very important customer need in his community. He requires additional capital so that he can continue to meet the needs of all his customers on an ongoing basis.

loans.use: To increase his stock of spare parts

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.es:
This borrower's group has 15 members who are hard-working women from the San Miguel district in the city of Caacupé. The group is now in the 4th cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) program and to date they have an average line of credit of 746.000 gs per member.

The group was created because Amelia learned about the project through an ad in the local media and came to our office where she was given all of the information on the Mujeres Emprendedoras group at Fundación Paraguaya.

Amelia was very quickly able to assemble 15 women, which is the minimum number of members required to form a group, and after going through the training sessions she established this group of working women who have hopes to progress. Today it is obvious that the women are very happy to be a part of her group and that the group's members all come from the same district.

The group's main goal is to capitalize on their internal savings as soon as possible through their businesses that provide income such as making food, running raffles and other businesses. This will enable them to have extra money to pay their dues in case anything sudden happens that will prevent them from paying.

They will invest the loans that they receive in the purchase of products to make chipas (local food that is very commonly eaten in Paraguay) such as starch, oil, cheese and also to purchase, herbs, sugar, soft drinks and another group of them who sell clothing need the loans to purchase used clothing wholesale because this enables them to get lower prices.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Caacupé, el grupo se encuentra actualmente en el 4to. Ciclo del programa Mujeres Emprendedoras, y a la fecha todas manejan una línea de crédito promedio de gs. 746.000 por cada integrante.

El comité fue formado gracias a que la señora Amelia tuvo conocimiento del proyecto a través de una publicidad en uno de los medios locales y se acerco a la oficina, dónde recibió toda la información acerca del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedaras de la Fundación Paraguaya.

En poco tiempo la señora Amelia llego a juntar a las 15 señoras, que es el mínimo de integrantes requerido para formar el comité; así es como luego de las reuniones de capacitación se formaliza este grupo de hermosas señoras trabajadoras y deseosas de progresar. Hoy día manifiestan que están muy contentas de ser parte de su grupo además de que el mismo está formado por vecinas del mismo barrio.

El principal objetivo de este grupo es la de capitalizar en la brevedad posible sus ahorros interno a través de actividades que genere ganancias como ser feria de comida, rifas (sorteos) entre otras actividades, esto les permitirá tener un extra para pagar las cuotas en caso de surgir algún imprevisto y que imposibilite pagar la cuota.

Los préstamos que recibieran desean invertirlo en la compra de productos para la elaboración de chipas (comida típica muy consumida en Paraguay) como ser almidón, aceite, queso, como así también para la compra de yerba, azúcar, gaseosas, otro grupo de señora que se dedican a la venta de ropa necesitan el crédito para la compra de ropas usadas en forma mayorista ya que esto les permite obtener un precio mas bajo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as sugar, herbs, starch, vegetable oil, cheese, milk, cookies, meet, soft drinks, beers, all types of drinks and also  to purchase clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Refika

texts.en: Refika is a 26 year old woman, living in a small village near the town of Ilijas.  She is married with 2 children, and her oldest daughter will be starting school next year. Her husband works, and she also helps support her family through their farming business.  Refika currently raises cows, and sells their milk to local dairies and people in her village. This is her second loan with Zene za Zene, and she is requesting $750 to buy another cow.  Refika thinks this purchase will help improve her overall sales, and will be a good way to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Somialo

texts.fr:
Currently married, Mrs. Somialo T. was born on 18 January 1971 in Notsè in the Prefecture of Haho, 100 km from the city of Lomé. Her husband being away, she has to take care of her needs by herself. She is a retailer of pagne cloth (a highly valued printed cloth) in the Kégué area. Sometimes she travels from place to place to sell her goods, and covers several kilometres a day. She has benefited from one previous loan, which she repaid without incident.

This second loan she is asking for will allow her to buy 27 rolls of Hitarget-type pagne cloth and 20 rolls of WAX-type pagne cloth in order to replenish her stock and sell better.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Mariée, madame T. Somialo est née le 18 janvier 1975 est née à Notsè dans la préfecture de Haho à 100Km de la ville de Lomé. Son mari étant en voyage, elle assure elle-même ses besoins. Elle est revendeuse de pagne dans le quartier Kégué. Parfois elle vend de quartier en quartier et parcourt plusieurs kilomètres par jour. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.

Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 27 pièces de pagne de type Hitarget et 20 pièces de pagne de type WAX afin de refaire son stock et de mieux vendre.

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth (brightly printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el presente comité fue la Señora Etelvina P. quien se acercó a la oficina y se informó sobre el programa, luego invitó y organizó a sus vecinas para formar un comité.

La señora Etelvina P. quien se dedica a la venta de remedio refrescante e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora Leonarda C., es modista pero se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles

. La señora Mirtha A., es artesana e invertirá el dinero en la compra de karanday que son los materiales para su trabajo.

La señora Nazaria A., es artesana e invertirá el dinero en la compra de karanday que son los elementos de trabajo.

La señora Ramona L., es vendedora de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercaderias( prendas en general).

La señora Victoria P., se dedica a la venta de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra mercaderías ( prendas en general)

La señora Virginia B. se dedica a la venta de remedio e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías al por mayor

. La señora Gladys C., se dedica a la venta de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería (prendas para adultos)

La señora Maria R., se dedica a la venta de ropas e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas para niños y adultos.

La señora Julia R. se dedica a venta de ropas y artículos de mercería e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas en general, espejos, peines, pinza para cabello, etc.

La señorita Maria I., es vendedora de remedio refrescante e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora Alicia M., es costurera e invertirá el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo (telas, hilos, agujas etc.)

La señora Ysidora, es vendedora de ropa e invertirá el dinero en la compra de prendas en general.

La señora Sonia A., se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.

La señora María S.. se dedica en la venta de comestible, e invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles

. La señora Eulogia M., se dedica a la venta de de remedio refrescante e invertirá el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderías.

La señora María M. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invertirá el dinero a la compra insumo para la elaboración de los comestibles.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Etelvina P., who stopped by the loan office and was informed about the program and then invited and organized her neighbors to form a group.

Ms. P. makes a living by selling refreshments and will invest the money in the purchase of these products.

Leonarda C. is a dressmaker but makes a living selling meals and will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes.

Mirtha A. is an artisan and will invest in the purchase of twine, which she uses to make her crafts.

Nazaria Alamda also is an artisan and will purchase twine.

Ramona L. sales clothing and will invest in the purchase of general attire.

Victoria P. also sells clothes and will purchase general attire as well.

Virginia B. sells over the counter medicines and will invest in the purchase of these items at wholesale.

Gladys Caballeo makes a living selling clothes and will purchase adult attire.

Maria R. sells clothing and will use the money to purchase clothing for children and adults.

Julia R. sells clothing and haberdashery and will invest in the purchase of general clothing, mirrors, combs, hairpins, etc.

Maria I. sells refreshments and will use the loan to buy these products.

Alicia M. is a seamstress and will invest in the purchase of fabrics, threads, needles, etc.

Ysidora R. sells clothing and will use the loan to purchase general attire.

Sonia A. makes a living selling meals and will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes.

María S. also sells meals and will invest in ingredients.

Eulogia M. sells refreshments and will use the loan to purchase these products.

María M. makes a living selling meals and will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her dishes.

María S. also sells meals and will invest in ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products related to their businesses

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco C. está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit pero le esta haciendo falta una diferencia de monto para el enganche.

El nos comento que desea empezar un patrimonio para su familia, ya que tiene barios años pagando renta de casa y pues prefiere pagar su propia vivienda..

Sr. Francisco trabaja en una empresa como ejecutivo de cobranza esté es su ingreso familiar. Al paso de los años que ha estado trabajando el a horrado por medio de Infonavit para una vivienda pero le está haciendo falta una diferencia de $575.00 dlls. Para que le puedan entregar su casa es por eso que el nos solicita un préstamo para pagarle a Infonavit.
texts.en:
Francisco C. is in the process of purchasing a home through Infonavit but he is missing a part of the down payment.

He was saying that he wishes to start a legacy for his family. After having paid rent for so many years he would prefer to have his own house.

Fracisco works in a company as a financial executive and this is the family income. Through the passing years that he has worked he has been able to save through Infonavit for a home but he is still missing $575 US. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay this last amount to Infonavit so that they will finally give him his house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the remaining portion of the down payment for a house.

loans.name: Stelastina

texts.en:
Stelastina A. is 35 years old. She is a wife and mother of four kids. Currently, all her kids are attending school. 

Her food business is the source of her livelihood.  She has been selling yams for seven years to support her family. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with direct supplies. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wishes to buy yams to serve to her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Stelastina is a member of a community group called Ntoboaseâ (meaning patience) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy yams and maize.

loans.name: Marica

texts.en:
Marica was born in 1954 and she lives in a suburb of Bijeljina in Bosnia. She lives with her husband who grows cabbage and sugarcane in the local market.  

Marica takes care of 3 cows and sells the milk to a local milk station. She also has a field in which she grows vegetables, such as corn and potatoes. Next summer, Marica plans to purchase additional cows, and she needs to grow extra corn in preparation for their arrival. 

 She requests a loan for 1,000KM from Women for Women International to buy minerals for her land, on which she plans to start growing the new crops.

loans.use: To buy minerals for farming

loans.name: Adeline

texts.fr: Née le 20 octobre 1978 à Cotonou (Aîdjèdo), D. Adeline résidant dans le 5earrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo précisément à Tokpota1,   est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants dont trois (03) sont scolarisés. Adeline est coiffeuse et dispose d’un atelier dans lequel elle mène son activité ; une activité qu’elle mène passionnément pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, elle mène comme activité secondaire la vente de jus de bissap. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité elle ne dispose pas assez de fonds pour mener à bien cette  activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 180.000frcs CFA pour l’achat d’un séchoir et de produits de coiffure afin de mieux satisfaire le besoin de la clientèle et se faire assez de revenus pour faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges et d’autre part de se constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
Born on October 20, 1978 in Cotonou (Aîdjèdo), Adeline D. lives in the 5th district of the town of Porto-Novo, more precisely in Tokpota 1. She is married and the mother of 4 children of whom 3 are enrolled in school.

Adeline is a hairdresser and has a salon where she works--work she undertakes passionately so as to help her husband support the family. To diversify her revenue sources, she also sells "bissap" (hibiscus flower) juice. Despite the passion she feels about her work, she does not have enough capital to do really well and bring in enough to easily cover her expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 180,000 F CFA to purchase a dryer and and hairdressing products so as to better satisfy the needs of her clientele while making enough to deal with her various expenses and, on the other hand, be able to put some savings aside.

GF Missimide is a women's group with 14 members from the village of Dekangbo in the district of Gbeko, an enclave of the township of Dangbo. Its members sell cereals and are farmers. The sack of 100 kg of maize in their zone costs 20,000 F CFA, one of flour costs 15,000 F CFA. The members of this group need a loan in the amount of 800,000 F CFA so that they can buy as inventory 20 sacks of maize, 20 sacks of flour and the rest will be for purchasing cooking salt in the town--something they also sell.

This is an entrepreneurs' group where the loan is managed jointly by the members. The following women belong to this group: Julie HOUSSA, Pierrette HOUNLIHO, Martine SAGBO, Pierrette ADANTONOU, Brigitte HOUESSANOU, Véronique ZOSSOU, Félicienne ZOUNON, Valentine ZANNOU, Julienne AGBODJETE, Clémentine KOUTONGNON, Agathe KOKODJI, Henriette HOUNSA, Cécile SONOU, B. M. Anastasie AGOSSOU.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing working materials for her salon

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny T. is the president of a village bank. The bank consists of sixteen people who live in Chumrov Village in Takeo Province. Each of the members will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Ny T. is requesting a loan to buy silk to weave. Her business is going well. Her husband, Mr. Seing Vin, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Ny T. is 42 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children attend the local school. The other two are ages six months and three years old.

loans.use: To buy silk to weave for her customers.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm C. is 26 years old and married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She stays at home doing housework and cooks for her family members. Her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman, earning around $7 per day. She and her husband have one young child. Morm C. is currently requesting a loan to purchase tools for her husband business.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El   Señor Eusebio I. Candia es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Tui, que se encuentra a 7 Km. de la ciudad de San Estanislao,  tiene casa propia,  con 53 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Julia Lezcano con 48 años de edad,Tienen 3 Hijos, todos  mayores de edad trabajan independientes.

Posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales, Ademas se dedica en la agricultura y ganaderia, posee 7 has. Finca con produccion bien diversificados, ganados vacunos y otros.

El cliente sueña en construir  un salon de material para su negocio y asi obtener mejores servicios e ingresos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eusebio I. Candia is from San Estanislao in the Ycua Tui neighborhood, located 7 km from San Estanislao. He is a 53 year-old homeowner. He is married to Julia Lezcano, who is 48 years of age. They have three adult children, all who work and are independent. He runs a pantry from his home. He has a well-established clientele, good income, and good personal and business references. He is also in agriculture and ranching. He owns 7 hectares of land. He counts with a diversified production, cattle and others. His dream is to build a storage room for his business to obtain an increase in revenue and to provide better services for his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital for purchase of goods: sugar, rice, flour, herbs, noodles

loans.name: Benturo

texts.es:
El socio Buenaventura; es natural del distrito de saylla, este distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco en carro.

El socio Buenaventura, tiene 73 años de edad, él es casado y el ayuda a su esposa con su restaurante de chicharronería, mientras su esposa cocina y sirve los platos, el socio le ayuda con la atención de las mesas, él hace la función de mesero y se encarga personalmente de atender al público en el restaurante; El invertirá el dinero como capital de trabajo, el necesita comprar insumos para el restaurante.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado para así él poder seguir apoyando a su amada esposa, del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is a native of Saylla, a district located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cusco. He is 73 years old, married and helps his with with their restaurant specializing in fried pork rinds. While his wife cooks and serves the meals, Benturo helps her set up the tables and functions as a waiter. He is personally in charge of tending to customers in the restaurant. He will use the money as working capital and purchase ingredients for the restaurant. He is grateful and values the loan because it allows him to continue supporting his beloved wife. In the same sense, he promises to repay the loan in total in the agreed upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es: Juana del Socorro S. D. S. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador, es una mujer casada que con su negocio aporta económicamente a su familia. Juana posee una tienda dentro D. su casa, que es la preferida por vecinos en la zona ya que la Sra. es muy amable con sus clientes, es por ello el éxito  su negocio.  Juana anteriormente ya ha obtenido créditos, donD. sus pagos han sido muy puntuales, pero hoy Juana quiere un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo D. otros productos que sus fieles clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro S. D. S. lives in Sayopango, a district in San Salvador. She is a married woman and she supports her family with the help of her business. Juana runs a store from her house, and it is the favored store among her neighbours because she is very kind to them, and it is why her business is such a success. Juana has had loans previously and her payments have been very punctual. But Juana requires a new loan to invest in her business, to restock with other products that her loyal clients have asked of her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock her store.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is a rice grower. She is 39 years old and a mother of three kids. She ended up farming because she was not happy about her previous job. Her husband, Deny A., manages their small rice field. They have been together for 18 years already.

Juvy wants to grow her business. She would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her rice farm. Fertilizers will improve the soil condition of her land. It will lead to increased yield for her and her family.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers to sustain and grow more of their livelihood. CEVI does not just provides loans to all its clients. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Norkuzi

texts.ru: Эшмуротов Норкузи- мужчина 55 лет. Отец 7-х детей. Норкузи имеет 15-летный стаж в сфере скотоводства. На полученный займ хочет купить корм для скота и 1 среднего бычка. Норкузи работает водителем грузовика в фермерском хозяйстве. Дети ухаживают за домашним скотом. У Норкузи есть большой сад в котором он трудится вместе со своей семьей собранные фрукты он продаёт соседних городах Табашара и Худжанда.
texts.en:
Norkuzi E. is a 55 year old man. He is the father of 7 children. Norkuzi has 15 years of experience in raising livestock. He would like to use his loan to purchase feed for the livestock and 1 medium bull. Norkuzi works as a truck driver on a farm. His children take care of the livestock. Norkuzi has a large orchard where he works together with his family. He sells the collected fruits in the neighboring cities, Tabashara and Khujand.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise livestock

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. runs a cold store in her community. She sells fresh fish and all kinds of meat – beef, turkey, chicken, etc. She buys her products from big cold stores in Kumasi. 
She is 46 years old, married and has four children – two daughters and two sons. Some of the children are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the very busy commercial town of Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. 
She has been in business for over two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Abena is hoping to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children through school to tertiary levels.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia
texts.en: Lucia

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Emilio Gutiérrez R. tiene 50 años, es soltero. Vive con su madre en Cochabamba en un barrio periurbano. Cuida de su madre ya que es el único hijo.  Trabaja con el ganado lechero desde hace 20 años y produce queso el cual vende en un mercado de la zona. 

También se dedica al comercio de ganado, los días martes y sábado de cada semana para poder generar un poco más de ingresos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero para poder producir más queso e incrementar sus ingresos. 

En un futuro desea sacar otro préstamo para poder incrementar más su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Emilio Guitiérrez R. is 50 years old and is single. He lives with his mother in Cochabamba in a neighborhood on the edges of town. He takes care of his mother because he is her only child. He has worked with dairy cattle for 20 years and produces cheese, which he sells at a local market. He also buys and sells cattle on Tuesdays and Saturdays each week in order to generate a little extra income. With the loan he will buy one dairy cow so that he can produce more cheese and increase his earnings. In the future, he would like to take out another loan so he can increase his cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en: Yeth Y. is a 38-year-old man and ox-trader. He normally goes to buy cows at a reasonable price from people who live in the rural area at the frontier of Phnom Penh. He also fattens cows from his home and will sell them out to farmers to gain income. Another source of daily income for his family comes from his wife, who works in a garment factory. Yeth Y. was married years ago and is blessed with three school-aged children. Yeth Y. will be using the loan to improve his oxen trade and buy a plot of land, and will rent the land out to farmers to gain extra profit.

loans.use: To improve his oxen trade and buy a plot of land

loans.name: Juana Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “30 D. Agosto”, en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos, ella tiene estudios D. educación secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años, su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc. Para aumentar el stock en su tienda.

Su deseo es ampliar su tienda para poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros D. Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank "30 D. Agosto" in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 50 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children. She completed her secondary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist organization) for 6 years. Her business is a grocery store; her first loan was 500 PEN, which she used to buy groceries.

Now she needs an additional loan, and has requested 800 PEN, which she will use to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, preserves, etc. in order to increase the stock in her store.

Her wish is to expand her store to be able to help her children become professionals.

She likes the savings and the meetings at her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda and her family reside in the village of Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jose and they are blessed with two children. They want their children to become successful someday.  Despite the economic crisis, they work hard to earn a living to be able to support the needs of their children.  

Mrs. B. operates a small piggery, manages a general store and sells commercial rice and feed. She wants to improve her business and is now asking for additional capital to sustain her businesses. She is hoping for a loan of PHP 5,000 that she will use for business maintenance.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Yelba Rosa

texts.es: La señora Yelba Rosa M. de 48 años de edad, casada, sus hijos son mayores de edad,  reside en el barrio la Luz en la capital de Managua, su negocio es la venta de nacatamales, sopas, también es dueña de una unidad de Taxi el cual se ayuda. Con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa y poder estar en las condiciones adecuada en su  vivienda con su familia, cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio, el trabaja de contador en una empresa privada, pues junto desean mejorar su casa y poder gozar de los beneficios de su trabajo. Desde horas tempranas se levanta para preparar la masa y verduras que lleva la preparación de los ricos nacatamales. Que son consumidos por muchos Nicaragüense, por su sabor y por su valor que es accesible. Da las gracias a la institución por dar  la oportunidad de poder invertir, como hacer las mejoras a su vivienda que es un  logro para cada ciudadano Nicaragüenses poder realizar los anhelos de un nivel de vida sastifecho para la familia. Ya que por condiciones diferentes muchos no lo gramos poder tener nuestra propia vivienda y es de mucha preocupación. Y  a través de estos financiamientos podemos salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yelba Rosa M. is 48 years old, married, and has grown children. She lives in the La Luz neighborhood of Managua and sells naca-tamales and soups for a living. She is also the owner of a Taxi unit, which helps. She plans to buy building materials with this loan so she can fix her roof so her home is in good condition for family. Her husband originally gave her money to start her business. He is an accountant with a private company. They would both like to improve their home and be able to enjoy the benefits of work. She gets up early in the morning to make the dough and vegetables for her delicious tamales. She has many customers since they are so tasty and affordable. She is grateful to this institution for giving her the opportunity to invest and make some home improvements. These opportunities are beneficial for all Nicaraguan citizens so they can fulfill their desires for their families in a satisfactory way. For various reasons many people are unable to have their own home and this causes a lot of anxiety. It this through these loans that we can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for home improvement

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Carmenza B. ha iniciado su pequeño negocio de venta de productos ferreteros pero no presa las condiciones necesarias y además requiere surtir el negocio para ofertar tales productos.

Ella muy sabiamente ha solicitado un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de los productos ferreteros y de esta manera ofertarlos y así ir ampliando poco a poco su negocio hasta convertirse en una excelente comerciante.

loans.use: Compra de productos ferreteros

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes C. is 37 years old and married to a soldier. She has seven school-aged children. Agnes is currently in the business of selling sugar and charcoal, and is requesting a loan to improve her stock. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To improve her stock of charcoal and sugar

loans.name: Suhee

texts.en:
E. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His two children both attend a local secondary school and E. operates a grocery business out of a stall at a local market.

He began his business in 2006 after selling his iron business, which was in operation for four years. With his grocery business profit, E. was able to build his family a home in order to make them more comfortable. He would like to one day own his own grocery store where he can sell a larger variety of goods that will attract many more customers.

E. is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan so that he can purchase a larger variety of products to sell at his grocery stall.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell at his grocery stall

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M., for the second time, is requesting a loan through ASHI, after paying her previous one funded by Kiva. This is because she wants her variety store business to grow, which it can do if she sells a wider variety of goods and beverages for the convenience of people in the community. She also hopes that along with satisfying her customers she will also be satisfying her family through her proceeds, by supporting their basic needs, and especially for the education of her grandchildren.

Most of Norma’s children have their own families now. Only her husband and her 31-year-old daughter are still living with her in their house. Being poor like her, she has no other options to find financial assistance besides from ASHI, because most of the money lenders are asking higher interest rates. The loan she is requesting is her only means to achieve all of her aspirations, both for the business and for her family.

loans.use: To purchase various beverages which will be sold in her store.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en: The committee "Oñondivepa" is made up of women who live in the same neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. All committee members have independent businesses, mostly in retail and sales. They are a very strong and organized group. All committee members are mothers, who share the goal of improving their quality of life and providing for their families. They hope to develop their businesses in a sustainable way, and will use their loans wisely to continue to grow their enterprises.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sainsanaa

texts.en:
Sainsanaa D. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two small children in Zavhan province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His son is four years old and his daughter is just one month old. Sainsanaa cuts down trees and sells them as wood during the warmer seasons of spring, summer and fall. In winter, he makes various bakery goods and bread for locals. He is a talented baker and uses his talent for his seasonal business.

During colder seasons, the bakery business is easier and more profitable due to various traditional celebrations where good bakery goods are important. Sainsanaa dreams of building his own home on land that he would own. In order to make his dream come true, he works hard in his various businesses. He requests a loan to purchase necessary ingredients for his winter bakery business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of the interest paid by borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 35 years old and married with 2 children. He sells motor parts at retail prices to his customers in the market in Ibadan, Oyo State. He has been in this business for 7 years. He hopes to expand his business. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers.

Festus hopes for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more motor parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Thong K., 52, was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She has four children, two of whom are married and the other two are single. All of the children are employed at different jobs. To earn a living, Thong K. cultivates rice and some vegetable crops, which she will sell to buyers when they are matured. A problem she currently faces is that she doesn’t have enough supplies to perform her business. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, crop seeds, and other essential accessories for her crop growing activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, crop seeds, and other essential accessories.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy trabaja como empleado de la Empresa Embotelladora Mendocina, su esposa es comerciante de cosméticos; así complementan sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia. Tienen dos hijos con las edades de 10 y 12 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Villa Bolivar “D” de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la refacción de su vivienda para poder vivir mejor. Necesita comprar estuco, cemento y arena.
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Willy works as an employee of the Mendocina Bottling Company; his wife sells cosmetics. Their combined income helps to cover their family expenses. They have two children who are 10 and 12 years old. Their home is located in the Villa Bolivar "D" area in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to refurbish their home to provide thjem a better place to live. They need to buy stucco, cement, and sand. This is their second loan through Impro; their punctual payments of their last loan qualified them to receive a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stucco, cement, sand to refurbish their home

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga T. is 55 and married with 5 children (ages 7 - 26).  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Aiga has 2 years of experience in this business.  Aiga needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.  Aiga T. is a strong, motivated client and wishes to have not only the ice cake busines but also a back up business to assist her with planting and elei as well.

In 2009, Aiga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Aiga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Aiga T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 33 years old and widowed with two children, ages 8 and 10, both of whom are in school. She runs a mixed farm near Kitale, Kenya, where she has been farming for over two years. She sells a variety of products to generate her income, including milk, vegetables, sugar cane and tomatoes. Since her husband passed on recently, Emily also receives small pension amount from his past employer which supplements her income.

Emily recently completed a Kes 20,000 loan with Juhudi Kilimo, and has now requested this loan for Kes. 20,000 to purchase two goats and to improve her stock of poultry. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her attain financial independence. She currently relies on relatives at times for financial support, and she hopes that will no longer be necessary once she is able to improve her standard of living. She also wants to be in position where she can afford to educate both of her children.

In the future, Emily has numerous goals for the growth of her farm. She wants to acquire additional dairy animals and over 200 poultry layers. She also hopes to expand and plant up to five acres of maize.

loans.use: To purchase two goats and add to poultry stock

loans.name: Jayasekara Kankanam

texts.en:
Jayasekara is a 52-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Yakabadda, Sri Lanka.

Jayasekara has her own tailoring business that her husband helps her with. She started this business seven years ago, so she has lots of experience as a tailor. Additionally, she considers herself to be hard-working which has helped the business be successful.

Jayasekara is asking for a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help expand her business. She hopes to continue growing the business and improving her family life with increased profits.

Thank you for considering supporting this loan!

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her business

loans.name: Kanthi

texts.en:
Kanthi is a 29-year-old married woman, living with her husband and two year old child. She is an educated woman.

Kanthi has a vegetable plot in which her husband provides support. She has a lot of experience in this field as she and her husband started the business three years ago. She is a hardworking woman and very happy about her present family situation.

Kanthi and her husband started the business as a very small one, but now it has grown considerably. Her plot has lots of vegetables such as leafy greens, pumpkins, and mushrooms. She can handle the responsibility of managing a family while working very well.

Kanthi is seeking a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her cultivation. She appreciates BRAC Sri Lanka providing her a loan to help her expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her vegetable plot

loans.name: Eterna Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Eterna Primavera inicia su segundo ciclo con 13 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, bebidas, cosméticos, comidas, cereales y servicios D. albañil.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Frida que es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Frida tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Frida invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideos. Los sueños D. Frida son ampliar su negocio y que su hijo sea profesional.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 7,650 soles.
texts.en:
The Eternal Spring Community Bank begins its second cycle with 13 members. The members have different businesses such as selling groceries, beverages, cosmetics, foods, cereals and construction services. An example of one of the members, Ms. Frida who is 34, unmarried, and has a son, she has a store in her home where she sells groceries and soft drinks everyday. Frida will invest her loan to buy sugar, rice, noodles. Frida's dreams are to expand their business and that her son becomes a professional. The members need different loan amounts, 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles for a total of 7,650 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles.

loans.name: Maïssata

texts.fr:
Maïssata S. est une veuve âgée de 56 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui réside chez son grand frère à Médine-Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
    Maïssata, après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée pendant 2 ans à la fabrication de savons traditionnels (savons noirs)  qu’elle a apprise auprès d’une amie. Elle mène son activité  à  son domicile où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an.
Dans l’objectif de mieux relancer son activité pour pouvoir répondre aux attentes de sa  clientèle, elle sollicite ainsi un deuxième prêt.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce deuxième prêt , 5 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pattes noires), 2 futs d’huile de coton, 5 sacs de soude caustique, 1 paquet de parfum et 4 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. 
Elle achète ses matières premières sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso).
 Après fabrication des savons, elles les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes.
   Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Maïssata S., aged 56, is a widow and the mother of six children who resides at her grandfather's place in Médine-Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having worked in many businesses without success, she was introduced two years ago to making traditional soaps (black soap), which she learned how to make from a friend. Working out of her home, she is much in demand for the quality of her products. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Maïssata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over a year ago. With the goal of reinvigorating business further, in order to respond to customer expectations, she is therefore requesting a second loan. She plans on using this second loan to buy five barrels of waste cotton oil (black paste), two drums of cotton oil, five sacks of caustic soda, a packet of perfume, and four cart loads of firewood. She purchases her ingredients locally and in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso). After making the soaps, she sells them retail to a customer base composed generally of women. With this loan, Maïssata envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital and to help cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials for making soap

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es:
Nelly N. es integrante D. L. alcancía comunal "Emprendedoras D. Casa Huerta", tiene 48 años y es casada con el padre D. sus 4 hijos.
ElL.  trabajaba en un taller D. costura realizando estampados D. polos ubicado cerca D. su  domicilio,  al transcurrir el tiempo Nelly decidió trabajar en gamarra (Centro Comercial  muy transcurrido en el  sector D. lima), en L. actualidad realiza  l operación D. costura estampados y remalle D. ropa.
Este actual préstamo lo invertirá en L. compra D. materiales para hacer  colchas y cubre cama para su venta.
Uno D. sus anhelos es realizar L. compra D. una maquina D. coser y lo mas importante apoyar a sus hijos en todo
texts.en:
Nelly N. is a member of the village bank Emprendedoras D. Casa Huerta. She is 48 years old, married, with 4 children. She works in a sewing shop near her home where she does screen printing on shirts. As time went by, Nelly decided to work in Gamarra (a popular commercial center in eastern Lima), and now has a business selling screen-printed clothing and tailoring. She will use this loan to buy materials to make bedspreads and bedcovers to sell. One of her desires is to buy a sewing machine. Most important to her is helping her children in everything.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make bedcovers and bedspreads

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Vicentina;   ella tiene 52 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos los dos últimos hijos tienen 23 y 20 años, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de verduras en el mercado vino canchón de San Sebastían, ella tiene el stnad nº 52. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor de los proveedores.  

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Esmeralda Communal Bank. She lives in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Vicenta is 52 years old, married, and has six children. Her two youngest children are 23 and 20 years old. She divides her time between her household activities and selling vegetables at the Vino Canchón Market in San Sebastían. She has vending stall No. 52. Vicenta is requesting a loan to buy vegetables in bulk from her suppliers.

She values and has endless appreciation for the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Las Responsables Y Intelectuales Group

texts.en:
Melida is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables y Intelectuales (The Responsible and Intellectual Ones), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her common-law husband and their three children.

Melida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by purchasing bras and panties to sell. She will use the profits to purchase pants for her children and save towards her long-term dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy bras and panties for resale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A.'s main source of income comes from selling snacks, biscuits and candies to local community members. She is 51 years old, married and has one grown-up child. She is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Ruth has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr:
Monique T. est une femme de 51 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de LEKHAR depuis 2007. Elle a 6 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit auprès de CAURIE MICRO FINANCE et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement.

Elle fait de l'élevage de poulets de chaire comme activité principale. Et comme activité secondaire elle fait un petit commerce de draps de lit et de tissus.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter des poussins et des produits véto pour l'élevage de poulet de chair et pour le petit commerce elle achètera des draps de lit et des tissus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle compte participer de la nourriture pour sa famille, payer éventuellement des frais de soin en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Monique T. is a 51-year old woman. She is single without children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Lekhar since 2007. Since joining, she obtained loans from Caurie Microfinance six times and never had any problems repaying them. Her main business activity is raising broiler chickens. As a secondary activity, she sells bed linen and fabrics. With this loan she would like to purchase baby chicks and chicken feed needed for raising broiler chickens, and for her small retail business she would like to purchase some bed linen and fabrics. With the resulting revenues, she would like to provide for her family’s food as well as for healthcare expenses in case of future illness.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chicks, feed, bed linens and cloth

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana M. is a 49-year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a coffee shop, a fish vending business, and a pig fattening business.  She lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental.  

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her coffee shop, fish vending, and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. 

Emeliana is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so she can purchase additional stocks. This is her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Emeliana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty-alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join the team.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Rosario solicita este credito para la compra de utiles escolares y uniformes de sus dos hijos, ella trabaja como obrera en una maquiladora de la localidad y su esposo el Señor Roberto trabaja en una empresa como contratista, son una familia muy unida y ellos quieren la mejor educacion para sus hijos. es por eso que solicitan el apoyo y agradecen este credito.
texts.en:
Rosario is asking for funding to buy school supplies and uniforms for her two children. She’s employed by a local assembly plant and her husband, Roberto, works in a firm as a contractor. They are a very close-knit family and want their children to have the best possible education. This is why they are asking for support and are grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es:
Brenda vive con su madre y dos hermanas, tiene un negocio de cosméticos y al mismo tiempo vende cocteles de conchas de mar. Ella aprendió este negocio desde que tenía 10 años pues su madre se dedicaba a este tipo de comercio, pero Brenda se esforzó por tener su propio negocio y es así como lo logro trabajando todos los días de la semana. 
Ella está solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para aumentar su negocio. Con esta inversión hará crecer su capital de trabajo teniendo más posibilidades de obtener mayores ganancias.
Su principal aspiración es que el negocio sea más estable y le brinde los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brenda lives with her mother and two sisters. She has a cosmetics business and also sells seafood cocktails. Brenda learned this business at the age of 10 since her mother engaged in the same type of work. However, Brenda struggled to start her own business but now she is able to work every day of the week.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to increase her business. This investment will increase her operating capital, which will provide her additional possibilities to earn more income. Her main aspiration is to have a more stable business that will generate the income required to cover her necessities and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Carmen Lorena

texts.es:
En provincia de Manabí encontramos el cantón 24 De Mayo, aquí se reúne cada quince días  el Banco Comunal San José, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La señora Carmen tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 9 años, fruto de esta linda relación como la define la socia procreo un hijo que ahora tiene 8 años y está estudiando la escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.  Ella esta estudiando para ser modista y está en el último año.

Su esposo tiene  un taller en el centro de 24 De Mayo en el que realiza una gran variedad  de trabajos con la madera. Trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por el buen trabajo que realiza y por la puntualidad en la entrega de sus pedidos,  dice que esa es su mejor carta de presentación, compra la madera en un depósito en Portoviejo, algunas veces entrega muebles en Portoviejo y Manta que le solicitan sus trabajos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar materiales para la fabricación de muebles, como por ejemplo, madera,  pinturas, y otros. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad que ofrece la institución para  conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y poner un taller de costura.
texts.en:
In Manabí province we find the 24 de Mayo canton [subdivision]. It is here that the San José Communal Bank meets every fifteen days. The canton is known for its beautiful landscapes and hard working people who are dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

Carmen is 24 years old and has been living with her partner for nine years.  The fruit of this beautiful relationship, as she describes, is her son who is now eight years old and in school.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.  She is studying to become a designer and is in her last year in school.

Her husband has a workshop in the center of 24 de Mayo where he does a variety of woodworking jobs.  He works Monday thru Saturday from 8am to 6pm.  He has many clients that prefer him because of his good work that he does punctually, and because he delivers when asked--he says that this is his best attribute.  He buys the wood form a warehouse in Portoviejo.  Sometimes he delivers furniture in Portoviejo and Manta, when his work is requested.

She is using this loan to buy materials used to make furniture, for example wood, paint and other things.  It is her fourth cycle with the communal bank, and she likes the ease with which the institution allows her to get loans.  Her dreams are to finish her studies and start a clothing shop.

loans.use: For the purchase of wood, paint, nails, lacquer, et cetera.

loans.name: Teresa Awuor

texts.en:
Teresa O. is 33 years old and is married to John. They have four children who are all school-going children. 

Teresa runs a retail shop in the Miwani area which is on the outskirts of Kisumu city. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after completing her second loan. She wants to buy shop items as sugar, soap, and cooking fats etc. to add to her stock. Her monthly income is Kshs 20,000. She will use her profits to pay school fees for her children and cater for family needs.

Her desire is to see her business stabilize and be able to open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: Buy shop items  like sugar, soap, and coking fats  to add to her stock

loans.name: Las Alondras Del Creston Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Alondras del Crestón, tiene este nombre porque en el lugar donde se reúnen pasa un río y ahí bajan a bañarse las aves  llamadas alondras, a las señoras les gustan mucho por este motivo decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su grupo, dicen que las alondras tienen un brillo que refleja una gran esperanza.  Está ubicado en la comunidad del Crestón en Hidalgo, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Rosario Catalina es integrante  del grupo. Tiene  43 años, estudio el bachillerato, y tiene en total 2 hijos varones.  Ella tiene una cocina económica la inicio hace 5 años.  Solicita el préstamo para hacerle mejoras a su negocio. Los clientes dicen que les agrada comer en ese negocio porque la señora es muy alegre y acogedora.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicito el crédito para mejorar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio, y a su vez lograr su sueño de comprar un automóvil.
texts.en: This group, called "Las Alondras del Crestón" (The Larks of Creston), has this name because a river passes by the place that they meet, and at this river birds called alondras (larks) go down to bathe themselves.  The women like these birds very much, and so for this reason they decided upon this name for their group.  They say that the larks have a brightness that reflects their great hope.  This place is located in the community of Crestón, in Hidalgo, Mexico.  This group has 10 members.  Rosario Catalina is a member of the group.  She is 43 years old, has a high school education, and has 2 male children.  She has had a small eatery for 5 years.  She requests a loan to make improvements to her business.  Her customers say that they enjoy eating in her establishment because she is very cheerful and welcoming.  Now, requesting this loan, she feels very content and is eager to work, because she requests the loan to improve her business so that she can continue to provide good service and, on her part, achieve her dream of buying an automobile.

loans.use: to make improvements to her eatery

loans.name: Beun

texts.en:
Mrs. Beun T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chea, 40, live on an island in the Mekong river about 15 km from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2006 and have a 7 year old son.   

Beun has been a weaver for more than ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a security guard. Beun is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Kadiatu F.. She is married and has three children, ages 7, 12 and 15. In 1995, Kadiatu established her palm oil, soap and essential drugs business. She started her business because she wanted a way to help her husband support their family. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 980,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to add more stock to her business so she can increase profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Kadiatu F. plans to expand her business, open a drugstore, and hire a sales person. Eventually, Kadiatu would like to pursue a career as as nurse. She is very hardworking and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor J. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. He is 52 years old. Nestor is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nestor plants and harvests rice for sale. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over 31 years and earns approximately 7,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Nestor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Nestor is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Nestor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie B., 33 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is married and has two children aged eight and four. Benjie is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops. He sells his harvest at his town's market. He says he started this business 13 years ago. He also owns some goats. Benjie does his best to build his business and have a stable income. 

Benjie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Benjie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Antonia es de la Comunidad de Chanquis, se dedica a la siembra de papa, quinua, a la elaboración de quesos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la en la compra de abonos, remedios, etc.  
La producción de la siembra lo vende en el Mercado Mayorista Nery García Zarate, los quesos que elabora los distribuye entre sus caseras.  
A Antonia le gusta Finca por las capacitaciones que recibe sobre los ahorros y créditos.
Su Sueño es poder comprar un terrero un construir su casa
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Futuro communal bank.  She is 40 years old, married and has six children.  Antonia is from the community of Chanquis. She’s a potato and quinoa farmer; she also makes cheeses.  She will use the requested loan to buy manure, remedies, etc.

She sells her crops at the Nery García Zarate Wholesale Market and the cheeses she makes among the local housewives.

Antonia likes Finca because of the training she receives about savings and loans.

Her dream is to buy a lot and build her house.

loans.use: To buy manure and remedies.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina A., 45 years old, is married to a farmer. She has 1 daughter and 3 sons. Marina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector production raising pigs and ducks. She sells the pigs and ducks eggs at the market. She also helps her husband till their rice farm. Marina works hard to provide a better living for her family.

Marina is in needs of piglets, ducks and feed. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, ducks and feed

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTUS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margarita; ella tiene 32 años de edad, casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de colección de kaptus de diferentes tamaños y formas la socia solo vende a coleccionistas de kaptus ella está contenta con este negocio ya que aparte de brindarle satisfacciones económicas también disfruta lo que hace el cuidar estos kaptus, a la vez la socia trabaja para una entidad estatal en el área de ceramoteca, la socia es enfermera de profesión pero por el momento no ejerce. La socia se siente bastante feliz ya que mediante su trabajo y su negocio de kaptus ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más kaptus (semillas) y para la mantención de estas plantas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "KANTUS" communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Margarita is 32 years old, married and has two children.  She has a business collecting different shaped cactus plants which she sells to cactus dealers.  She is very happy with her work which not only provides her with an income but allows her to care for the plants.  She also works in the ceramics exhibit area of a state agency.  She is a nurse by profession but does not practice at this time.  She is very happy that through her work and cactus business she is able to make a living for her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy more cactus seeds and afford to care for the plants.  She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy cactus seeds and afford maintenance of cactus plants

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana V. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo pupular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia Pulpería “EMMY”.
La Sra. Juana V. paso un momento muy difícil, perdieron de manera trágica (accidente) el hijo varón que tenía y a pesar de su estado emocional, siempre a seguido trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  
Doña Juana esta casada y su esposo se dedica a es su carro a vender tierra blanca,  actualmente de su matrimonio ya solo depende una hija de ellos.
Cabe mencionar que la Sra. V. hace la mayoría de sus ventas al crédito, casi todos sus clientes son empleados de las fábricas de tabacos y acuden a ella para que les de la mercaderia, mismos que le pagan a cuando reciben sus pagos de salario.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana V. sells popular consumer products.  She has a small general store located in her house, which operates under the name "Pulperia EMMY". 

Mrs. Juana V. went through a difficult time; they tragically lost their son in an accident. In spite of her emotional state, she always kept working to improve their quality of life.

Juana is married and her husband does mobile sales of diatomaceous earth.  Currently they only have one daughter who is still dependent on them.  It's worth mentioning that Mrs. V. makes the majority of her sales on credit.  Almost all of her clients are employed in the tobacco factories, and they go to her because she sells them the merchandise as long as they pay her when they get their paychecks.  

The loan will be used to buy merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, bread, rice, sugar, beans, shortening, oil, margarine, cookies, sodas, juices, spaghetti, pasta, sauces, soups, soaps, toilet paper, sanitary pads, toothpaste, and eggs.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a nursing assistant in Kyenjojo-Uganda . For three years she has been operating a drug shop and the business has allowed her to pay school fees for her children.She has a challenge of limited drugs to treat her clients and her desire is to set up a phamarcy and use the profits for educating her children. Winfred intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: René

texts.es: René H. de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela. Él junto a su esposa quieren hacer crecer el pequeño negocio que poseen en su vivienda ubicada en San Salvador, una tienda que les está ayudando a solventar sus necesidades. René tiene grandes aspiraciones y con su actitud quiere dar a sus hijos un ejemplo a seguir, que les ayude a salir adelante en la vida. Es así como se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito con el que podrá comprar más productos como granos básicos, confitería, cereales, embutidos, bebidas entre otros para así mantener a sus clientes y atraer a nuevos. René con el apoyo de su compañera de vida tienen la confianza que así podrán dar a sus hijos una vida plena.
texts.en:
René H., 55, lives with his life companion and three children who go to school.  Together with his wife he wants to help his small, home-based business located in San Salvador grow; it’s a small store that is helping them meet their needs.  René has large expectations and with his attitude wants to be a good example for his children to follow; that will help them get ahead in life.

This is why he decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that he will use to buy more products like: basic grains, sweets, cereals, cured meats and beverages, among others, in order to keep his current customers and attract new ones.

With his life companion’s support René is confident that they will be able to provide a fulfilled life for their children.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Paula Dolores

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paula, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 8 y 3 años, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Ella es profesora de una escuela fiscal en Montecristi y además de esto también se dedica a la venta de bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, vende anillos, collares, aretes, pulseras, etc. Trabaja todos los días en sus  ventas ya que también lleva sus productos a la escuela donde les vende a sus compañeras y a madres de familia que llegan hasta el centro educativo. Ella compra al por mayor a una distribuidora en Portoviejo, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por tres años y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la seriedad tanto de la institución como de sus compañeras.

Su sueño es que sus hijas tengan un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Los Tres Ángeles (The Three Angels Communal Bank) meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place renowned for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts, celebrated both at national and international level.
