It is also the homeland of the famous Toquilla straw hats.

Here we meet Paula, aged 38, who is married and has two daughters aged 8 and 3; the eldest goes to school. Her husband is a professional driver.

She is a teacher in a public school in Montecristi; on top of this she also sells costume jewelry. She is a street vendor selling door to door articles such as rings, necklaces, earrings, bracelets and so on. She runs both activities every day, as she brings her products to her school where she sells them to her colleagues and to the mothers coming there. She buys at wholesale price form a supplier in Portoviejo; she told us she has been engaging in this activity for three years and that things have been going well.

She will use this loan to purchase costume jewelry. She has been a member of the Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the reliability both of the institution and of her teammates.

She hopes to be able to offer a better future to her daughters.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces and earrings.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans,  5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier FANA-COURA, sous préfecture de Fana,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des habits, des boissons de fabrication locales et des produits cosmétiques.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
NAFI SANGARÉ compte acheter des habits pour enfants et adultes auprès des grossistes de Fana et souvent à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes dans la ville et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Djekafo are all married, and they average 44 years of age and five children. They all live in traditional extended families in Fana City, FANA-COURA district, sub-prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in clothing, beverages made locally, and cosmetics. The group members are on their seventh solidarity loan. 

Ms. NAFI SANGARÉ intends to use her loan to buy clothing for children and adults from wholesalers from Fana and often from Bamako. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sale to a customer base composed of women and men in the city and at the market. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help pay for societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
26-year-old Rowena earns a living through farming and raising hogs. She tills her land where she grows rice crops. She also grows coconut trees on part of her land. Rowena raises pigs to sell. She plans to user her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

Rowena is married and has two children aged eight and three. Rowena hopes to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 41 years old and is married, with two children.  He has been quarrying for six years and employs two casual laborers.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has gained alot of business knowledge which has helped him to sustain his business.  He hopes to have a well established business in five years.  He needs 20,000 Kes to hire an excavator for quarrying.

loans.use: to hire an excavator

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 34 years old.  He is married and has three children aged 5, 7 and 10.  He operates a van transport business to earn a living.  He has employed two people to assist him in the business.  In addition, he also runs a green grocery store for extra income.  He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable because he has grown his business.  Samuel has requested a loan for 20,000 Kes to repair his van.

loans.use: repair his van

loans.name: Zulaa

texts.en:
Zulaa is 72 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His wife is retired and his son is a shoemaker. His daughter is a disabled woman who stays home all day.

Attributing his business success to its location, Zulaa has been managing a grocery-trading enterprise at his booth near his home since 2000. A polite man who says, "I want to have a workshop place where my son can conduct his shoe-making business," he is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items for his business and some materials for his son's shoe-making operation.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora esta casada con el señor Javier el cual es empleado en un aserradero en su localidad, ellos tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ellos los cuales el mayor estudia la secundaria, luego sigue una niña de 8 años la cual estudia la primaria y una pequeña de un año. Gaby como es conocida en su localidad tiene una tienda de abarrotes y también vende dulces y refrescos de diferentes sabores, ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para seguir invirtiendo sus abarrotes ella comprara chiles enlatados, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, focos, veladoras, papel higiénico etc. comenta Gabriela que tiene 11 años aproximadamente con su negocio, cada ocho días va a la población de Zitacuaro a surtir sus productos a diferentes tiendas donde le den buen precio para poderle subir un poco mas ella y tener algo de ganancias a los productos que vende, ella esta muy contenta con lo que vende ya que de ahí le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos que tiene con sus hijos. El sueño de doña Gabriela es hacer un local especial para sus productos ya que los tiene en su cocina y ahí les vende a sus vecinos. Esta agradecida con la financiera por este préstamo ya que poco a poco puede crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She is married to Señor Javier who is employed in a sawmill in their town.  They have 3 children that are dependent on them.  The oldest is a high school student followed by a daughter who is 8 and attends elementary school, and a one year old baby.  Gaby, as she is known in her town, has a grocery store.  She also sells candy and different flavored soft drinks.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase groceries.  She will buy canned chilies, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, light bulbs, candles, toilet paper, etc.  Gariela says that she has been running this business for approximately 11 years.  Every 8 days she goes to the town of Zitacuaro to stock up on products at different stores.  She goes where they offer the best prices so she can save some money and also earn something from the products she sells.  She is very happy with what she sells since it helps her husband with the children's expenses.  Doña Gabriela's dream is to have a special place for her products as they are in her kitchen and she sells to her neighbors from there.  She is grateful to the finance company for this loan as it will help her to gradually grow her business.

loans.use: purchase canned chilies, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, light bulbs, candles, toilet paper, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años D. edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio D. luz, ubicada en L. zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope, que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque.  Esta zona L. actividad que desarrollan es L. agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

José desD. hace algunos años se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en L. parte externa D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo, lo comercialice en los distintos mercados D. L. zona, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados y aves D. corral, lo que le permitirá que su negocio crezca  y pueda ofrecer otros animales, para que sus ventas aumenten, con L. finalidad D. mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia.  José es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es poder sacar a su familia adelante, brindándole otras comodidades.
texts.en:
32-year old José lives with his wife and children in their own house which has electricity. It is located in the rural area of Mórrope, in the department of Lambayeque. The area is known for its agriculture, cattle, and tourism.

For the last few years José has earned his living raising and selling cattle. The corral is located just outsiD. his house. He feeds the cattle nutritional feed and grass so that they get to their optimum weight. He then sells them in various local markets. With the income he earns he can pay for family expenses. 

José has approached Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 soles to buy more nutritional feed and some poultry. In this way he will be able to expand his business by selling other animals and increase sales. His goal is to improve the standard of living of his family. He is a hardworking, very responsible person whose only wish is to see his family get ahead and have an easier life.

loans.use: to buy nutritional feed for his cattle and poultry

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 45-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with one parent. After the death of her father, she became the only one responsible for the family.  She started her work as a female hairdresser five years ago. She receives clients at her home and she also serves them at their houses. She works hard because she is the only income source of the family. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to rent a small salon and refurbish it in order to welcome customers properly. She feels positive about her business prospects for the coming years.

loans.use: to rent and refurbish a small beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly, 36 years old, is a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a stockman, and they have three children. Beverly and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. Beverly works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Beverly operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. Beverly earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in daily sales.

To help her continue operating her business, Beverly is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Beverly hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old and married with two children ages 6 and 15. He runs a bar and restaurant in Georgebrook, a neighborhood in Freetown. His children are currently attending school.

David has owned this business for 20 years and sells drinks and food at the bar and restaurant. He also earns income from another business (a cinema hall). He says that the main challenge to his business is a lack of sufficient funds.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soft drinks, star beer, stout and food. David says that the extra income from this loan will help him to educate his children. In the future, he would like to expand to another outlet.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, star beer, stout and food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase tea

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nyando in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of second-hand clothes from the market, and will help Moses to generate greater profits, pay medical expenses, and start building a house. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business and perhaps start another side business. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of second-hand clothes from the market

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Pino está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Paula quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace 4 años y trabaja en un restaurante de Masaya. 
Ella está casada, trabaja junto a su esposo en el mismo restaurante él es cocinero y tiene un niño. Con el crédito comprara cremas y cosméticos.
Las otras integrantes son Edda del Carmen quien vende ropa, Sandra del Carmen tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años y Rosibel vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Flor de Pino group is made up of four hard-working and entrepreneurial people. The group coordinator is Paula, who has worked selling cosmetics for 4 years. She also works in a restaurant in Masaya.

She is married, and works with her husband in the restaurant. They have one child. With the loan she will buy creams and cosmetics. The other group memebrs are Edda del Carmen, who sells clothing, Sandra del Carmen, who has had a small store for four years, and Rosibel who sells used clothes.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 59 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with eight children. 
Jovita works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase fishing materials and gasoline for a pumpboat to be used for fishing.
Jovita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Jovita hopes to have savings for future use.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials and gasoline for a pumpboat to be used for fishing

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida's husband sells buffalo milk. He is very good in his customer dealings and provides good quality milk to his customers. Sajida provides full support to her husband, milks the buffaloes and keeps their place clean. In addition to supporting her husband's business, she also performs her household duties very well. She is the mother of 3 children, all of them are getting their education at a local school.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to produce more milk and of a good quality.

He has good experience of his business and has been running it for many years. 

Sajida hopes that by purchasing another buffalo he will successfully be able to improve his business and his profits.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a milk-selling business.

loans.name: Mukunduzi A Group

texts.en:
Julius is the facilitator of the Mukunduzi B group. Julius and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julius and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Julius takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Julius had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julius was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Julius will educate his children and save in business and livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Mukunduzi B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Julius is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is married and lives in Malindi, Kenya. He uses his motorcycle to ferry people and goods around the area. He started the business four months ago after purchasing the motorcycle. Jonathan was introduced to Milango by his friend and decided to join in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to purchase fruit and vegetables in order to open up a grocery stall. His main challenge is the low season which begins in February. Jonathan would like to purchase more motorcycles in future and also to begin his grocery stall. He will use the extra income obtained to meet his current needs and invest a section for the future needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables to start a grocery stall

loans.name: Ruth Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Manuela    ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace tres años ella nos cuenta que gracias a su negocio le ha podido dar una mejor vida a su familia.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos , es soltera y con muchas ganas de triunfar y hacer mas grande su negocio.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas calzado en ocasiones los vende en pago y a contado.
Le da gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ruth Manuela has been engaged in selling shoes for three years. She has told us that thanks to her activity she has been able to provide her family with a better standard of living.
She has two children, she is single and she strongly wants to succeed in life and to expand her activity.
She has requested a loan to buy more shoes; she gets paid in cash and sometimes in installments.
She thanks the foundation for the support she has been given in getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Francoise Yvette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 22 et 26 ans,elle commence avec la vente des produits divers il ya de cela 10 ans,elle est bénéficiaire de Hope depuis bientôt 10 années, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine et des pagnes.
Elle a des recettes qui ont augmentés de 20.000 frs a 50.000 frs  le jour , et fait des benefices considérables depuis l'obtention des prêts.Son commerce a beaucoup évolué , avec son quatrième prêt, elle va renforcer le stock des marchandises , ajouter des pagnes de differents qualité comme le réal, les Hi target, le wax et cuvettes, des bassines , des seaux, des marmites et des pots.
Elle a pour ambition d'être  grossiste des pagnes et faire un dépôt des ustensiles en plastiques qu'elle ira acheter a Kinshasa.
Pour sa famille , elle est entrain de construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
She is a 48 year old client who is unmarried and has 2 children between the ages of 22 and 26 .She started selling various products about 10 years ago, she has been  a Hope beneficiary   for about 10 years and she sells kitchen utensils and fabrics.
Her takings have increased by about 20,000 Frs. to 50,000 Frs. per day and she has been making considerable profits since she obtained her loans. Her business has progressed a lot, with her fourth loan, she intends to increase her stock, add fabrics of different qualities like the real wax, Hi target wax, textiles, bowls, basins, buckets, saucepans, and jugs.
Her ambition is to become a fabric wholesaler and hold a depot of plastic utensils that she will purchase in Kinshasa.
For her family she is in the process of building a house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils,saucepans,buckets,plastic jugsand traditional cloth.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias Group

texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Visionarias ["Woman Bank's Visionary Women"]

Puntarenas

This group

El grupo se integra para realizar su tercer préstamo, cancelan el anterior invirtiendo en sus negocios, logrando una muy buena gestión de los créditos y un crecimiento en sus negocios, destacando el apoyo a la economía familiar y mejorar las condiciones de vida. Se organizan actividades de ventas de comidas y rifas, para fortalecer el trabajo e integración de las participantes, lo que ha traído una mejora las relaciones de las integrantes.

Son 4 familiares y 1 vecina, se han dedicado al comercio y actividades de costura, generando ingresos al hogar, apoyando la economía familiar, han trabajado con capital propio y esperan tener la oportunidad de empezar a crecer con el apoyo de Fundación Mujer y KIVA.

Cada una aporta a su hogar y desarrolla un negocio que le genera ganancias, se han organizado para realizar actividades, apoyarse entre ellas y generar ingresos adicionales para ahorrar y hacer de Mujeres Visionarias una gran microempresa. Las compañeras coordinan las reuniones de una manera adecuada, llevan su libro de actas al día, y la junta directiva ha desarrollado un buen trabajo, se da un cambio en la presidencia ya que la anterior tuvo que dejar el grupo por situaciones familiares.

Trabajan actividades consolidadas en la comunidad, personas activas, puntuales y participativas. Entre ellas destaca la presidenta, Adriana, se dedica a la actividad de costura, principalmente ropa de mujer que vende en la comunidad de Fray Casiano, mujer con deseos de superarse, se capacita y aprovecha las oportunidades para apoyar a sus compañeras y a su familia, mujer de escasos recursos, ha sacado adelante su hogar, es madre de un niño y con esta oportunidad desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, vive con su hijo en una casa de bono social, el menor está en la escuela.

Ellas buscan desarrollarse integralmente, por lo que con este grupo desean participar en actividades comunales y regionales, esperan recibir el apoyo de Fundación Mujer para participar en ferias y otras actividades similares. Se va a invertir para la compra de mercadería y materiales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfume and jewelry, clothing and

loans.name: Minura

texts.ru: Минура, 40 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей, у нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Минура около 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 30 овец. На 0,60 Га земли выращивает перец, фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Минура обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 20 овец для откорма и реализации. Минура доходы от кредита планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и обучение ее детей.

loans.use: to purchase 20  sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is a young girl and is 24 years old. She is dynamic and enthusiastic. She is single and has three daughters, and for this reason she decided to started her own business. Her daughters are the motivation of her life and they are her first thought when she wants to grow her business because she wants to offer them a better future. Her business is selling crystal and sets of dishes. Her products have so far done well in the marketplace and for this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to purchase merchandise and satisfy all of the orders that she has. Her demand will also increase this Christmas season. She offers to pay this loan in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Angélica es una mujer joven de 24 años, muy dinámica y entusiasta, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijas, es por eso que hace tres años decidió iniciar su negocio, sus hijas son el motor de su vida y son en las que piensa cuando quiere hacer crecer su negocio, pues quiere estar en condiciones de poder ofrecerles un mejor futuro. Su negocio es la venta de vajillas y cristalería, sus productos tienen muy buena aceptación entre sus clientes y es por eso que requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 USD para comprar mercancía del agrado de sus clientes y satisfacer sus pedidos los cuales se incrementan en esta próxima temporada navideña, la idea que tiene Angélica, es pagar el crédito en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vaitolo

texts.en:
Vaitolo V. was born in 1966 at Motootua. She has six children. Vaitolo is a strong and hard-working woman. Vaitolo has two small business projects: one is a plantation, and the other is a vegetable garden. She has a strong heart. If she can do two business projects, she also can do more.

Mrs. V. hired two village boys to help her plant, weed, and clean her plantation each day. She has a strong heart and believes that her business is growing, as she receives more than two hundred tala a day (USD 72.60). Vaitolo covers half of a quarter-acre with her plantation. She also owns a permanent block at the Public Market in town, where she serves more than thirty customers a day.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, planting materials, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is originally from Torreón, Coahuila, but more than ten years ago he decided to relocate so that his family could have a better quality of life. He found a better job in Monterrey and has been working every afternoon as a machinist, and during mornings and weekends he sells clothing to neighbors and friends alongside his wife Isabel. His customers pay him weekly or every two weeks. Since he has a large clientele and accounts to bill, he is assured a prosperous business for a long time.

Now Pedro is asking for a $925 loan to purchase merchandise for the next warm season so that he can provide a variety of products to his clients. He will pay the loan back in 6 to 12 months. The growth of this business and the welfare of this family are in your hands. Please choose to support them.

Don Pedro es originario de Torreón Coahuila, hace mas de 10 años él decidió mover su residencia con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y lo logró porque en Monterrey encontró un mejor empleo, en el que inició desde que llegó a esta ciudad, donde trabaja por las tardes como operario y en las mañanas y fines de semana vende ropa en compañía de su esposa Isabel con los vecinos de la colonia y amistades cercanas, recibiendo de ellos pagos cada semana o quincena, ya tiene una gran cantidad de clientes y cuentas por cobrar que le aseguran tener un negocio prospero por mucho tiempo.

Actualmente Pedro solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, para la próxima temporada de calor y poder tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. E n tus manos esta el crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use:
To purchase merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth I. is a 30-year-old businesswoman who is glad that she decided  to start her own metal shop a year ago. She enjoys running a successful business, and takes pride in meeting  the needs of her customers. She believes that this is a good time to expand, and has come to us for a loan to buy more gates and protectors to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more iron gates and protectors to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel L. is 27 years of age and has a wife and one son aged five years. Sam is employed on an agricultural farm for only four hours a day, five days a week. He spends the other hours of the day at his own business where he makes bricks for sale.

Sam has been in this business for one and a half years. Sam says the business brings in extra income for the school fees of his pre-primary son and for other necessities for the whole family.

Sam would like to secure a loan of US$ 700 to boost his business by leasing a piece of land where he can make bricks. When he has managed to do this, he will be able to save money to construct his house.

loans.use: Leasing a piece of land

loans.name: Eufracina Salisa

texts.es:
Salisa es una madre, que juntamente a su esposo se dedica al desarrollo de actividad diligentemente para brindarle bienestar y satisfacción a su única hija, Katy, que hoy tiene 20 años y tuvo que interrumpir sus estudios de industrias alimentarias en la capital debido a su delicada salud.Por este hecho sus padres se sienten muy angustiados, porque la salud de su única hija, quién ha estado llevando un tratamiento muy largo le está propiciando grandes inversiones de tiempo y dinero no previstos en su economía, sin embargo están dispuestos a salir adelante mostrando entereza y optimismo para mejorar su situación y brindarle mayores atenciones a su estrellita. Y ahora Katy, después de su parcial mejoría ha decidido trabajar en el extranjero para poder ayudar a sus padres y más adelante regresar y prepararse profesionalmente.Sin embargo los gastos para los trámites y demás requerimientos son costosos y su querida madre ha tenido que invertir los pocos ahorros que obtuvo con mucho esfuerzo, los mismos que pensaba invertir en esta última siembra para mejorar sus productos agrícolas y sus ventas; para que pueda lograr lo que se propone esta joven muchacha.Pese al apuro que tiene, también le embarga la pena de ver partir a su hija hacia tierras muy lejanas, pero sabe que todo cuanto puede hacer es únicamente para verla contenta y satisfecha.Ahora y con un proyecto a cuestas Salisa solicita la suma de 275 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para las pequeñas parcelas de cultivo que mantiene en el pequeño huerto de su hogar a fin de obtener hermosas zanahorias y rocotos.Con su colaboración podremos dar una sonrisa a una madre que sufre por la pronta partida de su hija.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Salisa is a mother, who together with her husband diligently began the development of this venture in order to provide for the wellbeing and happiness of their only daughter, Katy, who today is 20 years old. She recently had to interrupt her college studies in Lima due to poor health. Because of this, her parents have been very concerned, because her long and intensive treatments have cost them large amounts of time and money that they were not expecting. However, they are determined to continue on, showing optimism that their situation will improve and they will provide better care for their precious daughter. Now, Katy, after partially recovering, has decided to find work to help her parents pay the bills. The costs of transportation are expensive and they have begun to dip into their savings in order to continue improving the quality of the agricultural products they sell, in order to continue to be able to provide for their young daughter. All of these issues have weighed heavily on their family, but they are determined to do whatever it takes to be able to take care of Katy. Now Salisa is asking for a loan of $275 to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for the small parcels of land that she maintains in the small orchard near their home where she grows carrots and other root vegetables. WIth your cooperation we'll be able to put a smile on the face of a mother who has sacrificed a lot to provide for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Ojah

texts.en:
Ojah is36 years old and the mother of a 7-year-old daughter. She has been selling sheets on credit, cosmetics, clothes, etc. She can earn about $5 per day.

Her husband, A., sells vegetables and earns $15 in income per day. She requests a $50 loan to buy more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is single. He lives with his parents in Novomoskovsk in eastern Ukraine. Dmytryi sells sportswear in the central city market. The type of inventory he sells is always in high demand especially during the cold season. Dmytryi has been in this trade for 8 years. Presently, his monthly net profit is about $400.

Dmytryi believes he hasn’t realized the full potential of this business. He wants to continue to see his venture grow and expand. That is why Dmytryi would like to increase the assorted inventory in his kiosk which he believes will help attract more potential customers to his vending spot. Moreover, in the near future he is hoping to open a second vending facility. Dmytryi wants to get to the point of financial stability and independence when he will not only be able to provide for his own needs but will have enough to support his retired parents. Today Dmytryi is requesting a loan of $500. We believe the serious attitude and commitment of this young entrepreneur would help him repay the current loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Francisco M. is a gentleman who some years ago took the time to learn a task that would generate an income for him. Because of his skills he decided to take a course in electronics. Currently he has a business in this field and he does it from his house in the city of Leon.

He is married and has two small children to maintain. Francisco makes an effort to do a high quality work in order to gain new clients, and to be able to make a living so he can provide for his wife and children . He repairs household-electric appliances, TV, recorders, irons, amplifiers, heaters, etc.

Ceprodel has offered credits to him that have been used very satisfactorily, so now he does not only repair the household- appliances but to sell parts as well. He is asking for a loan in order to buy more parts and resale them to his clients.

Francisco M. es un caballero que hace varios años atrás se preocupo por aprender un oficio que le generara recursos, de acuerdo a sus habilidades decide estudiar un curso de electrónica que es el negocio al que se dedica hoy en día en su casa de habitación en el departamento de León.

Por ser casado y con dos pequeños hijos que mantener, Francisco M. se esfuerza para hacer su trabajo con la mas alta calidad con el propósito de ganar la atención de nuevos clientes y así poder ganarse la vida apoyando a su esposa e hijos en todo lo que necesitan. Entre los electrodomésticos que repara se encuentran t.v, grabadoras, planchas, amplificadores, calentadores, etc.

Ceprodel le ha brindado créditos que han sido usados muy satisfactoriamente de manera que hoy en día no solamente repara los electrodomésticos sino que también ha adquirido algunos repuestos para su respectiva venta. Su deseo es que se le otorguen mas créditos para comprar mas repuestos y vendérselos a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy parts to resale on his business

loans.name: Judith's Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Judith, 40 years old, is a married woman with 3 children, ages 20,14 and 7. She and her husband also take care of one other child, age 13. Judith works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. everyday, and she wants to expand her business.

She now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who operates a saloon.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is the mother of two small children. Due to matters of fate, she ended up staying alone and has brought up her children herself. She was in need of her own income to cover her household’s expenses and some medical expenses for her children. It was then that a friend introduced her to the footwear business and provided her with catalogs. This occurred 4 years ago, and to date she has obtained very good earnings.

Teresa requires capital to purchase footwear and resell it being that she has very loyal customers that continue to buy from her since she started the business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for US $375, which she will repay in 3 months. With your support, Teresa will be able to offer her children a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa es madre de 2 niños por circunstancias del destino ella se quedo sola y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos. Ella necesitaba de ingresos propios para poder costear los gastos de su casa y algunos gastos médicos de sus hijos. Fue entonces cuando una amiga la inicio en la venta de zapatos por catalogo proporcionándole libros de calzado, hace ya 4 años, a la fecha ha obteniendo buenos ingresos.

Ella requiere de capital para comprar zapatos y revenderlos ya que tiene clientes muy fieles que le siguen comprando desde que se inicio en este negocio, por esto solicita un crédito por US $375 que pagara en 3 meses.Con tu apoyo Tere podrá darles mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase more footwear to resell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos G., 47, is married to Margarita Cubilla and is the father of four university-age children. Five years ago, Carlos started selling outfits house-by-house in his neighborhood. The business did not succeed, but Carlos did not give up. He continued looking for business opportunities. That is when he saw one--he realized that the maize market was a very profitable business in the area. So, five years ago, Carlos decided to buy maize and then sell it to his customers.

Carlos’ family is very close and they all help him run the business. Carlos wants to buy a motorcycle to cover more regions and thus increase the number of sales. With this increase in earnings, he would bring prosperity to his family by sending his sons to college.

The credit provided will be used for the purchase of maize to its further sales.

loans.use: Purchase of maize (corn)

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia started her business because her husband did not have work and the pension was not sufficient to pay for services and the maintenance of her children. She started her business more than 10 years ago, selling natural products and cosmetics to friends and neighbors, increasing her list of clients little by little.

She needs a loan of $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your help her business will be able to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Alicia inició el negocio ya que su esposo no tenia empleo y la pension no le alcanza para el pago de los servicios y la manutencion de sus hijos. Comenzó su negocio hace mas de 10 años vendiendo productos naturales y cosmeticos con amistades y vecinas, incrementado su cartera de clientes poco a poco.

Ella neceita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda su negocio podra prosperar.

loans.use: To buy natural products and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 35, lives in the Beirut suburbs. He is a men's hair designer. He used to work in a hair salon, but his ambition pushed him to request his first loan from Al Majmoua this year and that allowed him to open his own salon. At present, Ahmad needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase a generator. This equipment will permit  Ahmad to guarantee more convenience for his clients and therefore to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase a generator for his hair salon

loans.name: Juana Nila

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana Nila is married and is 33 years old. She studied to be an executive secretariat, but she never practiced because she was taking care of her son, who is 9 years old and is an elementary-school student.

The businesswoman sells appetizers in her house, which is in the Moche district in Trujillo, La Libertad. She works every day from 9:00 a.m., taking advantage of the fact that the “Hospital del Seguro” of Moche is located in front of her house. She decided to request a loan from Manuela R. because of the profits and the opportunity of working among women. The first loan that she received was for 300 new soles; she invested this into the purchase of soda, which she offered with the appetizers.

She belongs to Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia.” With this loan of 700 new soles, which she will repay in four months, she plans to buy soda at wholesale directly from the factory in order to get the best price.

Her goal is to help her mother and support the education of her son so that he will be a good professional. She also dreams of having a bigger restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana Nila está casada, tiene 33 años, estudió secretariado ejecutivo, pero nunca la ejerció porque se dedicó al cuidado de su hijo el cual tiene la edad de 09 años y es estudiante del nivel Primario.

La empresaria se dedica a la venta de piqueos en su casa, en el Distrito de Moche en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Vende todos los días, a partir de las 9:00 a.m. aprovechando que al frente de su casa se encuentra el Hospital del Seguro de Moche. Decidió solicitar el préstamo a Manuela R., por los beneficios y la oportunidad de trabajar entre mujeres. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300.00, ha invertido en la compra de gaseosa las que oferta junto con los piqueos.

Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “SANTA LUCIA”. Con este préstamo de S/. 700.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, piensa comprar gaseosa al por mayor directamente de la fabrica para obtener mejor precio.

Tiene como meta ayudar a su mamá y apoyar en la educación de su hijo para que sea un buen profesional y sueña con tener un restaurante más grande.

loans.use: To buy sodas at wholesale

loans.name: Ccatarisun Llaqta Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Ccatarisun Llaqta is located in the District of Acoria in the Huancavelica region, Peru's poorest region, at an altituD. of 2880 meters above sea level. The prinicipal economic activities of the people in the region are agriculture, livestock raising and commerce.

Filomena C. R., a single mother of a 3 year old boy, is requesting a loan of 400 soles (Peruvian currency). Her business is vegetable sales. Starting as a child she worked selling vegetables in order to support her younger sisters. Her goal is to sell vegetables in every fair. To meet this goal she needs capital, but previously no one would loan to her because she did not meet the approval requirements. When she was ill for a time, her business suffered and she had to borrow money from her neighbor at 10% interest. Finally she saw that a FINCA representative was giving out loans accompanied by business training. Says Filomena, "From that moment FINCA trusted me, lending me the capital to grow my business. I bought embroidery thread and now I am embroidering the petticoats local women wear under the skirts of our traditional dress; it is going very well." One of Filomena's obstacles has been a year-long bout of gastritis, which severly impacted her business, but she had the support of her family and FINCA. With the loan, she is going to buy cloth with which to make aprons, since she has a small sewing machine. Through local bartering, she trades the aprons that she makes for corn and barley. She dreams of one day opening a clothing store with her own savings, and sellling wholesale. Some day she would also like to get to know the capital city of Lima, arriving there as a business woman.

Patricia R. R. is married with 8 children ranging in age from 12 to 22. All of her children are in school; the eldest attends the national university. She is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian soles. Her business is the sale of lambs; Patricia raises sheep. Before she was born her father passed away. As a result, the people of the village marginalized her. A friend took her to Lima where she got married and started a business with her husband. Unfortunately, the couple lost everything in a robbery and had to return to her village with nothing. That's when Patricia began to raise her sheep. "When FINCA arrived in the village the community did not support me in my application for a loan because they did not believe I would be able to repay it, but I stood my ground. In the end, FINCA loaned me the money and gave me the business training. I was able to reopen my business selling meat and free range eggs. Now that I qualify for a larger loan I would like to begin selling my meat in Lima. Thanks to FINCA and their training courses, I feel valued, and the people no longer marginalize me since I now have a stable business." The loan will be invested in rams, more eggs, and cheese. Her dream is to have a butcher stand in the city of Huancavelica, and to support her son in the university, in the hope that he will later be able to support his younger siblings, so that they, too, may go on to be professionals.

Maria C. R., single mother of a 4 year old son, is taking out a loan of 800 Peruvian soles. She sells potatoes, and has now started a business making embroidered petticoats. "In the beginning I did not want to walk into the training meetings; I didn't say a word in them. Now I am very talkative." Maria is the local president of the Glass of Milk program, a national social program providing basic and much-needed nutrition to the poor. Her leadership of that program demonstrates that she knows how to value herself as a woman. Now, she says, people say that she is an entrepreneur, thanks to God, because FINCA trusted her. Maria overcame a difficult obstacle in life: the father of her son left her, leaving her with only the support of an aunt. With the loan from FINCA she will buy an embroidery frame and perhaps hire an assistant. She dreams of owning her own embroidery business, which she will call "El Resplandor" ( perhaps "The Glow" or "The Gleam" in English).

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Bancomunal Ccatarisun Llaqta perteneciente al Distrito D. Acoria y al departamento D. Huancavelica (el mas pobre del Perú), ubicada a una altitud D. 2880 m.s.n.m, las principales actividades son la agricultura, ganadería y el comercio.

Filomena C. R., madre soltera D. un niño D. 3 años, solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles, su negocio es la venta D. verduras, desD. niña trabajaba con verduras, para mantener a sus hermanitas, su meta es vender verduras en cada feria es por eso que necesita Capital, pero antes nadie le prestaba, no cumplía los requisitos, llego a enfermarse entonces su negocio bajo y tuvo que prestarse D. su vecina al 10% D. interés hasta que observó que una promotora D. FINCA trabaja dando crédito con capacitaciones, Filomena dice: “...desD. ese momento FINCA confío en mi, prestándome para crecer en mi negocio, compre hilos D. bordar, telas y ahora estoy bordando fustanes y me va bien...”. Una dificultad que tuvo fue enfermarse D. gastritis fracasando 1 año en el negocio, pero tuvo el apoyo D. su familia y D. FINCA. Con el prestamos va a comprar mas telas para confeccionar mandiles por que tiene su maquinita D. coser, los mandiles que hace los cambia en trueque con maíz y cebada. Su sueño es tener una tienda D. ropa y vender al por mayor, con sus ahorro tener una tienda y algún día quiere conocer Lima e ir como empresaria.

Patricia R. R., casada, con 8 hijos cuyas edades están entre12 y 22 años, van a la escuela y el mayor esta en la universidad Nacional, solicita un préstamo D. 800 soles, su negocio es la venta D. corderos (pastora). Antes que naciera falleció su papá por lo que la gente D. su pueblo la marginaba, una amiga la llevo a Lima donD. se casó y puso un negocio con su esposo pero les robaron todo y tuvo que regresar a su pueblo sin nada, comenzó a pastorear sus ovejitas, cuando llego FINCA las D. mi comunidad no me apoyaron para recibir mi préstamo por que creían que no podía pagar, pero me puse fuerte y FINCA me prestó y capacitó, puD. retomar mi negocio vendiendo carne, huevo D. corral. Ahora que me aumentaron D. préstamo quiere llevar carne a Lima. Gracias a FINCA y sus capacitaciones me siento mas valorada y la gente no la margina pues ya tiene un negocio seguro. El dinero del préstamo lo va invertir en carneros, mas huevos y queso. Su sueño es tener un puesto D. carnicería en la ciudad D. Huancavelica, apoyar a su hijo en la universidad para que él apoye después a sus hermanitos para que también sean profesionales.

Maria C. R., madre soltera con 1 hijo D. 4 años, saco un préstamo D. 800 soles, venD. papas, se inició trabajando confeccionando fustanes en bordado simple y aplicaciones. Nadie quería prestarle pero llegó FINCA y le prestó para comprar mas lana y tela. Al inicio no quería entrar a mis reuniones pues era callada pero ahora ya soy habladora. Es presidenta del programa D. vaso D. leche, señala que sabe valorarse como mujer y ahora dicen que es empresaria gracias a Dios por que FINCA confió en ella. El problema que supero es que el padre D. su hijo la dejó y solo contó con el apoyo D. una tía. Con el préstamo D. FINCA va comprar bastidor D. bordar y tal vez contrate un peón. Su sueño es tener su pequeña empresa D. bordado “el resplandor”

loans.use: The communal bank Ccatarisun Llaqta is requesting a loan of 8100 Peruvian soles. The group is made of 16 women who live in the Quimina community. They want to use the loan to carry out their plans for their businesses.

loans.name: Padre San Jacinto Group

texts.es:
La comunidad D. Acostambo pertenece al Distrito D. Acostambo, Provincia D. Tayacaja ubicado en el Departamento: Huancavelica El distrito D. Acostambo se localiza a los 3,600 m.s.n.m, se encuentra ubicado al noreste D. Huancavelica, al final del inmenso Valle del Mantaro y muy cerca a la quebrada D. Huanta ayacucho, se tiene referencias por los historiadores D. la zona, D. que el Inca en nuestros antepasados cuando avanzaba con su tropa, por los caminos D. entonces, desD. el Cuzco hacia Quito, pasando necesariamente por este territorio, acampaba con sus tropas en el lugar hoy conocido como "TAMBO MACHAY" (lugar turístico D. Acostambo), el cual está constituido por una secuencia D. cuevas geológicas que cuentan con ambientes claramente delimitados.

Actividades Principales: Agricultura, ganadería, Acuicultura, Comercio, Artesanía y turismo

R. V., es viudo, se dedica a la compra D. vacas y toros. Rómulo es padre y madre D. sus hijos, su esposa falleció en un accidente, él lucha para que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Isabel U., es casada y se dedica al negocio D. compra D. cerdos, con el préstamo que recibirá comprará pequeños cerditos para engordar y vender en chicharronerías D. Izcuchaca.

Rosa T., es casada y su negocio es dar pensión a profesores D. la escuela, invertirá su préstamo en comprar arroz y azúcar por sacos para su negocio, Le gustaría tener su propia bodeguita bien surtida con golosinas y mas adelante tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
The Acostambo community is in the Acostambo Distrit of the Tayacaja Province, Huancavelica Department. The Acostambo District is 3,600 meters above sea level and is situated to the northeast of Huancavelica, at the end of the immense Mantaro Valley. It is very close to the Huanta riverbed, which is important to local historians because the Incan troops, advancing along the road from Cuzco to Quito, necessarily passed through this territory. The troops camped in the area which today is known as “Tambo Machay” (a tourist destination in Acostambo), which is maD. up of a series of well-defined geological caves. Main activities: Agriculture, stockbreeding, aquaculture, commerce, handicrafts, and tourism R. V. is a widower who purchases cows and bulls for a living. He has been both a father and mother to his children since his wife died in an accident. He has fought to turn his children into professionals. Isabel U. is married and dedicates herself to the business of purchasing pigs. With the loan she will receive, she will purchase piglets to fatten up and sell to pork rinds vendors in Izcuchaca. Rosa T. is married and her business is to proviD. board to schoolteachers. She will use her loan to purchase rice and sugar sacks for her business. She would like to have her own small shop well supplied with sweets, and to own her own restaurant later on.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The l Padre San Jacinto community bank requests a loan of s/5200 to be used by its 11 members to  implement their businesses.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 37 year-old mother of three children. Currently, all the kids are in school. She enjoys providing quality customer care. She has been selling maize and beans for the past thirty years to support her family. Florence treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. By doing this, she avoids middleman costs. 

She wishes to use the loan to buy additional inventories of maize and bags of gari to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support one of her kids, who is ready to enter university this year. Florence is a member of a community group called Judah. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy additional inventories of maize and bags of beans.

loans.name: Leyla Mercedes

texts.es:
Su nombre es Ley a Mercedes M. Balmaceda tiene la  edad es de 58 años, su estado civil es casada, su compañero de vida no labora ya que es jubilado y trabajo 14 años al estado, Doña Leyla tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solo un hijo varón de la edad de 28 años depende de ella por lo que el no trabaja pero la asiste en la pulpería que esta ubicada en su casa de habitación que es el barrio de subtiava, Texaco guido 1  cuadra al oeste 2  ½ al norte, los propósitos de Doña Esperanza es obtener su propia casa ya que donde habita recientemente es de una de sus hijas, los deseos que mas predominan en ella son de ayudar a su hijo para que este invierta el dinero en algún negocio y pueda defenderse en el mañana y  así el pueda sobrellevar  la situación del país  por lo que ella se encuentra en una edad avanzada y no puede seguir trabajando de la misma manera que cuando era joven.

Su actividad económica es una pulpería  en donde vende los productos como: sal, azúcar, aceite, jabón y refrescos, el tiempo que lleva en  este negocio es de 4 años, da inicio a este negocio con un  carretón en el que proporcionaba la venta de chancho con yuca y lo realizaba en las calles razón por la que su hija  le propone instalar una pulpería en su casa y así nace el establecimiento, por lo que el financiamiento es para  la capital de trabajo para la compra de sus productos ya que tiene ciertas productos que le gustaría ofrecer a sus clientes y obtendrá ingresos y lograra pagar sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Leyla Mercedes M. Balmaceda, 58, is married. Her husband is retired. Leyla has 9 children; but only her 28-year-old son still lives with her, and helps her run a small grocery store out of their home. Leyla's long-term goal is to have her own home, because the house where she lives now belongs to one of her daughters. She would also like to support her son in starting a business of his own and have a better life, even in the country's economic conditions. She feels that she is growing old and is not able to work as much. Leyla's business is a small grocery store where she sells products such as salt, sugar, oil, soap, and sodas. She started four years ago selling "chancho con yuca" (fried pork marinated in achiote spices with yuca and cabbage salad) on the street. Her daughter suggested to open a corner store in her house, so that she did not need to work on the streets. Leyla is requesting a loan to use as work capital, to purchase a wider variety of products to satisfy her customers' demands and make her profits grow.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: Née à Athiémé le 15/10/1962 de parents cultivateurs ,dame A. Béatrice n'a jamais été à l'école .Dès son enfance ,elle dut aider ses parents à cultiver la terre .Puis , elle se lança dans le petit commerce et se mit à vendre de l'igname frite avec des beignets de haricot..Ce qu'elle fit pendant 3 ans ,avant de changer d'activité pour commencer par vendre les noix d'acajou grillés.Mais actuellement ,elle n'exerce plus cette activité compte tenu du manque à gagner assez élevé et a préféré faire la vente de nourriture :riz accompagné de sauce graine avec poisson frit .C'est pour renforcer cette activité et la diversifier avec la vente d'huile végétale qu'elle a sollicité ce 3ème   prêt de 140000fcfa.Mariée ,elle a cinq enfants tous scolarisés.
texts.en:
Born in Athiémé on October 15, 1962 to parents who were farmers, Mrs. Béatrice A. was never able to go to school. From childhood on, she had to help her parents cultivate their earth. Then she went into petty commerce and began to sell fried yams with bean fritters. She did that for three years, before changing over to selling grilled cashews.

Presently, however, Béatrice is no longer in this business, since she was not able to earn enough money. She preferred to sell cooked food: rice accompanied by grain sauce with fried fish. It is to bolster this business and diversify it by selling vegetable oil that she is requesting this third loan of 140,000 F CFA. Married, she has 5 children, all enrolled in school.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 5 jerry cans of 25 liters of vegetable oil and 4 sacks of rice

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Dame I. Mariama est âgée de 37 ans. Originaire du Togo Nord, elle a été élevée par sa tante dès son jeune âge, elle aida cette dernière dans la vente de divers articles: conserves, cigarettes, pates alimentaires et autres biens de consommation. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte à 25 ans après avoir été placée  comme domestique pendant 3 ans. Elle  vendait de la nourriture :riz mélangé au haricot  avec de la friture.Depuis 13 ans, elle est arrivée à cotonou, elle a ajouté à son activité de vente de riz, de la pâte de maïs accompagné de diverses sauces. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour augmenter son capital afin de renforcer l'activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en sacs de maïs et de riz.
texts.en:
Mariama I. is 37 years old. Originally from northern Togo, she was raised by her aunt from a young age, and she helped that aunt to sell various products: canned goods, cigarettes, pasta and other consumer goods. She started her own business when she was 25 years old after having worked as a maid for three years. She sold fried food with rice and beans. When she was 13, Mariama moved to Cotonou, and in addition to selling rice, branched out into selling fermented cornmeal mush, accompanied by a variety of sauces. She is requesting her third loan to increase her working capital in order to build up her business. Mariama intends to stock up on sacks of rice and corn.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one sack of rice and one sack of corn

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
C. was born 1973 and lives with five other family members in a small family home in the Pursat Province.  She and her husband make a living as rice cultivators.  The couple currently has four children; all four of them are single and in school. 

To help meet the family's food needs, C.'s husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, and he provides a service to passengers for a profit.  

In view of the fact that rice cultivating is the main source of income for the family, and to help with the physical labors, C. and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase water buffalo to use for plowing their farmland. 

(C.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase water buffalo to use for plowing their farmland

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco L. Q. quiere iniciar un cuarto en la parte de enfrente la casa donde vive es muy pequeña aunque tiene un hijo no descarta la idea de poder tener mas. El quiere aprovechar que son menos los gastos en su vivienda para ir levantando poco a poco  las paredes, la losa y destalles para que se vea bien. 
El es una persona trabajadora el cual tiene su propio negocio como vive en un lugar donde se ponen las pulgas y hay muchísima gente vende muy bien y también los fines de semana trabaja en un antro.
texts.en:
Francisco L. Q. wants to start building a room in the front part of the house where he lives. The house is very small; although he has a son he does not discard the idea of being able to have more. He want to take advantage that he has less expenses at home, to start building the walls, floor and details little by little. He is a hard-working person who has his own business. He lives in an area where the flea market is, he has really good sales because there are a lot of people. He also works at a bar over the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start construction of small room

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. owns a small duck farm. She is 46 years old and has eight children. Merlinda started raising ducks 30 years ago, and has continued to do it because she thinks it is the most profitable business opportunity available to her. Today, she has 400 ducks. She and her husband, Nilo Crisostomo, manage their business as a couple, and a good deal of the income they earn goes to pay tuition and book fees at their children's schools. They are happy to have their ducks because it allows them to provide for the needs of their family.

Merlinda is requesting a loan to buy more ducklings. She will also use a portion of the loan to transport her ducks to her regular customers. 

CEVI is proud to help Merlida by providing the credit she needs to manage her business. Merlinda also receives training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita G. is a mother with determination. She has worked very hard to support her two children ever since her husband abandoned them. She and her children were barely able to survive on her little income from washing clothes for her neighbor. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to start a business and gain more income. Her membership in ASHI has impacted her life, especially her confidence. She was able to earn respect from others. She applied for this loan to buy a pig for fattening and to buy rice to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her pigpen so she can raise more pigs and she wants to continue selling rice in order to keep her regular customers. She hopes that she and her children can escape from the bondage of poverty.

loans.use: To buy a pig and rice

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana B. D. L. C. vive en el puerto D. L. Libertad, junto a su madre. Juana tiene dos hijas que se han ido del país en L. búsqueda D.  superación económica, Ahora Juana junto a su madre, que es D. un gran  un apoyo se dedican  al negocio, un pequeño comedor donD. tienen muchos, Juana ya a obtenido créditos anteriormente donD. su record crediticio es excelente, ahora elL. solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio, así aumentara su producción al igual que sus ingresos económicos.-
texts.en:
Juana B. D. L. C. lives in the L. Libertad port with her mother. Juana has two daughters who have left the country looking for a better economic situation. Now Juana and her mother, who is of great support, have a business, a small dining hall where they have many customers, Juana has already obtained loans in the past, and her record is excellent. Now she needs a new loan to invest in her business and increase her production as well as her income.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos para su negocio

location.town: Puerto de La Libertad, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Philip Ochieng

texts.en:
Philip Ochieng A. is a 30-year-old father of two children, a girl aged four years old and a boy who is two months old. Philip's wife owns a small kiosk in which she sells vegetables in the Nyalanda slum, where they live.

Philip drives a piki-piki, or motorcycle, which he shares with his brother. He is asking for a loan to purchase his own piki-piki so he can increase his income. For a ride of about 4 kilometers, he charges around 50 shillings (64 cents US). He says times are difficult because his wife is unable to sell as many vegetables as she used to, so he is supporting most of the family. Philip says he spends his free time on Sundays at church.

Philip recently joined the K-MET volunteer community health worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, he will be trained by K-MET and will visit members of his community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. His volunteering will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Motorcyle

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia Amoquando is 45 years old. She is married and has six children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working and resourceful mother.

Cynthia sells oranges in her neighborhood. She buys her oranges from farmers in nearby villages and supplies them to her customers. She peels them and arranges them on a metal stand to attract customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy more oranges to avoid frequent traveling to the farms. She hopes to increase her savings to pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called “Kronkron” (holy) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more oranges in bulk

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn O. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 40 years old. Rosalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosalyn owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is married with two children and they are all in school. Adwoa is a 42 year old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and for that matter, she is very serious about her business. 

She trades in foodstuffs like plantains. She started this business fifteen years ago and through this she has been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes with the loan she can buy bunches of plantains from the farmers, instead of through middlemen who sell retail to her at a high price.

loans.use: To buy bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Allaer

texts.ru: Аллаер Умирзоков проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. По специальности Аллаер "электрик". Аллаер более 8 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В данный момент он выращивает бахчевые растения. Кредит просит для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
36-year-old Allaer U. lives in the Kurgan-Tyurbe district. He is married with six children. By specialization, Allaer is an electrician, however, for more than eight years, he has been involved in farming. At the moment, he grows melon plants. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Irma Marleni

texts.es:
La señora IRMA MARLENI M. S., tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito deL Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco ESPERANZA DEL MAÑANA
La empresaria presenta estudios 5to de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18,16 y 8 años quienes  depende económicamente de ella.
EUIRMA  se dedica a la venta de suelas de zapatos, plantillas, cuero y pegamento para la fabricación de zapatos.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas plantas y pegamentos.
El crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas plantas, plantillas, cuero, pegamentos y también implementara las tres cabinas de locutorio con los teléfonos , tarifadotes y una computadora.
 IRMA  sueña con ampliar mas su negocio con un locutorio dentro del mismo local donde vende las suelas, plantillas, cuero y pegamentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma Marleni M. S. is 44 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir in Trujillo Province, Deparment of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank Group “Esperanza del Mañana” (Hope of Tomorrow).

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 children (ages 20, 18, 16, and 8) who are financially dependent on her. Irma sells soles, insoles, leather and adhesives used for manufacturing shoes. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy soles and adhesives.

Irma’s current loan of 1500 soles will be used to buy more soles, insoles, leather, and adhesives. She also would like to install three phone booths, a tarifador (a device that tracks usage on land line phones), and a computer. She dreams of expanding her business by adding a call center in the same location where she sells shoe manufacturing supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her inventory of shoe manufacturing supplies & purchase equipment to start a call center

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato L. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 35 years old and is single. Renato owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Renato joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Clara Esther

texts.es: La señora Clara, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 52 años, 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Se dedica a la Venta de Juanes y tamalitos (Platos típicos del País), los vende todos los días, repartiendo por las calles. Nos cuenta que lleva 03 años en el negocio y que sus ventas le salen muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena acogida y sus preparados le salen muy ricos.En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón que le pone a sus comidas.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de maíz choclo y arroz, maní en kilos, hojas de bijao, sal y bandejas mas grandes para colocar su producto.Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben T. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro. He is 31 years old. Ruben is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Ruben owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ruben has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ruben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruben is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome M. is  39 years old and happily married to a Sergeant in the Kenyan military. She is a mother of two, Mwokofu who is in class six and Kasele who is in class two.

Salome has a contract to transport plastics from Mombasa to Nairobi and does it twice per month. She has been in this business for 6 years. Salome is accessing her first loan from KADET and she intends to purchase more stock and to transport stock to Nairobi.

One day, she hopes to become a manufacturer of plastics in Mombasa city.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase more stock of plastics and to transport them to Nairobi.

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mr. Sophak C., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Thida Maung, age 24, live along National Road Number six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have a two-year-old son. They are both shown in the photograph.

Sophak has been driving a motor taxi from his village to the local market for over 2 years, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for over 2 months. Unhappily, Sophak’s motorbike is old and doesn’t work well, so he is applying for a loan of $400 to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace his old one

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina L. is engaged in hog raising business. According to her, feed is consumed rapidly by her hogs. She wants to borrow a loan of at least PHP 4,000 to help her purchase a supply of feed, which costs more than a thousand for each sack. This amount will be very helpful in sustaining the needs of her hogs. Gina hopes that her business will grow and have more development someday. She hopes that the number of her hogs will increase through the assistance of KIVA lenders.

Gina is a married business woman and has school-aged children. They live together happily in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. Gina’s husband is also very cooperative and industrious. Her agricultural business is doing good and is also a big help to their family.

loans.use: To purchase supply of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Jamileh
