texts.en: Jamileh is a 57-year-old married woman with one child. She works as a tailor to help her husband to provide better life conditions for their family. She has been involved in this business for the past 23 years. Today, Jamileh is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine to replace her used one.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. Since 2005, she has been making and selling detergent at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make a profit of about US $4.00 every day. Her husband is a bus driver for a private company. On average, he is able to make US $2.00 in profits each day. Sok S. is asking for a loan of US $1000.00 to purchase materials to make detergent.

loans.use: Buy materials to make detergent.

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Z. Anne-Marie est née le 06 Octobre 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à BOVIS Modeste, un peintre, Anne-Marie est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, depuis environs 6 ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Anne-Marie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a trois ans que Anne-Marie s'est mise à vendre du riz et du jus de bissap à Allada. Anne-Marie vend également des glacières. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Anne-Marie fait ses achats. Anne-Marie a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Anne-Marie désire augmenter le volume de son activité, et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; ce qui lui permettra d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. C'est ce qui amène Anne-Marie à solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Anne-Marie Z. was born on October 6, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Modeste Bovis, a painter, Anne-Marie is the mother of four children, all in school. For about six years the family has lived together in the Dogoudo area of the town of Allada, in the Atlantique department. The couple shares the family expenses. Anne-Marie stopped going to school at the secondary level. Three years ago Anne-Marie began selling rice and bissap juice (a hibiscus flower drink). She also sells coolers (ice chests). Anne-Marie gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Anne-Marie has already received two loans through Alidé which have both been paid back. Anne-Marie would like to build up her business and better serve her customers, which would permit her to increase her income. This is what has led Anne-Marie to request a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 bags of rice, 12 coolers, bissup packets and leaves

loans.name: Twekambe Candiru Alice Group

texts.en: C. Alice is twenty-five years old and representing her small group. She is a single business lady blessed with three children, of whom one is in schooling. She is carrying out an art and craft business making different types of mats for sale. She has stayed in her business for a year now. She is using the loan to purchase materials (sisals, colors, bamboo leaves, and so forth) for making mats. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to prosper and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase materials (sisals, colors, bamboo leaves, and so forth) for making mats.

loans.name: Gudalupa Mercedes

texts.es: Guadalupe Mercedes tiene 40 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, como madre responsable debe buscar la manera de mejorar las condiciones de vida. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, ella tiene que proporcionarle lo necesario como es la vestimenta y el pan de cada día. Inicio hace 6 años por cuenta propia porque no tenía un trabajo ella poseía mucha fortaleza esto la motivo a establecer una pulpería, al inicio Guadalupe no tenía la experiencia en este negocio, pero eso lo fue obteniendo con el paso del tiempo. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Mercedes, 40, has a min-market. As a responsible mother, she needs to look for the way to improve their living conditions. She is raising two children. She needs to provide them with the necessities like clothing and their daily bread. She started on her own six years ago because she did not have a job. She had a lot of strength, and this motivated her to establish a mini-market. At the start, Guadalupe did not have experience in this business. But, with the passage of time she was acquiring experience. She is asking for this loan to buy raw material. She dreams of converting her mini-market into a distributorship.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en:
Tautala H. is 50 and married with 4 children (ages 13 - 29).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Tautala has 3 years of experience in this business.  Tautala needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase a fishing boat.  She plans to use the earnings from her business to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tautala joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tautala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tautala H. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik V. was born in 1973 in Ijevan city. He is married and has 3 school-aged children. Since 1992 Garik has been working as a hairdresser in his own hairdressing salon.  Garik has used his profits for his family's needs: he repaired his apartment, bought furniture for his apartment, etc. 

Garik is asking for a 900.000 AMD loan, which will allow him to repair his hairdressing salon and to buy modern hairdressing implements. 

Garik has taken loans three times from “Nor Horizon” and has never been delinquent his repayments.

loans.use: To repair his hairdressing salon and to buy modern hairdressing implements

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 49 and married with four children. She sells firewood a — business she loves because of the one-on-one interaction with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more firewood to sell and to expand her business. As a hard working woman with the determination to excel, she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. Mercy says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fire woods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more beverages for her restaurant

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 22 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de su hermana menor.
Pese a su corta edad, esta joven agricultora casi no descansa, pues tiene muchos sueños que cumplir, como por ejemplo: llegar a ser profesional. Para lograrlo, todos los días trabaja desde la madrugada y tres veces por semana se dirige al mercado mayorista de su ciudad para empezar con la comercialización de papas, pues vende al por mayor a los minoristas de la ciudad.
La venta debe empezar desde muy temprano, ya que hay bastante competencia y los minoristas solo compran muy temprano, los otros días se dedica al cuidado y vigilancia de sus cultivos de papa, para esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de su familia, pues juntos buscan progresar cada día. 
Para más adelante, tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ganancias y aumentar su producción.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Magdalena tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para la siguiente siembra.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 22, lives with her parents and her younger sister. Despite her age, this young farmer almost never rests. She has a lot of dreams to fill: a professional career, for example. To realize her dreams, she gets up early to work. Three times a week, she goes to the wholesale market in her city to buy potatoes which she then sells to local retail stores. The work starts early because there is a lot of competition and retailers only buy in the early morning. Other days she works caring for her potato crop, work for which she can count on her family to help since they all want to get ahead. For the future, she is planning on planting more potatoes so that she can increase her production and, in turn, her earnings. This is Magdalena's fifth MFP loan and she is very grateful to everyone who has made it possible for her to continue her business. She will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer to prepare her land for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Ezekiel Tallam

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 60 years old and is married to Kobilo C.. They have eight children: Simon (30 years old; O-level graduate), Johnstone ( 26 years old ; O-level graduate), William (24 years old; O-level graduate), Gladys (22 years old; student), Jepchumba (18 years old; student), Jeruto (14 years old; student), Eric (28 years old, O-level graduate) and Jemutai (20 years old, student).

Ezekiel operates a hotel (restaurant) which he started four years ago and earns a monthly profit of Ksh 2,000 from this business. His farm also supplements what he earns from the hotel.

Ezekiel has borrowed Ksh 24,000 from KADET. He will use the loan to cultivate his farm, buy maize seed and fertilizer, and purchase fungicides and pesticides.

Ezekiel has not borrowed from another source before KADET. Existing clients introduced him to KADET.

If this loan boosts his business, Ezekiel will use the extra profit to expand his horticultural business and educate his children to higher levels. His dreams and hopes are to buy a tractor for cultivation and also become a dairy farmer. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seed, fertilizer, fungicide and pesticide

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma A., 37, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Happily married to Edito A., a driver, they are blessed with two children. Vilma makes sure that she helps her husband's earnings so that their family can have a better life. She has been in the fruit vending business for quite some time now.

Vilma has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than six years. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means that she has been able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business. 

To ensure the success of her business, Vilma would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital in the expanding business by buying different kinds of fruit to sell.

Vilma dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to sell

loans.name: Ruben Adriel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “ ESMERALDA”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente ala provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Rubén;   él tiene 25 años de edad, él socio es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 1 año y 18 meses, él socio se dedica al transporte, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto. 

Él  socio valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “Esmeralda” Community Bank. He lives in the San Sebastián District that belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Our member is Mr. Ruben. He is 25 years old. He has a domestic partner and a one-year-old child. Our member is a driver. He is asking for this loan in order to buy tires for his car. Our member values and is infinitely grateful for the help offered from the bank. He promises to repay the loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is asking for this loan in order to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Miurell Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Miurell Raquel M. L., es una joven de 22 años casada y su esposo labora como transportista,  apoyándole en los gastos que se incurren en el hogar, ella se trabaja como domestica en casas privadas desde hace 4 años.

Ellos son una familia de escasos recursos y uno de sus principales necesidades esta la remodelación de su vivienda, sobre todo que se acerca la temporada de lluvia, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan las edificaciones de un muro en su hogar, esta inversion le garantizara una mayor seguridad y las comodidades necesarias para habitar en un ambiente optimo y digno para todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Miurell is a 22-year old married woman. Her husband works as a truck driver, and to support the household's expenses, Miurell has been employed as a domestic worker in private homes for 4 years. They are a family of scarce resources and with the rainy season coming, one of their most pressing needs is to remodel their home. Therefore, the family solicits a loan for the purchase of construction materials to erect a new wall in their home. This investment will guarantee all of the members of Miurell's family more security and the comfort of living in a decent environment.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to remodel the home by adding a wall

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith R. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 52 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Judith joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 35 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 1. He has been selling electrical goods for ten years. He was previously employed and went into business so as to earn enough income to support his family.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Johnstone has been able to save his money. He has also become focused in his business and, so far, he has managed to employ two people.

Johnstone has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to his stock of electrical goods for resale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of electrical goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in his shop and purchase items needed to progress his business

loans.name: Maji Manuel

texts.es:
Maji de 38 años, tiene un local de comida típicas, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijas y a su esposa que le ayuda en el local. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el comenzó a trabajar vendiendo legumbres en el mercado llamado “Montebello”, poco a poco con los ingresos generados y ayuda de su esposa pudo alquilar un local para tener su negocio de comidas típicas.  Ahora el trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere pagar la pensión escolar de sus dos hijos y algunos libros. En el futuro quiere terminar de construí su casa y tener su negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Maji, 38, has a typical fast food stand. He lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso, Guayaquil. He has two daughters and his wife helps out in the eatery. Due to the lack of employment opportunities he started out selling vegetables in the Montebello Market. Gradually, with profits generated here and help from his wife he was able to rent a locale to set up his typical fast food business. Now he’s open for business from 6:30am until 10pm. He wants to use the loan to pay for his children’s school fees and some textbooks. In the future, he’d like to finish building his house and have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his children's tuition and textbooks.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito de Mórrope un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en pequeñas areas rurales que distan mucho entre si. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral desde hace cinco años, el cría sus animales en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que visitan la zona. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero en la municipalidad de su distrito. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para sostener la economia de su familia.

Actualmente desea adquirir mas aves y alimento balanceado para poder implementar su negocio de crianza y venta. Esto le permitira ampliar sus ventas y percbir mayores ganancias que utilizará en el progreso de su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Nestor es una persona responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de los suyos. Anteriormente ya ha tenido un préstamo con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nestor is a 32 year old father. He lives with his wife and their three children in the Mórrope district. This district is characterized as having the majority of its population concentrated in small rural areas that are distant from one another. It is located in the Lambayeque province and is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Nestor has been raising and selling poultry for five years. He raises his animals in an area in the back of his house. When they are big enough he sells them to his neighbors and the merchants that visit the area. Additionally, he works as a laborer for the municipality in his district. The money that he earns from these activities supports his family. Currently, he would like to acquire more birds and balanced feed in order to be able to increase his sales and earn a better wage that he will use to help his family get ahead. To achieve his goal he has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa. Nestor is a responsible person that always ensures the well-being and development of those close to him. He has had a previous loan with Edpyme Alternativa and has shown that he is punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed and more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 38 years old. Luzminda is married and has 6 children. Her eldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 2 months. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzminda has been engaged in farming for over 20 years.

Luzminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth O. is 35 years old and married to Lydia Auma; they have five children who are all under 18 years old. They live in Kisumu city.

Kenneth has a business for making bricks and has been doing it for the past four years. He has a huge clientele as many building construction companies order from him. He is in dire need of working capital to be able to meet the demand of his customers. He intends to use the money to buy materials for making the bricks. His monthly income is Kshs 20,000. 

His desire is to venture into a chicken-rearing business to run alongside the brick business.

loans.use: Buy building materials and stone for making bricks

loans.name: Mercy Maria

texts.es:
Mercy de 42 años, tiene una pequeña farmacia en un local lejano a su casa. Vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Desde pequeña Mercy estuvo relacionada con las medicinas ya que el papa es doctor, cuando creció y tubo a sus hijos decido tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad tiene una farmacia vende productos farmacéuticos, pañales, bebidas. Trabaja sola desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm. Tiene en la farmacia aspirinas desde $ 0.25 c/u, pañales a $ 0.40 c/u, jarabes a $ 4.50 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas para su farmacia y así tener mas variedad. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa propia y tener su farmacia en otro sector para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Mercy is 42 years old, and she has a small pharmacy near her house. She lives in Primavera de Duran (an area located in the outskirts of Guayaquil).

From a young age, Mercy was familiar with medication since her father is a doctor. When she became an adult and had her children, she decided to start her own business. At present, she has a pharmacy, which sells medicines, diapers, and drinks. She works alone from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. In the pharmacy, she sells aspirin for $0.25 per unit, diapers for $0.40 per unit, and syrup for $4.50.

With this loan, she wants to buy medicine for her pharmacy so that she has more variety in her store. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and move her pharmacy to another area to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 50 years old and he is married. He has five children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old. He employs three people. Francois has been a taxi driver for fifteen years. He gets up at 5 am every day to start transporting people to their work places. He pays rent each day to the owner of the taxi.

Francois is requesting a loan to buy his own land. His goal is to send all his children to school and to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a food vending business. She lives in Purok Dalisay, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

 By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.  Juliet is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase raw materials.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Juliet aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  Her photo was taken during the center meeting because all of her food was already sold out.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for business

loans.name: Rollylyn

texts.en:
Rollylyn D. is from the village of Santa Isabel Sur. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rollylyn owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rollylyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Rollylyn joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rollylyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tikariy Quillahuata Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Tikariy Quillahuata” ya tiene 4 años de funcionamiento y está conformado por 11 mujeres y 3 varones, los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Quillahuata que está ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en esta comunidad y se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.   
 
Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores, venta de flores, venta de verduras, venta de artesanía, crianza y venta de cuyes. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de construcción de casas y asistencia social.  
 
Felicita, tiene 32 años y nació en el distrito de Colquepata provincia del Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Felicita vive junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en la comunidad de Quillahuata. Su actividad económica principal de Felicita es la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y muchas animales más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Felicita desea invertir en el capital del negocio y desea comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
The "Tikariy Quillahuata" Community Bank has been around for four years and is made up of eleven women and three men. The members are hard-working and enterprising people who are constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead and offer their children a better life through their daily hard work. The community bank meets every thirty days in the Quillahuata community, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. The majority of the members live in this community and work in livestock and agriculture.

The following are examples of the businesses of some of the members: food sales; raising small animals; flower sales; vegetable sales; crafts sales; and raising and selling guinea pigs. Other members offer home construction services and social assistance.
 
Felicita, age 32, was born in the Colquepata district, in the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco, Peru. Felicita currently lives with her husband and their five children in the Quillahuata community. Felicita's main business is raising, buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and many others. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. Felicita wants to invest in the business' capital and wants to purchase more small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.use: to purchase more small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with two grown children. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka which is a predominantly rural and agricultural region of Ukraine. Alexei owns three big greenhouses and plants 3,700 tall-growing tomato plants every year. He started the enterprise 22 years ago. Presently, Alexei has already invested 100,000 Grivnyas in this business and his annual expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 35,000 Grivnyas. 

Alexei is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to construct an additional greenhouse. A new addition will give him a chance to plant and grow more vegetables, thus increasing his harvests and income. One of Alexei’s short-term plans is to reconstruct his greenhouse for seedlings to grow better quality seedlings. He is very energetic and enthusiastic about his business. He is willing to work hard and see his venture expand and develop even further in the future.

loans.use: to construct an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Carlos Lorenzo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y  reside junto a su madre en la Ciudad de Dios en el distrito de San José ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Carlos se dedica a la actividad de carpintería su especialidad es hacer trabajos en melamine para ello cuenta con sus herramientas las cuales ha ido adquiriendo con los ingresos que obtiene de los trabajos que realiza, sus ventas son a pedido para ello cuenta con clientes que lo llaman para que les haga sus  trabajos. El ya tiene cual bien dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 3 años y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos y ayuda a su madre.

Carlos desea comprar su materia prima en este caso melamine y algunas herramientas  de modo que le permita fabricar más productos y satisfacer a sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Carlos es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y clientes, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante realizando la actividad que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Carlos is 20 years old, single and lives with his mother. They live in Ciudad de Dios area of the district of San José, which is 30 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

Carlos is a carpenter. He specializes in working with melamine, using certain tools which he bought over time with the money he earned from his work. He makes custom order pieces and this is why his customers call him to do projects for them. Carlos has been in this business for three years now and thanks to his work, he has been able to cover his financial needs and help out his mother.

Carlos would like to purchase raw materials, melamine in this case, and a few tools so that he can make more products and keep his customers happy. This is what led him to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 Peruvian nuevos soles.

Carlos is fairly well-known and well-respected by his neighbors and customers. They feel that he is a responsible person who is really motivated to keep moving forward with the work he enjoys so much.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells banku--a staple in the Ghanaian diet made from fermented corn dough--in Kokowada, Elmina. She has been in this trade for a decade. 

Married to a farmer, she has six children. They are dependent on her income to pay for school fees and household utility bills. She needs a loan to expand her business to increase her earnings. She plans to use the loan to purchase larger quantities of corn so that she can increase her banku production. The extra earnings will be used for her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business to increase her earnings

loans.name: Rasto Kimutai

texts.en:
Rasto Kimutai is 23 years old farmer and he is married to Mercy Jerop who runs a salon in the nearby trading centre. Kimutai has been in the farming business for a period of two years and his monthly income from this is Ksh 10,000.   

Kimutai has borrowed a loan of Ksh. 40,000, this being his second loan, after successfully repaying his first  loan. The money will be used to purchase one dairy cow and animal feeds. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to improve the welfare of his family and also improve his dairy farm.  
  

His future dreams are to own a motorbike which will assist him transport milk to the KCC plant.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia P. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 53 years-old. Emelia is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Emelia owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Emelia joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Maral's Group

texts.en:
Maral K., 46, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur – a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband works as a foreman, and together they have raised two sons and a daughter. The sons study at university and the daughter is at school. 

The family breeds livestock animals for making additional money. They have three cows and fifteen sheep. With money received from the loan, Maral wants to increase the number of livestock and purchase five more sheep for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five more sheep

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has been living with her family in the area of Bari Rakh in a two-room brick house for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. N., and he sells animals and milk to community clients. He is a very caring person and takes good care of his cattle. Mumtaz also provides full support to her husband in his business. She helps him milk the cows by getting up early in the morning and also gives them timely food and water. 

Besides this activity, Mumtaz carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She is the mother of three sons. All of them are young and stay at home. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo that will enable him to get larger quantities of milk and also sell it at profit. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years, and Mumtaz is hopeful that an investment will help him grow his business and make better profits. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mumtaz.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for a dairy and animal sales business.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Fatu B. (pictured in the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatu was born in Ma-Bonkeni village 47 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. 

For 14 years now, Fatu has been selling soap, magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and cooking oil. With the help of this loan, she will be able to further expand her business, make more sales and consequently improve on her living conditions.  Fatu is going to use her share of this loan to buy soaps, magi, cooking oil, etc. in large quantity to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy soaps, magi, cooking oil, etc. to resell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is taking care of three children, together with her husband. Nana sells items such as gari,plantain and cassava at a village called Nkontrodo in Cape Coast, which she has done for some time now. Her income, generated from the sale of gari, is used to help her husband feed the family. Nana will use the loan to purchase more bags of gari to supply her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari to supply her customers.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 31 years old, married and has two children. He sells charcoal and works hard in his business to provide for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money and he has been trained in business management.  
Joshua hopes to own a lorry for transporting charcoal in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Gloriosa

texts.en:
Gloriosa is 52 years old, married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gloriosa has a buy & sell dried and fresh fish business in the Philippines. Gloriosa has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

Gloriosa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gloriosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children in college..

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse has been selling boiled eggs for three years. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to interact with other business people who have given him business ideas and business management skills.

Jesse is a 25 year old married man who has a new-born child. He hopes to supply eggs by wholesale in five years. His dream is to buy a piece of land and start a poultry farm. He needs a loan of 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy eggs.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Unido Group

texts.en:
Juana Francisca, is a member of the "United" Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, is married and has 4 children who are 16 years old, 12, 7 and 18 months. She lives with them and her husband in the Calpules Community. She learned to sew clothing in school. She works alone and has many years of sewing experience which allows her to make any type of garment that her clients ask for. 

She doesn't have a fixed work schedule, since this depends a lot on the amount of orders that she has. Her main clients are her neighbors. With this loan she will purchase cloth, interlining, decorations, elastic, thread, buttons and zippers, among other things. With this loan she will be able to offer her clients a larger variety of fabrics and and is hopeful that her increased income will allow her to better help her husband pay for their children's student fees. 

Each day her biggest challenge is to take care of her youngest child while also working. Her goal is to get ahead and he able to help her children finish their studies. Juana has been a FAMA client for several loan cycles and has always paid her loans back on time. 

Translated from Spanish:

Juana Francisca, es miembro del Banco Comunal Unido, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos entre las edades de 16, 12, 7 y 1 año y medio, y junto a ellos y a su esposo reside en la Comunidad de Calpules. Ella aprendió a confeccionar ropa en una escuela donde enseñan a costurar. Las confecciones las realiza sola y tiene muchos años de experiencia costurando y eso le permite elaborar casi cualquier tipo de moda que le soliciten sus clientes y clientas. 

No tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, ya que eso depende mucho de la cantidad de encargos que tenga, y su principal clientela son sus vecinos. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar telas, entretelas, adornos, elásticos, hilos, botones, zippers, etc. Con la ayuda de este préstamo podrá ofrecer a sus clientes y clientas mayor variedad de telas y con esto espera que sus ingresos mejoren para poder ayudar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos estudiantiles de sus hijos. 

Cada día su gran desafío es cuidar a su hijo de 1 año y medio, al mismo tiempo que trabaja. Su meta es superarse y poder ayudar a sus  hijos a culminar sus estudios. Juana es clienta de FAMA desde hace varios ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es: Teófilo, de 56 años, convive con Verónica, su esposa. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Sherly y Robert. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.El tejido de sábanas, cubrecamas, chompas y tapices. Es su principal actividad, ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a este oficio, que le da muy buenas ganancias. Después de culminar sus tejidos los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Oroya y Cerro de Pasco, donde viaja 2 veces al mes. Según cuenta la habilidad que adquirió en el tejido, le permiten acabar 2 sábanas a la semana. Se siente satisfecho con los logros que está alcanzando. Pues también se dedica al trasporte de productos agrícolas en todo el país, donde trabaja por contratos, adquiriendo un dinero extra. Según cuenta esta temporada comenzó con el traslado de varias toneladas de maca. Ahora está planeando adquirir un nuevo telar (instrumento que le permite tejer), para poder dinamizar sus ventas, ya que tejerá en menor tiempo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de progreso. Además de prometer ser puntual en sus pagos. Teófilo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madejas de lana pura de alpaca en todas sus variedades. Con los cuales podrá continuar con su finos tejidos.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 56 years old and lives with Veronica, his wife. They have 2 children, Sherly and Robert and live as a family in their own house, located in the locality of San Pedro de Cajas. Teofilo weaves sheets, bedspreads, sweaters, and upholstery fabric. He has dedicated himself to this work for the past 11 years and it has become his principal activity, providing very good earnings.

Upon completion of his weavings, he sells them in cities like Ayacucho, Oroya, and Cerro de Pasco, which he visits twice monthly. With his acquired ability as a weaver, he finishes 2 sheets per week. Teofilo feels very satisfied with what he has achieved.

Teofilo also transports agricultural products all over the country, working under contracts, to acquire extra money. He says he began this season transporting several tons of maca [a Peruvian root with purported medicinal value]. 

At present, Teofilo plans to acquire a new weaving machine, in order to dynamically increase his sales, since he will be able to complete a weaving in less time.

Teofilo belongs to the “Corazon de San Pedro” (Heart of Saint Peter) Communal Bank and this is his first loan with MFP. He is grateful for this opportunity for progress and he pledges to be punctual in his payments.

With this loan Teofilo will buy bundles of pure alpaca wool in all it varieties, with which he will be able to continue to produce his fine weaving.

loans.use: to buy bundles of pure alpaca wool in all its varieties to use in his weaving.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Sonia has a food shop that sells viands like chicken adobo & pancit bihon.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for her food shop.

Sonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for food shop

loans.name: Almira's Group

texts.en:
Almira is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she is raising two daughters and a son. The older daughter and the son are at school and the younger daughter is not yet school age. Thirteen years ago, Almira inherited two cows from her dad and since then has been engaged in livestock breeding. Almira applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase three sheep for breeding. She wants to increase her number of farm animals. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 43-year-old widowed woman. She has four children aged between 17 and 23. She describes herself as resolute. 
Rosa operates a greengrocery store. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a trading center and her primary customers are householders. She describes her biggest business challenges to be fluctuating sales, high transport costs, and inadequate supplies. She will use her 50,000 KES loan to add to her greengrocery stock. Her business goal is to open a wholesale grocery store in town within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase and develop a plot of land.

loans.use: to restock her greengrocery store.

loans.name: Faridah Nabukera's Group

texts.en:
Faridah's group is comprised of 3 hard-working women. Faridah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and expand her business and take care of her family.  Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big boutique shop. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faridah's future prospects by helping her to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Eva De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Eva de 50 años, es una mujer soltera que ha sabido cómo salir adelante con sus hijos

Ella empezó su negocio hace 10 años que está ubicado en la parte de afuera de su casa, su negocio es una mini tienda que ah podido agrandar con la ayuda de Dios.

Ella necesita este préstamo para invertir en su negocio y la compra de víveres como: leche, huevos, queso, etc.

El sueño de ella es tener un local propio para su mini tienda y que su negocio aumente cada día más con la ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
Eva is 50 years old, single, and a woman who has learned how to come through for her children.

She began her business ten years ago and it is located in the front of her home. Her business is a mini shop that she has expanded with the help of God. 

She needs this loan in order to stock her business and plans to buy supplies such as milk, eggs, cheese and other items.

Her dream is to have her own location for her mini shop, and that her business grows more every day with the help of God.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, drinks and other products

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 24 years old with 2 small children.  After accessing loans from SEDA credit program in 2008, she invested in developing a small mechanical work shop. However, in her free time, she went to market to buy some fruit to sell. This helped her have extra money to spend for daily expenditures. Since 2009 she decided to invest strongly in this kind of business. For her latest loan cycle she received a loan of 8,288,000 VND. She bought a variety of fruits and earned big revenue. 

Currently, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in selling fresh fruits.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is an embroidery expert, and she also sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and has learned this art from her mother. Now, by using her skills, she supports her husband and earns reasonably good profits every month. Her husband is a bus conductor. He travels to different areas and mostly remains away from home.

Nasreen is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works while 2 of her remaining 3 children are enrolled in school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sewing business. With the loan investment, she will purchase a new sewing machine, because her current machine doesn't produce good quality work. The new sewing machine will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for the past many years, and she is very confident that her business will be more successful after an investment.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Kaitikei

texts.en:
Kaitikei is 32-years-old. He is married and together they have two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twelve years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. He has been a good client, he repaid his previous loan well and this will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Né en 1966 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Daouda est marié et père de six enfants, il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Fama un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso
Monsieur Daouda est un réparateur de profession des moulins depuis plus de dix huit. Aussi il dispose de son propre moulin pour ses prestations et il mène en parallèlement à son métier, l’achat-vente des pièces détachées et des moulins casses. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant une année et avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Il compte acheter avec ce premier prêt,  5 moulins casse à farine, 5 moulins casse à décortiqueuse et des pièces de rechanges. Ces moulins casses seront détachés en pièces  sur place à travers leurs démontage  pour être vendues par pièces dans son atelier.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Sikasso, Daouda is married with six children. He lives with his wife and children in a large traditional extended family in Fama, a working-class neighborhood in Sikasso.

Daouda has worked at repairing mills for more than eighteen years.  He also has his own mill, and along with his repair work, he buys and sells broken mills and spare parts for mills. He is much sought after by his customers for the quality of his products.

In order to satisfy his ever increasing clientele, one year ago he decided to join the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is obtaining his first individual loan.

With this loan, he intends to buy five broken flour mills, five broken huller mills and spare parts. These broken mills will be dismantled on site so that the parts can be sold in his workshop.

As a result of this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, which he will use to increase his business capital, contribute to the family's expenses and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy broken mills and spare parts.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush lives with her husband and two children. The family gets its main income from keeping cattle and land cultivation. The current number of income does not incur enough income for Anush to save for her children's education in the future. This loan will help Anush to increase the number of cattle, as well as to purchase seeds to cultivate the land. Anush will get additional income and insure better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and seeds

loans.name: Agot

texts.en:
Agot is 30-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan, for four years.

Agot is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, salt, and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY YUNGAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados, ella los hace engordar y luego los vende en las distintas ferias del distrito de Anta, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un ganado.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of Señor de Ccoyllorty Yungaqui Communal Bank, located in the Anta District which is part of the province of Anta and the department of Cusco.

Maruja is 37 years old and has a live-in partner and four children. She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling livestock. She fattens them and later sells them at the various fairs in the Anta District. She works from 8am to 6pm and this business serves as a means for her to get her children ahead. Her dream is to expand her business buying and selling livestock. She is requesting this loan to purchase livestock.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 26 años, convive con Mari, la madre de sus 2 hijos: Gaby de 6 años y Michez de 2. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Villa María en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Arturo se dedica a la agricultura. En los terrenos de cultivos que sus padres y la comunidad les ha asignado siembra: café, plátanos y maíz. Estos 3 productos son rentables, depende como él los negocie y trabaje. Pero se centra más en el cultivo de café. En una parcela entera tiene sembrados éstos granos tan demandados por los compradores.
Tiene que abonar sus plantas cada 6 meses, para asegurar su crecimiento y formación de los granos. 
Aparte de vender los granos secos, también los vende molidos y embolsados. Esta actividad inicia en el mes de enero. Sus compradores son personas que vienen de visita hacia su comunidad y se llevan bolsas de café listas para consumir. Arturo es emprendedor. Es así que ahora piensa extender sus sembríos sembrando más café, de esa manera podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida necesaria. Sería la primera vez que Arturo recibiría un préstamo de MFP, por eso muestra firmeza al mencionar que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Los productores Yaneshas”, es su reciente banco comunal, siente que en grupo sus logros serán mayores. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 10 bolsas de abonos para fertilizar las tierras del café. Así asegurará una buena cosecha para junio y julio.
texts.en:
Arturo, 26, lives with Mari, the mother of his two children: Gaby, 6 and Michez, 2. This family lives in their own house in the indigenous community of Villa María in Chanchamayo Province.  Arturo is a farmer.  On his parents’ land and on land assigned to him by the community he grows coffee, bananas and corn.  These three products are profitable depending on how he negotiates and works them.  But he concentrates on coffee production the most.  He has an entire parcel planted with these beans that are in such high demand by buyers.  He has to fertilize his plants every six months to insure their growth and the formation of the coffee beans.

Besides selling dry beans, he also sells them ground and bagged.  This activity starts in the month of January.  His buyers are people who come to visit his community and take bags of ready to be consumed coffee.  Arturo is an entrepreneur and is thinking about extending his fields planting more coffee to give his family the necessary quality of life.  

This will be Arturo’s first MFP loan and he’s firm in mentioning that he will be punctual with his installment payments.  His communal bank is called “Los Productores Yaneshas” (Yaneshas Producers) and he believes that his accomplishments will be greater in the group.  He will use the money from the loan to buy 10 sacks of organic manure to fertilize his coffee fields thus insuring a good harvest in June and July.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Zhyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 40 лет, имеет 5 детей, замужем. Жылдызкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес с 2008 года. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 9 овец, 2 козы, также есть 0,50 ГА поливной земли, где растет картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота, за счет покупки ягнят. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zhyldyzkan is 40 years old, has five children, and is married. Zhyldyzkan rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family, having started her business in 2008. Thanks to Zhyldyzkan's hard work, today she has two cows, nine sheep, and two goats, and she also has 0.5 hectares of irrigated land where she grows potatoes. In order to further develop her business, Zhyldyzkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying some lambs. Zhyldyzkan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing the size of her herd, and also wants to save up to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some lambs in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Mrs. Dorcas I. is 40 years old. She lives in the semi-urban of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells her goods to people in her environment. She is married with seven (7) children.

She is a dedicated client of LAPO. According to her, if given the sum of $250 her business will improve.

loans.use: To buy more food for sales in the store

loans.name: Faleseu

texts.en: Faleseu R. is from the village of Nofoalii.  Her business project is sewing her family clothes and clothes for other people.  She is very happy about the talent that she has because it helps her to contribute to the needs of her family.  She is a woman of many talents, but her best talent is sewing.  She intends to use her loan to buy tools to fix her machine, as well as needles and everything that she needs to improve her business.  She believes that she will become a good businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tools for maintaining her machine and additional stock of fabrics

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.en:
Marco is originally from Zacatecas. He is married with 3 children, ages 11, 9, and 3. His wife works at home, caring for their children. He began his business 9 years ago. At the time he was unemployed, but he had a wife and a son to support, and another child on the way. So he and his wife decided to start a bakery in their home. The business has grown and earned a reputation in the neighborhood. Their son occasionally helps out in the family business.

Marco is asking for a $375 loan to buy raw materials. This will help increase production and sales. He hopes to sell his baked goods at other outlets, and thereby grow his business. He plans to repay the loan in 6-12 months. He looks forward to your support and he and his family thank you.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco es originario de Zacatecas, esta casado y tiene tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años respectivamente, su esposa no trabaja y se dedica a su hogar y al cuidado de los hijos. Inicio su negocio hace nueve años, ya que estando casado no conseguía empleo y con un hijo y una esposa que mantener, sumándole un segundo hijo en camino, junto con su esposa decidieron dedicarse a la repostería en su hogar y ofrecer sus productos a las personas. Actualmente el negocio ha ido creciendo y se ha hecho conocido, por ello en ocasiones lo ayuda su hijo mayor.

Esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 325 para comprar materia prima, lo que le permitirá incrementar su producción, y podrá tener mayores ventas, ya que su idea es vender a otras tiendas a comisión y así seguir creciendo con su negocio, ofrece pagar este crédito en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses y cuenta con el apoyo de todos ustedes y junto con su familia se los agradece.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en: Zarif is 29 years old. He is educated, married and has 2 children. His wife does not work and stays home to look after their children. He works on a farm in Dekhkan, where he has the opportunity to breed cattle. He also has several gobies (fish) and cows. He has 10 years work experience and he likes his job. On the photo, you can see his pride – a tribal ox. By local measure, it is a very big ox, and Zarif is going to continue to breed it. Now is the season for cultivating hay and raising cattle. Zarif would like to get a loan to breed cattle and gobies.

loans.use: To breed cattle and gobies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia has been living in this house for over 14 years. She still lives here with her husband and 4 kids. For the past few years, she has had to take become the mainstay of the family's economic survival, as her husband hasn't had a steady job for quite some time! Occasionally he works as a hired hand in agricultural duties (the area has a lot of cocoa farming, and there's a need for laborers at the time of hand-picking of this precious fruit! He now works assisting her in her clothing sales, by delivering the goods and doing some collections himself! 

The clothing Antonia sells comes from “pacas” (or packs of pressed new and used clothing which Dominicans can buy from donations to the poor on the Haitian side of the island, which the people bring over to the Dominican Republic in order to sell them and thus, be able buy food and groceries). “Pacas” come in at least three types: Type A, B and C. Type A packs are mostly of “premium” goods, as they contain new items, often from signature brands, and which command a ‘premium’ price, for obvious reasons. On type A’s (worth between USD$300 to $400) there is more income to be made, as they can be sold to a higher income bracket customer. However, Antonia tells us thus far she has only been able to buy type B “pacas” (worth some USD$250 to $300 mainly dependent upon the composition and proportion of the new/used portions of clothing to be found on them) which is obviously of a lower quality from those on the type A group. Finally the type C “pacas” (costing anywhere from USD$100 to $250, each) are the cheapest, obviously consisting of used clothing or new of lower quality. “Paca” buyers must trust their intermediaries, as the insides are not able to be seen until the packs are opened. Normally the “pacas” are opened and sold on a piece by piece fashion, which will bring the largest return on the sales. However, those go to the Haiti-Dominican Rep. border in order to buy the “pacas”, as Antonia does, can buy them at lower prices than those that might be found in or near the cities, such as Santo Domingo. The trip to the border costs somewhere in the neighborhood of USD$25-30 each way, expensive, but there’s no other way… Of course, both the sacrifice as well as the cost is recuperated a few times over, once the “paca” buyer has been able to do the purchasing and transportation to the end market’s territory. The unopened “pacas” can command up to three times the value over their original cost once brought into the final market areas, as the owner/buyer is able to maintain the quality standards customary to their customers. But most prefer to have the larger income product, which may be brought in selling them piecemeal! 

Antonia wishes to be able to have her kids grow, become good citizens and show their love for the country! This she plans making via sufficient income in order to be able to pay for their transportation, and daily needs with school. She’s never had a type A “pack”, as she’s only been able to pay for a maximum of the “B’s” value. Eventually, she’ll be able to buy the As type, as she’ll receive more good and larger loans.

loans.use: Antonia will now be able to buy more "pacas" which she expects to need on a weekly basis, as opposed to her now bi-weekly capability. As well, she plans to eventually upgrade her purchasing capacity to the A packs. (see explanation below)

loans.name: María Altagracia

texts.en:
From the past five years, Maria has been one of the most successful businesswomen of her community. She sells clothes, tablecloths, curtains, shoes, and also natural medicines. She has been separated from her husband for six years. Since then she has had to struggle to provide education and food for her only child, a16-year-old son.

As she lives close to a wharf, Maria buys clothing in bulk from merchant ships at very good prices and resells her products some distance away, so that the business can generate good profit. With money earned from her sales activity, she pays for her rented house, goes shopping, and buys books and notebooks for her son. The entrepreneur has requested a loan to buy bulk clothing because she is presently in short supply and her customers need clothes. The loan will help this 47- year- old woman continue with her business so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of bulk clothing in order to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en: Muhabat M. has sold bedspreads for over 5 years. She is married and has 4 children. Her business is located in Spitamen, Tadjikistan, in the big clothes market. She sells her goods at a high rate and she has many constant clients. Her trading place is profitable as it is situated in the center of the market. Every day, she helps her clients enthusiastically and they continue to be satisfied with the quality of her goods.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Mrs. Margarita A. is 35 years old, a widow and a mother of two girls (one in high school and the youngest in grade school). They all live in a humble home which is also where their small business is located.

Margarita and her two daughters manage a small restaurant that feeds the workers of a nearby wood processing plant. Together they offer a varied menu of home cooked meals, salads, desserts and drinks..all made to order. From the year 2000 (when her husband passed away), she started this business to be able to feed and educate her two daughters. Now she wants to improve her small business and offer a more varied menu.

The need to survive provided Margarita with the strength to overcome her tragic loss and taught her children a valuable lesson in how to face the challenges which we face in our lives. Their mother is a role model of valor and committment.

The money requested will be used to purchase stock for the restarurant such as: soft drinks, beer, ciders, wine, ice cream, and meats.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, beer, ciders, wine, ice cream, and meats

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Maria M. sells tortillas and food which she prepares by hand in her home, later taking them to the market in the main terminal to sell. She prepares many local dishes, the most popular is a dish called nacatamal and her tortillas.

She has had her business for 15 years, starting it with her small savings which she got from her mother. She began selling her food outside the market until she was able to secure a stand inside.

The most important thing she needs now is to purchase stock and materials for her business; corn, charcoal and ingredients to make her tortillas and other dishes. Ceprodel has lent a helping hand in growing this business, with a total of 8 loans which have had a great impact on her business.

La actividad de la sra. Maria M. es la venta de tortillas y comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado la Terminal preparando variedad de platillos siendo los mas demandados el nacatamal y las tortillas.

Tiene 15 años de tener su negocio y se inició con un monto inicial de C$2,000 producto de ahorros personales que almacenaba cuando su madre le regalaba. Ella inició vendiendo estos alimentos en las afueras del mercado al aire libre hasta que logro conseguir su local en el mercado la Terminal.

La mayor necesidad que atraviesa actualmente la señora M. es que debe de adquirir el maíz, carbón y leña para realizar las tortillas y los nacatamales. Por tal razón acude a Ceprodel quien le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio con un total de 8 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS AND MATERIALS FOR HER SMALL STAND IN THE MARKET.  SHE NEEDS INGREDIENTS TO MAKE HER TORTILLAS AND OTHER LOCAL DISHES.

loans.name: Mwazani

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year old Mwazani M., who is married with one child, aged 3.
In 2004, Mwazani established a general store. Working seven days a week, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $45 per month from this business. She now requests a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stocks of juice, milk, ice cream, rice, beans, and biscuits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $85. In the future, Mwazani also plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of juice, milk, ice cream, rice, beans, and biscuits for her general store.

loans.name: Fernanda's Group

texts.es:
This group is currently in its fifth cycle of the program “group of entrepreneurial women” whose objectives are to accomplish that the women, in unity, have the ability to work in their trade, obtain good sales and greater earnings, increase their sales and be able to save money, and also to increase the solidarity and entrepreneurialism of Paraguayan women.

This group is made up of 15 women 10 of whom are founding members of the group. These women generate income through various types of businesses among them the sale of groceries, fruits, vegetables, some have pantries, others sell clothing and jewelry and others (the majority) dedicate themselves to recycling.

These women’s desire to move ahead is admirable and is evidenced by the determination that each of them dedicates to their daily work. As a group, these women are very responsible in paying their fees and in saving.

The loan that each one of these women will receive will be used to invest in their businesses by purchasing goods such as sugar, milk, canned goods, soft drinks and the purchase of ingredients to make meals, such as meat, vegetables, fruits and also for the purchase of recycling goods such as glass bottles, plastics and paper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité se encuentra actualmente en su quinto ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” cuyo objetivo es lograr que todas unidas puedan trabajar en sus oficios, obtener buenas ventas y mayores ingresos, capacitación para poder vender más y para ahorrar dinero, además de fomentar la solidaridad y emprendedurismo de las mujeres paraguayas.

Esta conformado por 15 mujeres, de las cuales 10 son las que forman parte del grupo desde sus inicios.
