As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marlene, de 25 años es una joven dedicada al comercio de calzado y mercería, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, residen en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután;  ella aprendió a vender con su madre hace 8 años, pero actualmente tiene su propio negocio en el mercado municipal, lo atiende de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo pues necesita comprar zapatos para la venta como: tenis, sandalias, también juguetes y cosméticos como maquillajes para dama. Ella quiere realizar esta compra porque su compromiso de comerciante es tener siempre para los clientes todo lo necesario en su caso relacionado a calzado, cosméticos y juguetes.
Las aspiraciones de Marlene es cada día fortalecer el negocio, dar excelente atención a los clientes, y contribuir al progreso de su familia, en especial en el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlene is 25 years old.  Her business is selling shoes and sewing supplies.  She lives with her husband and two children, aged 6 and 4, in Jucuapa, in Usulután department.  She learned to sell from her mother 8 years ago and she now has her own business in the town market, where she works from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

Marlene is requesting a loan as she needs to buy shoes to sell such as sneakers and sandals.  She would also like to buy toys and cosmetics such as women's make-up.  She would like to make these purchases because her commitment as a saleswoman is to always have everything available for her customers, in her case this means footwear, cosmetics and toys.

Marlene's aspirations are to strengthen her business every day, to provide her customers with excellent customer service and to contribute to her family's progress, especially that of her children.

loans.use: To buy footwear such as sneakers and sandals.  To buy toys and cosmetics

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era una niña aprendió a trabajar en la tierra, sembrando y cuidando de las plantas que era productos para su sostenibilidad familiar, y hasta en la actualidad es la fuente de ingresos económicos más importante. Por otro lado, también vende productos alimenticios como: maca, mashua, olluco entre otros, permitiéndole tener más ventas al por mayor en las ferias comerciales de su localidad. Siempre trabajo al lado de su esposa y sus hijos durante 10 años, y eso le ha dado la ventaja de tener una economía estable, y por ello continuará adelante con esta actividad, con la meta de comprar más terrenos para cultivar. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento y motivado de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en: Tito is 38 years old and he lives with his wife and three children in a house of their own. Since he was a boy he learned to work the fields, sowing and taking care of the plants that would produce the products that would support the family. And until today it continues to be his most important source of income. Concurrently, he also sells food products, such as: maca tubers, mashua tubers, and potatoes. This gives him the opportunity to sell more in wholesale at the fairs in his community. For the last 10 years he has worked alongside his wife and children and this has given them the advantage of a steady family economy. For this reason he will continue working his business, with the goal of purchasing more land to cultivate. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is very happy and motivated to know that he has financial support. He is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute towards the loan he requests. It will be very useful for the progress of his business. With the loan he requests, he will invest in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next growing season.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jean Claude  Alfred

texts.fr:
Client de 49ans marié et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie de 08ans à 20ans. En 2009 il ouvre son salon de coiffure homme. 
Avec ce prêt il compte renforcer son stock en achetant des tendeuses, des ventilateurs, des paires de ciseaux, des peignes, poudre, multiples brosses. 
Ses ambitions sont de rendre son salon de coiffure plus spacieux ainsi qu’avoir 2  autre salon de coiffure.
Pour sa famille il compte assurer être capable à scolariser ses enfants ainsi qu’assurer leur vie sociale et leur quotidien.
texts.en:
Jean Claude Alfred B. is 49 years old, married, and the father of five children, aged 8 to 20. In 2009, he opened his hair salon for men. With this loan, he intends to bolster his stock by purchasing clippers, fans, scissors, combs, powders, and several brushes.

He ambitions to make his current salon more spacious, and to open two additional ones. For his family, he wants to be able to send his children to school as well as to ensure their social and daily life.

loans.use: to buy clippers, fans, scissors, combs, powders, and several brushes

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas J. is from the village of New Compostela, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 44 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Tomas owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Tomas has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Tomas joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Tomas is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold G. is 47 years old, married, and has one child who attends college. They live in a rented apartment in Narantuul area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital Mongolia. His wife is disabled and must stay home all day. Ganbold manages a public transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2000. Since then he has worked hard to stabilize and expand his business. His daily earning is 60,000 MNT and he pays 12,500 MNT to his conductors. He is one of the reliable and safe drivers amongst his colleagues. He is an honest man who says, "I want to have my own apartment in the near future." He is requesting a loan for 2,000,000 MNT  to pay his daughter's college tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Doris R. tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, viven en casa de un hermano y se dedica a la elaboracion de pan casero y rosquillas, con dicha actividad a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, darles educacion, vestuario y alimentacion, ademas en la epoca de invierno compra lecha para elaborar cuajada y queso, Vilma es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos
de salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una estufa industrial para elaborar pupusas.
texts.en:
Vilma Doris R. is 32 years old, a single mother, and has three dependent children. They live at her brother’s house and she works making homemade bread and rosquillas (a ring-shaped pastry). Through her work in this business, she has been able to get her children ahead, providing them with an education, clothing and food. Additionally, she buys milk during the winter to make cheese curd and cheese. Vilma is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy an industrial stove to make pupusas (a traditional Honduran dish).

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly currently sells cooking oil and soap.  She is 28 years old and married, with 3 children, all of whom go to school.

 Lilly requested a loan to stock more cooking oil and soap to sell. She hopes to pay for her children's schooling and buy a car in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves tiene 29 años es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella es una cliente antigua de la institución y ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y cortés en la evaluación que se le hizo. La señora Nieves y su esposo Vidal se dedican al transporte y venta de agua, ellos llevan agua en su carro a diferentes pueblitos de la ciudad del Cusco donde no hay mucha agua. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a la venta de agua y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Nieves requiere el microcrédito para hacer mantenimiento del carro ya que es la única fuente de ingreso económico pues tiene que estar en buen estado para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Nieves is 29 years old, married, and the fruit of her relationship is her three children. She is a long time client of the institution and she has demonstrated a determination to make her payments. She was kind and courteous at the time of evaluation. Nieves and her husband, Vidal, transport and sell water. They carry water in their car to different communities in their city of Cusco where there isn't very much water. She has been selling water for 7 years and it has been successful thanks to the care she invests in her business. Nieves requires a loan to carry out maintenance repairs to her car. It is their only source of income and the car must be in a good state of repair to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to her car.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants, Afi est mariée à un électronicien. Pour joindre les deux bouts et  épauler son conjoint dans l’éducation de leur enfant, elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure en 2006  après sa formation de coiffeuse. Elle est âgée de 32 ans et d’une bonne réputation, pour  s’assurer du gain journalier elle vend divers article comme les produits de beauté et des chaussures. Ce troisième prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter le stock existant. Ses provisions se font sur place.
texts.en: A mother of three, Afi is married to an electronics technician. To make ends meet and support her spouse for her children's education, she opened her hair salon in 2006 after training as a hairdresser. She is 32 years old and has a good reputation. To ensure a daily profit, she sells various articles such as cosmetics and shoes. This third loan will allow her to increase her existing stock. She gets her supplies locally.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old and married to Julius Gaitungu. The couple is blessed with three children who are attending school. For the last 21 years, Mary has been selling items made from tin and sheets of iron in Naivasha town. 

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her third loan. She repaid a previous loan of 40,000 KES in full and in good time. Mary will use this loan to buy raw materials, such as tin and sheets of iron, for her business.

In the future, Mary hopes to open a manufacturing company in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as tin and sheets of iron

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn, 52 years old, is a farmer with an income of $2 per day. She is a single mother with three children, but only one lives with her. There are six members in her family, including her daughter-in-law and three grandsons. 

Her son is a motor taxi driver making $8 a day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $20 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a cow, which she will breed in order to sell its calves. When she saves more money, she plans to start a small grocery shop in front of her house with her daughter.

loans.use: To buy a cow for calving, to sell the calves.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, està casada y tiene tres hijos menores de edad.  Gracias a su primer prèstamo recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos iniciò su negocio.
Lleva tres años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de ropas de segunda mano, que vende por los caseríos cercanos a la ciudad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 comprarà: 15 pantalones, 10 polos, 10 camisas, 10 shores, 5 faldas, 5 vestidos.
Solo trabaja los fines de semana porque sus hijos no se van al colegio, su esposo trabaja en su casa, tiene un pequeño taller de cerrajería.  Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos pueden solventar los gastos de la casa.
Desea que Manuela Ramos siga ayudando a las mujeres que quieren trabajar por el bienestar de su familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is a member of the communal bank Sol Naciente in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali.  She is 41, married and has three minor children.  Thanks to the first loan she received through the Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to start her business.

For three years she has been working with loans through Manuela Ramos in her business selling second-hand clothing to the rural villages near the city.

With the new loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN she plans to buy 15 pairs of trousers, 10 polo shirts, 10 shirts, 10 pairs of shorts, 5 skirts and 5 dresses.

She only works on weekends because her children do not attend school.  Her husband is a locksmith and has a shop set up at home.  Thanks to both their efforts they are able to cover household expenses.

She hopes Manuela Ramos continues helping women who want to contribute to their family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy clothing: trousers, polo shirts, shirts.

loans.name: Pablo Vño

texts.en:
Pablo has now been 10 years in a farming business to financially secure the needs of his family. He is 48 years old and been married to a simple housewife. They were blessed with only one child. 

He is accustomed to visiting his rice crop every now and then to ensure that his plants are growing well. He works hard for his only child's future.  He wants him to grow comfortably and with abundance as opposed to what he went through in his childhood. He aims to give him a complete education, because as he said, his profession someday is the only lifetime inheritance he can give him. 

Pablo sees it as an opportunity to take out a loan through KIVA so he is requesting the amount of P18,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides to maintain his crop growth. Part of the loan will be used in irrigating his rice field to cope with the negative effect of drought.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to maintain his crop growth.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
43-year-old Muoi lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. The couple have two children, one son and one daughter. Her husband works as a labourer for a rubber production factory. 

Muoi has tried to support her family by selling food for lunch on her street for 12 years. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's basic living expenses.

Muoi would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of food to sell to her customers and by buying new furniture for her stall. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food and new furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban (in the photo) and his wife are vegetable farmers.  He also works for a brick kiln when he is not at the farm.  Ban and his wife live along National Road Number Six, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two young children -- one son and one daughter.  

Ban is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow to raise and a boat and fishing nets for his brother who is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fishing boat and nets

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en:
Rakhila is a mother of four children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young girl, she learned the honest work of raising cattle, the knowledge she has passed down to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. 

Rakhila and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow, five years ago. After a number of sacrifices, they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk. They sell it on the weekends in their village. Her monthly income from this business is 150 USD.  She breeds cattle for meat purposes also.

Currently, Rakhila wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living conditions, Rakhila applied for a 1200 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two cattle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 2 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures. Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for pedicures and manicures.

loans.name: Isabel Segunda

texts.es: Isabel se dedica a L. fabricación D. muebles, elL. tiene 53 años y en condición D. separada ha logrado L. educación D. sus hijos D. 19 y 30 años.  En su negocio maneja las líneas D. muebles D. saL. comedor, alcobas, puertas etc. Su mercancía L. distribuye en almacenes que venden estos productos y a elL. le pagan a crédito. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas como madera, e insumos para fabricar nuevos diseños por encargo D. los almacenes a quien le venD.. Su meta es convertirse en L. primera distribuidora en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. y también lograr el mejoramiento D. sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en:
Isabel's business is making furniture.  She is 53 years old and, although separated from her husband, she managed to educate her children who are now 19 and 30.  In her business, Isabel makes furniture for living rooms, dining rooms, bedrooms, doors, etc.  She distributes her merchandise to stores which sell these products and they buy from her on credit.

Isabel's Kiva loan is the first loan that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials such as wood and supplies for making new custom-maD. designs for the stores that she sells to.  Her goal is to become the most important distributor in the city of BarranquilL. and also to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood and supplies for making new designs

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.
Lleva nueve años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, nos cuenta que las lleva a vender por las chacras.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 15 pantalones, 20 camisas manga larga, 10 polos, 10 blusas, 6 faldas, 6 buzos, 4 polares, 2 casacas, 10 pantalones para niños, 10 polos para niños.
Las ropas de segunda mano tienen mucha demanda por las chacras porque muchos la utilizan para trabajar en el campo para que los proteja del calor, cada mes regresa para hacer negocio con su mercadería, cuando  sus clientes no tienen  dinero para pagar en efectivo lo hacen con aves de corral, los mismos que vende en la ciudad.
Dina está tranquila porque cuando sale a otro lugar a vender su mercadería se distrae y le hace bien a su salud.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of the "Las Almendras" communal bank, located in Callería district, in Ucayali department. She is 65, and married.  She has been working with loans from the Manuela Ramos institution for nine years. 

She sells second-hand clothing. She tells us that she takes her merchandise to the countryside to sell. With her new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles she will buy: 15 pairs of pants, 20 long-sleeve shirts, 10 polo shirts, 10 blouses, 6 skirts, 6  tracksuits, 4 fleeces, 2  jackets, 10 pairs of children's pants, and 10 children's polo shirts. 

There is a lot of demand for second-hand clothing in the countryside, because many people use it for working in the fields, and to protect themselves from the heat. Every month she returns to sell her merchandise. When her clients don't have money to pay cash, they do so with poultry, which she then sells in the city. Dina is content, because when she goes to another place to sell her merchandise she keeps herself busy and it's good for her health.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr:
Omar agé de 36 ans.Il est célibataire sans enfant depuis 5 ans,il tavail dans son propre atelier de couture.
Omar avec ,il achete de nouveau tissus dans la capital du sénégalpour les coudre en tenu d'homme et vendre.
Il travail un employé dans son atelier,un qui a maitrisé la couture cause pour la qu'elle leurs habits ne traine pas.Omar veut élargir son atelier de couture avant de se marier pour pouvoir gérer propre famille.
texts.en:
Omar, aged 36, is single and has no children. For five years, he has been sewing in his own workshop. He buys new cloth in the capital of Senegal to sew into men's outfits for resale. 

He has one employee working in his workshop. This person is competent at sewing, so the clothing gets made in a timely manner. Omar would like to expand his workshop before he marries so that he can provide for his own family.

loans.use: to buy and sew clothing for resale.

loans.name: Janybek

texts.ru: Жаныбек 47-летний фермер, живущий в с .Фрунзе (северо-восточная часть Кыргызстана). Женат и воспитывает троих детей 16, 13 и 8 лет.  С 1991 года семья Жаныбека успешно занимается разведением скота и перепродажей сельхоз продукции. Особое внимание он уделяет выращиванию яблок и груш, а также переработке пшеницы. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Жаныбека насчитывается 3 коровы, 2 лошади и 10 овец.  Упорный и неустанный труд в бизнесе позволяет Жаныбеку покрывать расходы своей семьи и планировать оплату контрактов детей на высшее образование. Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Жаныбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Жаныбек намерен использовать для реконструкции сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условия для содержания скота.
texts.en: Janybek is a 47-year-old farmer, living in the village of Frunze (in northeastern Kyrgyzstan). He is married, and raising three children: 16, 13 and 8 years old. Since 1991, Janybek's family has been successfully raising lifestock, and selling farm products. They especially focus on growing apples and pears, as well as processing wheat. Now, Janybek has 3 cows, 2 horses and 10 sheep. Janybek's perseverance and hard work has allowed him to cover his family's expenses and save for his children's post-high-school education. To further increase the number of animals at his farm, Janybek is turning to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS, to purchase additional animals to fatten for market. Janybek plans to use the money he makes on improvements on the barn, to ensure good living conditions for his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 47 years old. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school while the others are helping their father in his business. Her husband operates a dairy business and sells buffalo milk to his community clients at low rates. He has a good relationship with his customers and makes good sales every month.

Zubaida is a housewife. She stays at home to do her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also supports her husband in his business by feeding the cattle and by keeping their quarters clean. Zubaida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another buffalo to increase his milk production in order to serve more clients and increase his income. He has operated his business for many years, and Zubaida is hopeful that an investment will help him to increase his profitability.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk business.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет четверых детей. Двое его сыновей находятся а Российской Федерации. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Два года как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Fakhriddin lives in the region of Yavan. He is 45 years old. He is married and has four children. His two sons are in the Russian Federation. He has secondary education. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle and has been in this business for two years. He is taking out the loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle.

loans.name: Shaimaa

texts.en:
Shaimaa is a 28-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. 

Shaimaa sells milk and other dairy products and she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase materials needed for making dairy products. 

Shaimaa is looking to improve the income of her family. 

Due to cultural issues the woman in the photo is Shaimaa's mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making dairy products

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is 62 years old, married and has four children. For the last 20 years, she has worked very hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells items such as shampoo and groceries. She is applying for a loan for PHP 22,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for the future is to secure the financial stability of her family by expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Matilde Argentina

texts.es:
Con mucha alegría y satisfacción, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, la señora Matilde Argentina inicia la actividad de venta de verduras y frutas tales como chayotes, zanahoria , papa, tomate, naranja dulce piña y yuca, con la que ha desarrollado su familia 

Al irse agotando los perecederos, ha tomado la sabia decisión de solicitar un crédito para la compra de las verduras mencionadas anteriormente y de esta manera satisfacer la gran demanda de sus clientes que prefieren comprarle a ella por su buena personalidad y gran afecto que ella tiene hacia dichos clientes.
texts.en:
With much joy and satisfaction, Matilde Argentina gets up very early every morning to start selling fruit and vegetables such as chayotes, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, oranges, pineapples, and yucca. With this business, she has raised her family. 

With her perishables running out, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy the aforementioned fruit and vegetables. This way, she can satisfy her customers' demand. They prefer to buy from her because of her good personality and the great service she gives them.

loans.use: to buy chayotes, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, oranges, pineapples and yucca.

loans.name: Mirta Ximena

texts.es:
Mirta es una mujer de 35 años divorciada y madre de dos hijos que tienen 15 y 10 años. Juntos viven en la casa de su hermano en "Nanegalito" que es una parroquia de "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es  pertenece a la provincia de Pichincha (donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador), toda la zona es visitada por sus cascadas, ríos y biodiversidad, el río Mulaute es un sitio de interés turístico, en el límite con la provincia de Santo Domingo, en varios tramos de estos ríos se practica el rafting. La comida típica es la guaña o campeche, que es un pescado que se consume estofado con plátano de tipo denominado orito verde. El ceviche de palmito, la tilapia, lomo a la piedra y el dulce de guayaba.

Mirta tiene un local donde vende desde caramelos hasta productos cosméticos desde hace tres años. Lo aprendió de sus amistades. La falta de oportunidades de crédito han sido sus mayores obstáculos, es por eso que Mirta ha acudido a Fundación Alternativa que es una institución que no sólo le brindará un crédito sino que le capacitará y le dará asistencia. Con este crédito esta mujer emprendedora espera mejorar es surtido de productos y así atraer mayor clientela y por ende tener mayores ingresos.

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con sus hijos. Y a pesar que el padre se sus hijos le ayuda económicamente la preocupación de Mirta está siempre con ella y por eso sueña con crecer como empresaria y así asegurar el porvenir de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirta is a 35-year-old divorced mother of two children ages 15 and 10. The all live in her brother's home in Nanegalito, a parish in San Miguel de Los Bancos, which is in the Pichincha province (where the capital of Ecuador is located). This area is frequented because of its waterfalls, rivers, and biodiversity. The Mulaute river is a tourist hotspot on the border of the Santo Domingo province. Rafting is done on various tributaries of this river. The traditional dish is guaña or campeche (fish that is stewed with green plantains), ceviche de palmito (palm hearts and raw fish marinated with citrus juices), tilapia, lomo a la piedra (steak cooked on a rock), and guava sweets. 
For three years, Mirta has been running a shop in which she sells anything from candy to cosmetics. Her lack of access to loans has been her biggest obstacle, which is why Mirta has turned to Fundación Alternativa, an institute that will not only provide her with a loan, but also train her and give her assistance. With this loan, the enterprising woman hopes to obtain a wider variety of products, thus bringing in more customers and in so doing, obtaining greater profits. 
Mirta likes to spend her free time with her children. Despite the fact that the father of her children helps her out financially, Mirta is always concerned about money, which is why she dreams of growing as an entrepreneur, thus ensuring a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 49 years old and married with four school-aged children, the firstborn being 18. He lives with his family in the Kitale area of Western Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for nearly 17 years. His farm produces milk, maize, and beans for the local market.

David has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a a dairy cow. He says this will boost his dairy business and earn income he will use to educate his children. He adds that milk has always been, and will continue to be, his family's daily food supplement. He aspires to own a vehicle to make deliveries to the market as well as to offer transport services to other farmers in the area. He sees animal diseases as his major farming challenge.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cesile

texts.en:
Cesile aged 33 years. She is married with two children aged between 3 and 5 years.Not yet go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 13 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a cow. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor Manuel V. Padilla has been selling ice cream and candies for 1 year. He has a lot of customers in parks and schools where the kids play. I love kids. Mr. Victor Manuel V. wants to extend his business and his wife is very excited because she wants to help him and work together to give the best to their family. Mr. Victor V. is planning the acquisition of another sales unit for his wife. Mr. Manuel V. is asking for a loan of$ 800. He wants to repay in a term of 12 months. In the new sales unit, this next winter, her wife is panning to sell delicious hot corn with cheese and lemon.

Español

Víctor Manuel V. Padilla tiene un año de vendiendo dulces y helados, tiene muchos clientes, sobre todo en las escuelas y en los parques de diversión; donde hay niños, yo quiero mucho a los niños. El Sr. Víctor Manuel V. quiere ampliar su negocio pues su esposa esta muy entusiasmada y trabajar juntos para darle lo mejor a su familia. El Sr. Manuel V. solicita recursos por $ 800.00 y pagarlo en un plazo de 12 meses, con estos recursos el planea la adquisición de otra unidad y en la que además incorporará la venta de elotes pues es temporada de frío.

loans.use: buy another sales unit

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Antie Victoria (lady sitting) sells "wakye", a meal enjoyed by locals and prepared from a special rice and beans grown in her area. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation (KSF) and has completed several training programs that teach good business practices. She is a good manager of loans and knows how to use them to help her business. She is requesting a loan of $750.00 so she can buy ingredients in bulk and increase her profits.

loans.use: Buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Ang V. is 40 years old and lives with her 5 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away and V. must support the family herself. To do so, she sells traditional Khmer cakes in her village. This business generates a profit of about $1.50 per day. Two of her children help contribute to the family by working in a local garment factory, while the other three children are still in school. V. hopes to use this loan to help construct a small house for her family, as they currently live in a tiny cottage with a poorly constructed roof--with not nearly enough support to keep the house from leaking during the rainy season.  It is V.'s dream that her children will be able to finish high school.

loans.use: To build a house for the family

loans.name: Patricia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Patricia Y.'s six brothers and sisters attended school through the 6th grade, however she herself was only able to attend through 4th grade. Her father drank quite heavily. She began helping in her mother's shop as a girl, then worked as an employee until she had saved up enough to start her own business selling clothing. She was married at 23 to Francisco, who has since completed his primary-school equivalency. They have three children. The oldest boy is nine and in second grade. The second, a girl, is six and is still in pre-school and the youngest, Obed Francisco is four. Patricia hopes that with this loan she can expand her business and earn more money for her family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Patricia Y. tiene 6 hermanos todos estudiaron hasta 6to primaria, ella fue la única que llego solo a 4to primaria, su padre tomaba bastante licor, ella se dedicó a trabajar en el negocio que era de su madre, ella les trabajo a otras personas y con lo que a ella le pagaban lo fue ahorrando, y así inicio su negocio, con sus ahorros, vendiendo ropa, Patricia se casó a los 23 años con Francisco, él terminó su educación primaria en CONALFA ya casada, tienen 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 9 años estudia 2do primaria, la segunda tiene 6 años estudiando preparatoria y el ultimo quien es Obed Francisco con 4 años todavía no estudia. Con un préstamo de Q7,000.00 que le pudieran dar de préstamo ella podría surtir mas su negocio y así obtener un poco mas de ganancias.

loans.use: Clothing sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock enough fruit.

loans.name: I Made Rai Artika

texts.id:
I Made Rai Artika lives in Blimbingsari village, West Bali, his birth place. But before Made Rai opened this business in this village, Made Rai immiragted with his family to Dili, East Timor, and opened a workshop there for about 6 years. Because Made Rai graduated from Technical Middle school, he works persistently and with dicipline, since this is his expertise and hobby. Made Rai's work is good and strong, so that within a short time he had many customers. However after the incidents in East Timor, Made Rai and family immigrated back to his birth village, Blimbingsari. Made Rai did not want his unfortunate situation to haunt him. Made Rai raised and worked for his family's well being. In this village Made Rai started from scratch again. Because of his deep expertise, and his satisfactory work, Made Rai immediately has again many customers. Because of the many orders he has to fulfill, often Made Rai has no capital left to buy raw materials, like iron, and other welding equipments. From Dinari's loan, Made Rai would buy raw materails and other welding equipments, so that all his customers orders could be finished on time. Made Rai likes to serve his customers as best as he could, so that his customers would be satisfied with his work and service.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

I Made Rai Artika tinggal didesa Blimbingsari, Bali barat. Desa ini merupakan tempat kelahirannya. Namun, sebelum Made Rai membuka usahanya didesa ini, Made Rai merantau bersama keluarganya ke kota Dili, Timor – Timur dan membuka usaha bengkel las disana selama kurang lebih 6 tahun. Karena Made Rai lulusan STM Teknik, pekerjaan ini dilakukannya dengan tekun dan disiplin, disamping sudah menjadi keahlian dan hobinya. Hasil pekerjaan Made Rai sangat rapi dan kokoh, sehingga dalam waktu sekejap sudah memiliki banyak pelanggan. Namun setelah ada kerusuhan di Timor – Timur, Made Rai beserta keluarganya mengungsi kembali ke desa kelahirannya, Blimbingsari. Namun, Made Rai tidak mau terlarut dalam kesusahannya. Made Rai ingin segera bangkit dan bekerja untuk kesejahteraan hidup keluarganya. Di desa ini Made Rai membuka usaha dari awal lagi. Karena sudah pengalaman dalam pekerjaannya dan hasil kerjanya yang memuaskan, Made Rai segera memiliki banyak pelanggan. Karena begitu banyaknya pesanan yang harus dikerjakannya, seringkali Made Rai kehabisan modal untuk membeli bahan baku yang berupa besi dan peralatan las lainnya. Dengan pinjaman dana dari DINARI, Made Rai membeli bahan baku dan alat – alat las, sehingga semua pesanan pelanggan bisa diselesaikannya tetap waktu. Made Rai ingin melayani pelanggan dengan sebaik – baiknya sehingga semua pelanggan akan mendapat kepuasan dari hasil kerja dan pelayanannya.

loans.use:
To buy rwas materials like iron, and other welding materials

Membeli bahan baku berupa besi dan alat - alat kelengkapan las

loans.name: Sarneta Xavier

texts.pt:
Sarneta lives with her boyfriend and 5 children. Her boyfriend works odd jobs to support the family. All Sarneta’s children are in school except the youngest. She has just joined the credit program. And this is her first loan. She plans on using this loan to buy more used clothes to sell.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Sarneta é solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. O marido de Sarneta vive de pequenos negócios. Os filhos de Sarneta estão a estudar com a excepção dos mais novos que ainda não têm idade para ir a escola.Sarneta quer usar o dinheiro para aumentar o seu stock de roupa usada para a venda. Sarneta está entrando ainda este ano para ao programa de crédito. Este empréstimo é o primeiro que ela vai tomar.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: “I am Sadia B. and have two girls and one boy. My eldest daughter is in nursery school. My husband needs a loan to purchase a buffalo. He has been selling fresh milk in the neighbourhood for many years. We already have nine buffaloes. Later on, when my children are older I may open my own tailoring business. I think my daughters  especially shouldobtain an education.”

loans.use: purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca's husband is a merchant, which means that his earnings are not stable. Sometimes they sell a lot, some other times they don't. This is one of the reasons why Francisca decided to start selling second-hand clothing. Additionally, she noticed that other people that were selling these type of products were doing very well. Slowly she started to make a name for herself at the market and currently she has customers that look for her to buy her merchandise.

Nevertheless, Francisca currently does not have enough merchandise to offer her clients. This is the reason she is asking for a loan in the amount of $200, which she is willing to pay back in 5 months. With this money Francisca would be able purchase a bundle of second-hand clothing of the season to offer to her customers. With your help Francisca will be able to get ahead and help her family with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Francisca es comerciante, y con un negocio no es constante la entrada de dinero. Puesto que en unas ocasiones venden mucho y en otras no. Fue por eso que Francisca decidió ponerse a vender ropa usada, puesto que se daba cuenta que otras personas que vendían este tipo de productos les iba muy bien. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer en el mercadito. Actualmente ya tiene clientas que la buscan para comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo actualmente Francisca no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $200 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Francisca podrá comprar una paca de ropa usada de la temporada para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Francisca podrá sacar adelante a su familia con las ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Zaina's Azimio. Group

texts.en:
Zaina is 45 years old and is married. She and her husband also take care of 3 children, ages 17,15, and 12. Zaina owns a garage, which she started in 1995. Every day, she works from 7 am to 9 pm at her business and earns about $790 profit a month.

In the past, Zaina had one loan from BRAC Tanzania, to expand her business. She now requests a loan to buy food items to sell to start another business. She plans to share this loan with her group member, who sells clothes and has a cafe.

loans.use: Start another business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar P. is married and has a family. When he was younger, he worked in the US where he learned how to cook. He returned to Linares when his son was born as he wanted to be with his family. Currently he works in a restaurant as a waiter and assistant cook; he would like to earn even more money for his family by holding receptions for special occasions in his home. His wife is planning to assist him.

In order to host wedding receptions in his house, Oscar requires a loan of US$475 to buy all the necessary items. He will repay the money within 6 months. With your contributions, Oscar will reach his goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Oscar P. es casado y padre de familia, cuando era joven se fue a trabajar a estados unidos, haya aprendió sobre cocina, tuvo que regresar a linares cuando nació su hijo y quería estar con su familia. Actualmente trabaja en un restaurante como mesero y ayudante de cocina; además para generar más ingresos para su familia en su casa se dedica a realizar banquetes para fiestas, su esposa lo ayuda en esta labor.

Ahora tiene un pedido para la realización de un banquete para una boda por lo cual requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar todo lo necesario para llevarlo a cabo. Con tus contribuciones Oscar podrá logar su meta.

loans.use: Expand his food service business

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
His work as a master carpenter makes Jesús very happy, and he is one of the most hard-working persons in this trade because he puts in such effort, patience and dedication to each and every piece of furniture he makes. Thanks to this, his customers are very satisfied and his client base increases considerably. Currently, with the help of two other youngsters, he creates a wide variety of designs with intricate finishes and beautiful details as requested by his patrons. Thanks to his patience and ability, he is managing to keep up with orders. However, he still requires raw materials such as lumber, varnish, and a few tools that he lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Su trabajo de maestro carpintero tiene muy contento a don Jesús, quien es uno de los mejores trabajadores en este rubro, ya que pone su mayor esfuerzo, paciencia y dedicación a cada uno de los muebles que elabora, gracias a ello es que sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos y su número aumenta considerablemente.Actualmente con apoyo de otros 2 jovencitos elaboran una inmensa variedad de modelos con finos acabados y bellísimos detalles de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes.Gracias a su paciencia y habilidad está logrando cumplir satisfactoriamente con sus pedidos, pero aún le falta materia prima como: madera, barniz y algunas herramientas que aún le hacen falta.

loans.use: Purchase additional quantities of raw materials.

loans.name: Halovat

texts.ru:
Halovat N. sells men's clothing at the local market in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. She wants to increase her cash-flow to raise her income. This will help her broaden her business and improve her and her family's lifestyle. To do this, she needs a loan for $450 and plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Ниязова Халоват бизнесмен. Занимается тороговлей на рынке города Турсун-Заде. Торгует мужской одеждой. Занимается бизнесом уже три года. Ей 43 года , она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , для того , чтобы получать дополнительный доход. Это поможет расширить бизнес,а так же улучшить условия жизни для себя и своих детей.Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит в размере 450 долларов США ,погасить который сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase Cash-flow

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, thirty seven years old, is married with four children. All of her children are currently in school.

Ruth has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past eight years. Ruth is very skillful and a talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. She wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators. This will allow her to avoid shortages and poor service.

Ruth hopes to raise a good income to finance the education of her children. She is a member of the community group called Humility Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral access to loans and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators

loans.name: César Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar Antonio has his own fast-food business in which he sells hot-dogs, hamburgers, sodas, fried foods, etc. He started this business three years ago with the support of his family and his own savings. With the profits that his business generates he wants to improve his family’s quality of life, and he wants to do it step by step. He will use this loan to buy construction materials so that he can finish the porch of his home, and that way provide more security for his family and their belongings. Cesar hopes to improve his business to provide better attention to his customers and thus continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

César Antonio es un pequeño comerciante que se gana la vida vendiendo comidas rápidas como hot-dog, hamburguesas, fritangas, refrescos, etc. En busca de una forma de poder salir adelante junto a su familia, decidió hace 3 años poner un negocio de estas ventas. El negocio lo empezó con dinero propio y con el apoyo de su familia. Con los ingresos que le genera el negocio espera poder mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, y empezará a hacerlo en pequeñas partes, el uso de este crédito será para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de hacer el porche de su vivienda, y así poder darle más seguridad a su familia y a sus bienes materiales. César espera poder mejorar el negocio para darles mejor atención a sus clientes, y poder seguir creciendo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish the porch of his house.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 21 years old. She is a widow with one child aged 2 years old. She has been a firewood and bites seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 4am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Fatma is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mwamvua

texts.en:
Mwamvua K. A. is married with 5 children between the ages of 16 and 1. She has sold clothes and fish since 2000. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Mwamvua is now looking  for a loan to expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding items to her current stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells clothing, footwear and cooking utensils at Bronibima near Elmina. She is divorced and has three children. Having received a primary school education, Mary has been selling clothing, footwear and cooking utensils since 1996. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing and cooking utensils for resale to her ever-increasing customer base. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest and increase operations and sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and cooking utensils for resale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes R. R. is a member of the Firmeza Village Bank, which means “steadiness” in Spanish. She is married, has two children, and works everyday selling food. She will use her loan of 600 soles to purchase potatoes, seafood, and limes. She is currently saving to be able to pay for her children’s education so they can become professionals. Her dream is to have her children remain in school and become professionals and that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Buy potatoes, seafood, and limes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Margarita tiene 75 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos que tienen familia. Vive en la Av. Circunvalación Nº 1347, distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno.

Es socia del Banco “Diana D. Gales” en Puno desD. hace 6 años aproximadamente. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 aumentó su capital y compró cereales como trigo, chuño, papa, maíz. Empezó con este negocio a los 50 años D. edad y trabajó durante muchos años con la venta D. cereales, después D. un cierto tiempo cambio D. negocio por su edad resultándole muy  difícil. 

Actualmente se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, galletas, gaseosas, etc., los cuales venD. en diferentes lugares D. Puno.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará galletas, aceite, fideos, gaseosas, etc.

Margarita desea seguir trabajando con su negocio hasta donD. pueda.
texts.en:
Mrs Margarita is 75 years old, she is married and a mother of 5 children who already have family. She lives in the Av. Beltway 1347, district, province and department of Puno. She has been a partner of the “Diana D. Gales“ Bank for approximately 6 years. With the first loan of $300, she increased her capital and bought cereals such as wheat, freeze-dried potato, corn. She began this business when she was 50 years old and worked selling cereals for many years, after a certain time she changed businesses because of her age it was becoming quite difficult. At present, she sells groceries such as noodles, sugar, cookies, sodas, etc., which she sells in different areas of Puno. With this loan of $650, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy cookies, oil, noodles, soda drinks, etc. Daisy wants to keep on working with her business as long as she can handle it.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, oil, pasta and soda drinks, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Margret is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house for rent

loans.name: Amidou

texts.fr:
Mr Amidou S. est un homme marié, né vers 1968 à Ouogan (Sikasso) qui est  père de (05) enfants (2garçons et 3filles). Il vit dans une famille monogamme avec son épouse et ses enfants à Noumousso un des quartiers de Kadiolo ville(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge, il appris le commerce à côté de l’agriculture qu'il pratiquait avec ses parents comme activité première. Dépuis maintenant  7 ans la tendance s’est inversée, il vend dans sa boutique, de céréales et divers autres articles, dans le quartier Noumousso de la ville de Kadiolo au bord de la route principale. Il jouit d’une notorieté sans précédente dans la ville de kadiolo. 
Il collabore avec l’intitution de microfinanace Soro Yiriwaso il y a  2 ans. Il est à son 4eme prêt individuel, tous les précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Mr Amidou S. compte acheter avec son prêt 5 sacs de sucre, 10sacs de riz, 2sacs d’haricots, 5 bidons de 20 litres d’huile et 30 sacs de maïs. Il s’approvisionne à Kadiolo ville chez les grosssistes.
Mr Amidou S. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Il est souvent sollicité par certains fonctionnaires de la place pour leurs dotations mensuelles.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 94.000FCFA dont une partie sera injectée dans son commerce et l’autre partie sera mise de côté comme épargne. Il ambitionne d’être un grossiste.
texts.en:
Mr. Amidou S. is a married man, born about 1968 in Ouogan (Sikasso), who is a father of five children (two boys and three girls). He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in Noumousso, a district of Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). At a young age, he learned commerce along with agriculture, which he practiced with his parents as his first job. For seven years now, the trend has been inverted. In his shop located along the main road, he now sells grain and various other goods, in the Noumousso district of the city of Kadiolo, where he enjoys unprecedented fame.

He has been in collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years and is on his fourth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been settled. With this loan, he plans to buy 5 sacks of sugar, 10 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of beans, 5 drums (20 liters each) of cooking oil, and 30 sacks of corn. Supplies are gotten in Kadiolo City from wholesalers. Sales are made, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women and men. He is often in demand by some local civil servants for their monthly allocation.

He envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 94,000 francs CFA, part of which will be injected into his business and the other will be put aside as savings. His ambition is to be a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and various other goods

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn B., together with her husband and seven children, resides in Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. They have a sari-sari store (variety store), a major source of their family income. This is tended by Merlyn. She works together with her husband, a farmer, to provide for the basic needs of their family. She desires to improve and fill her store with stocks to be competitive in the market; hence, she is requesting a loan amounting to Php 11,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Клиент Хайдаров Ибодулло проживает в районе Руми, высшее образования не имеет, в возрастом 39 лет. Женат имеет 4 - ех детей.Сам клиент занимается торговлей уже более шести лет.На получившие деньги клиент хочет расширить ассортимерт продугции.
texts.en:
Ibodullo H. lives in the Rumi district, is 39 years old, and has no higher education. He is married and has four children. This client has already been in business for over six years. He wants to use the loan to expand his inventory of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Бобоев Ибодулло житель Варзоба. Варзоб это скалистая местность , где   основная часть населения занимается животноводчеством. Многие жители работают в городе Душанбе. И очень маленькая часть населения занимается сельским хозяйством. Ибодулло строитель, женат и имеет двоих детей., но уже 10 лет имеет хозяйство с козами. Сейчас решил получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. На деньги полученные у нас он купит несколько породистых коз.
texts.en:
Ibodullo B. lives in Varzob. Varzob is a mountainous area where the main portion of the population raises livestock. Many residents work in Dushanbe. A very small portion works in agriculture. Ibodullo is a builder, he is married and has two children, but for 10 years now he has a plot with goats. Now he decided to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. He will use the money that he gets from us to purchase several bred goats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Since 1999, Isaac A. has worked as a trader at Moree, near Siwdu, selling goods such as rice, sugar, and paint and other building materials. He is married with 3 children and his wife is employed as a trader. He is responsible for paying various family expenses such as school fees and utilities. Isaac’s loan will be used to buy more stock and building materials for selling and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more stock and building materials for selling

loans.name: Tulkindjan

texts.ru: Хашимов Тулкинджан- мужчина 45 лет. Женат отец 4-х детей. Занимается торговлей скота. Тулкинджан имеет 4-х летный стаж в этой сфере. Тулкинджану помогает брат. Свой скот он перепродает на Жигда, Булок и Аппон Аштского района. Также по специальности он механиком работает в автопарке колхоза. На полученный займ она хочет купить скот у оптовиков и перепродать по выгодной ему цене. У Тулкинджона также есть земля, на которой он посеял лук  через месяц он соберет свой урожай.
texts.en:
Tulkindjan H. is a 45 year old man. He is married and is a father of four children. He sells cattle. Tulkindjan has four years of experience in this field. His brother is also helping him. He resells the cattle on the Jigda, Bulok and Appon markets of the Asht region. He also works as a mechanic in the autoshop of the collective farm. He wants to use the loan to buy cattle from wholesellers and resell for a profitable price. Tulkindjon also has a plot of land where he has sown onions and will collect the harvest in one month.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Kenelma

texts.es: Kenelma tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes la ayudan en todo lo posible. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con muchos deseos de superación. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, con está labor debe visitar de casa en casa a sus clientes recolectando sus pedidos para llegar a su meta mensual de ventas. Kenelma está muy contenta porque gracias a esta actividad ha podido generar los ingresos económicos necesarios, que junto al trabajo de su esposo, alcanzan para solventar las necesidades de su familia, además es una labor que no le toma mucho tiempo. Y gracias a su carisma y jovialidad al vender ha ganado una buena cantidad de clientes regulares, a quienes suele concederles crédito, según la responsabilidad que le demuestren en sus pagos.  Para más adelante, a Kenelma le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa donde también pueda vender variedad de perfumes y cosméticos. Con MFP, ya tiene 6 préstamos, y le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque en estos años (3) de trabajo solidario se comprenden muy bien y tienen responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de más productos de belleza y una vitrina de exhibición.
texts.en:
Kenelma, 33, lives with her husband and their three children. They help her as much as possible. She is a very active woman with a great desire to improve. For one year she has been selling beauty products by catalog. In her work she must go house to house to visit her customers to gather her orders. She does this to reach her monthly sales’ goal. Kenelma is very happy. Thanks to this work, along with her husband’s work, she has been able to generate the enough income for the family’s necessities. Also, this work does not take too much time. Thanks to her charm and joviality when selling, she has won a good number of regular customers. She usually gives them credit based on their demonstrated responsibility about paying. In the future she would like to have a clothing store where she could also sell a variety of perfumes and cosmetics. She has had six loans with MFP. She likes being part of her community bank because in her years of working (3) in a supportive manner, they understand each other very well and are responsible about their payments. The loan she is now asking for is to buy more beauty products and a display case.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and disply case

loans.name: Abdul Ahad Group

texts.en: A. Ahad is the leader of A. Ahad group. There are three members in this group and they all live in distract 15 in Kabul, Afghanistan. They want to take out a loan to improve their businesses. A. Ahad wants a loan for his business of selling vegetables. A. Ahad wants a loan for his general store. Nasema wants a loan for her carpet-weaving business. They all want to affirm that this process will definitely help them advance.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Delmy Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Delmy Azucena R. C. tiene ya dedicándose a su negocio de abarrotes desde hace ya más de seis años, es la fuente de ingreso para darles lo mejor a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder  surtir la tienda y así tener más ingreso para su familia.
La señora Delmy ya ha tenido tres créditos en FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Señora Delmy Azucena R. C. has been working at her grocery business for more than 6 years. It is the source of the income that gives her children the best as she is a single mother. The business lacks a variety of merchandise, but at the moment she doesn’t have the money necessary for the investment. This is why she is asking for a loan, to be able to grow the store and so have a better income for her family. Señora Delmy has already completed three loans with FVP, which she repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for Delmy's shop

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma T. is 31 years old and from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing and ready-to-wear items to local community members. Alma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Alma joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new additional ready-to-wear items for sale. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ready-to-wear items for sale

loans.name: Sergio J Dolores

texts.es:
El señor Sergio J Dolores está muy agradecido por su gran ayuda con el anterior crédito el cual pudo reparar el techo de su casa. 
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo pero ahora necesita herramienta nueva y de mejor calidad para su trabajo ya que se dedica a la construcción y le está haciendo falta ya que tiene varios trabajos para realizar y por falta de herramienta no ha podido terminarlos, también desea darles a dos personas trabajo. Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Sergio J Dolores is very grateful for the assistance of his previous loan, which was used to repair the roof of his house.

He is now requesting a loan to purchase new tools to help him improve the quality of his work. Sr. Sergio is in the construction business and has several projects that are pending, but he lacks the necessary tools to complete them. He also wants to provide work for two employees. This is why he is seeking your cooperation with this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is into pig farming. She has been in the business for the past 3 years. She is 54 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more pigs to raise. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Shayma Gull

texts.en: Shayma Gull lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married but she lives alone in Kabul since all her family is living in anther province in Afghanistan. She came to Kabul to work hard for her family and opened a retail shop. She is new in her business and she wants to expand it. She wants to take an individual loan to complete her stock and make a better monthly income so that she can bring her family to the capital and help them better. She is happy that she can further her business by taking a small loan.

loans.use: they are improve their business

loans.name: Bishnu

texts.en:
Bishnu D. is a farmer in the village of Chapagaun. Chapagaun is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur district and most of the people in this village are engaged in agricultural farming. She grows green vegetables on her land and sells them in the local market both morning and evening. Mostly she grows seasonal vegetables. She is requesting a Rs 25000 loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable farm.

Bishnu D. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a laborer in house construction work. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade five and her son is in pre-school.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Sat Miech Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sat M. is the group leader of four members who all live in Trapeang Prei village in Takeo province. She is 51 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Sat M. sells rice soup. Her husband, Mr. Haem Chan Sopha, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because the field is infertile soil, which hurts his crops. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Sat M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle A. is from the village of Palao, Iligan City. She is 30 years old. Rochelle is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rochelle makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Rochelle has been in business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rochelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rochelle is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rochelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Susana Castellón ha sido una mujer de pocos recursos económicos desde su juventud ha trabajado para apoyar a sus padres, luego que se caso ha tenido que trabajar para lograr tener sus propia casa. Procreo tres hijos que ha podido mantenerlos como madre soltera por que su matrimonio no resulto como muchas familias. Lo más difícil que ha trabajado como domestica donde hace mucho quehaceres por poco salario y a veces muchas humillaciones. Tiene 59 años de edad, vive en un barrio de Managua Laureles Sur, ella logro poco a poco hacer su casa pero es sencilla parte de madera en mal estado, es por eso quiere comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar a mejorar las partes malas como cambiar el techo de su casa que se moja en temporada de invierno, también el cerco lo tiene caído y por falta de dinero no lo ha reparado. Sus mejoras han sido mediante el financiamiento por que paga poco a poco y a si puede hacer las mejoras por que tiene que cubrir las necesidades de su alimentación como medicina ya que ni  asegurada. Da las gracias Afodenic por el pollo de poder hacer posible los cambios de su casa.
texts.en:
Susana Castellón, 59, has never had much money; from a very early age she worked to support her parents. Once married, she has worked to have her own home. She had three children and has had to support them alone because, like happens in so many families, she is a single mother. The hardest work she's done is as a domestic where salaries are very low, work is very hard, and one is subject to many humiliations. She lives in Managua's Laureles Sur neighborhood. Little by little she managed to build her house, which is very unassuming, partly made of wood that is in very poor shape. She wants to buy building materials so that she can start to improve the worst parts like the roof which needs to be replaced because in Winter it leaks. Also, her fence has fallen and, because of lack of funds, she has been unable to repair it. The improvements she has made have been thanks to the financing which she can repay bit by bit. This allows her to make improvements and still be able to pay for basic needs like food and medicine (she's not insured). She thanks Afodenic for making her home improvements possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting to replace her roof and the fence.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is excited about taking her first Kiva loan with LAPO. She has been in LAPO for three years now. Bola is 49 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a trader; he sells building materials. Bola is into the sale of drinks; soft drinks, and beers in both wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for a very long time and is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000. She plans to expand her business of selling drinks, which is now booming. With this business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide for her children's education. Thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifanía tiene 51 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Bernabé de 58 años y sus dos hijas Mari luz de 28 y Delia de 18 años.Pese a que esta algo enferma por el frío de la sierra ,no deja de trabajar porque teme que otros comerciantes le quiten su clientela, ya que desde hace 30 años se dedica  a la venta de queso y choclo (maíz), que debe trasladar desde la altura de su pueblo hasta una ciudad en la selva central del Perú, donde estos productos son los preferidos de la población por su delicioso sabor y por las vitaminas que contiene; paralelamente desde que se casó se dedica a la agricultura sembrando papa, arveja, maíz, cebada, trigo, oca y mashua (productos oriundos de la sierra peruana) junto a su esposo; estas actividades le resultan rentables porque le permiten cubrir sus necesidades, y comprar terrenos productivos. Para el futuro planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, además desea comprar un moto carro  para alquilar sus servicios de transporte en la ciudad, también quiere aumentar su productividad.Es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y esta muy tranquila porque dice es una oportunidad de seguir creciendo económicamente; con respecto al trabajo en su banco comunal refiere que es bastante organizado.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en mercadería para su negocio de venta de queso y choclo que va esta creciendo de a pocos, además otra parte la invertirá en  bolsas de semilla de arveja, sacos de fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas, además  pagará a sus trabajadores por preparar los terrenos de sembrío.
texts.en:
Epifanía is 51 years old. She lives in her own house with her partner Bernabé (58 years old), and her two daughters Mari Luz (28 years old) and Delia (18 years old). Although she is a bit sick from the cold of the mountains, she does not stop working because she is afraid that other merchants will take her clients. For 30 years, she has sold cheese and corn which she must transport from the height of her town to a city in the central forest of Perú. These products are preferred there for their delicious flavor and for the vitamins they contain. At the same time, since she married, she has also worked in agriculture, planting potatoes, peas, corn, barley and tubers called oca and mashua( native products in the Peruvian mountains), with her husband. These activities are profitable because they allow them to cover their necessities and to buy good fields. For the future, she plans to plant, in large amounts and in addition, she wants to buy a motorized 3-wheeled vehicle in order to rent its services in the city. She also wants to increase her productivity. This is the tenth time she has had a loan with MFP and she is very calm because she says this is an opportunity to continue to grow economically. With respect to the work in her communal bank she says it is well organized. She intends to invest the money from the loan in merchandise for her cheese and corn business which is growing little by little. In addition, she will invest another part of the loan in bags of pea seeds, fertilizer and bottles of insecticide. She will also pay her workers for preparing the sown fields.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and increase her land's productivity
