loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es: “Diamante”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Exaltación”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de víveres, edredones, atención de tienda de barrio, venta de muebles, juguetes, verdura y taller de mecánica. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y materia prima, según el negocio que tengan cada una.
texts.en:
“Diamante” (diamond) is a group of seven women and one man who attend the meetings at the Centro Focal Exaltación. They met there recently to get a loan since all of them need to increase their working capital. They have various businesses such as selling provisions, comforters, running neighbourhood shops, selling furniture, toys, vegetables, or running a mechanics shop. All of them need a loan to buy merchandise and raw materials depending on what kind of business they have.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of cereals in bulk

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una socia del Banco Comunal Damas De Éxitos, se reúnen cada 15 días en un sector a las afuera de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí localidad turística por sus hermosas playas que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero durante todo el año.

Rosa tiene 5 ciclos en el bankito con los prestamos que ha obtenido a podido seguir en su negocio como comerciante informal  de zapatos, ella junto a su hija tiene un puesto en el  casco comercial de Portoviejo desde hace 20 años, su horario de atención  es de 08 de la mañana a  6 de la tarde de lunes a domingo ofreciendo calzado para toda la familia.

La señora Rosa nos comentó que fue un hermano quien la ayudo para que ella tenga su propio  negocio  ya que toda la familia se dedica a esta actividad. Con este nuevo préstamo viajara a Guayaquil donde compra a los mayoristas  calzada deportivo, casual, informal y sandalias para la temporada playera y obtener una mejor gananciasobre todo  estos meses del año que  son muy buenos para el negocio.

 Rosa al igual que las otras socias tiene su sueño y no descarta la posibilidad de  tener un local más amplio y cómodo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Damas de Exitos. They meet every two weeks in an area outside the city of Portoviejo, Province of Manabi. This is a tourist area because of its beautiful beaches that attract national and international tourists all year long. Rosa has gone through 5 cycles with the little bank with the loans she has gotten to be able to continue with her business as a street vendor of shoes. With her daughter she has had a spot in the business district of Portoviejo for 20 years. Her work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon, Monday through Sunday, offering shoes for the whole family. Rosa tells us that it was her brother who helped her to have her own business, since the whole family participates in this kind of activity. With this new loan she will travel to Guayaquil, where she will buy athletic, casual and informal shoes and sandals from wholesalers for the beach season. She will then make more profit, especially during this time of year which is very good for business. Rosa, along with the other memebrs, has her dream and doesn't discount the possibiilty of having a more spacious and comfortable locale to give a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase athletic, casual and informal shoes for the beach season

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit P. is 58 years-old and is married with three children: two sons and a daughter. Davit’s family lives in Kapan city. 

Davit has his own business: he has auto repair shop on his own shop floor and his elder son helps him in this business. Davit needs a 750,000 AMD loan to repair his workshop and to buy new tools for his business.

Part of his future profits Davit will use to pay for his daughter’s education.

loans.use: To repair his workshop and to buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Keneya Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Keneya Kadi sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant  une moyenne d’âge de 31ans,  3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou  II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur  deuxième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. 
Elles font la vente de tissus,  de chaussures,  de la restauration et de la viande. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 rouleaux de tissus, 4 douzaines de paires de chaussures, 1 sac de 100kg de riz, 3 paquets de condiments pour la restauration et 3 petits ruminants (pour les abattre et vendre leur viande). 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants.  Elles vendent dans les différents marchés de Sikasso, dans les quartiers de la ville et à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Keneya Kadi group are for the most part married, and on average are 31 years old with three children. Most live in monogamous families in the Sanoubougou II neighborhood of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs and are requesting a second group loan, having correctly reimbursed the first. They retail pieces of cloth, shoes, food preparations and meat. With their new loan they will buy: 5 bolts of cloth, 4 dozen pairs of shoes, one 100-kilo bag of rice, 3 packages of condiments for food preparations and 3 small ruminants (to butcher and sell the meat). They get their supplies from the Sikasso market and in neighboring villages. They sell their products in the different markets in Sikasso, in the town neighborhoods, and they also do home delivery. They sell for cash but often on credit to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach average monthly earnings of 22,500 FCFA each, of which part will be devoted to savings and family needs, and the remainder reinvested in the business activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Mariatu's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1935 by the Catholics. Presently, this school is staffed with eighteen  teachers and has 549 pupils. 

This is the first loan this school is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would not have been able to accomplish with their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mariatu K. is the leader of this group of teachers. She has been a teacher for twenty years now. The 42-year-old Mariatu was born in Lunsar, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with three children who are attending school -- one in university, one in secondary school, and the other in primary school. Mariatu is seeking a loan of SLL 1,500,000 in order to buy house-building materials like cement and corrugated zinc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like cement and corrugated zinc

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem N., age 31, is employed at a local garment factory and earns an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband (pictured) sells salt, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Between the two of them, they try to cover the family expenses. They live with their five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase salt in bulk for her husband to offer in resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies. 

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy salt in bulk for resale

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a hardworking lady who owns a retail shop where she sells sugar, cereals and cooking fat. In addition, she is a farmer. Evalyne was previously selling charcoal before she ventured into her retail shop business which she has been running for two years.

Evalyne is a member of Farasi (horse) SHG (self-help group) in Faulu Kenya whose members have guaranteed her loan of Kes 60,000. She plans to use this loan to buy cereals, sugar and rice for her shop.

Evalyne hopes to open a savings account with Faulu Kenya in the future. She dreams of enlarging her business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To buy cereals, sugar and rice

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene F., 43 years old, is from the town of Banga. He is married and has two school-aged children.

Rene owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over eleven years already.

In May 2010, Rene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his first from CEVI.

Rene plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: María Angelina

texts.es: Doña Angelina tiene 30 años esta casada y tienen 4 hijos, su esposo se encuentra en el extranjero y el le envia ayuda economica. Angelina trabajo para darles estudio a sus hijas para que algún día sean personas profesionales. se dedica a vender comales los días martes, jueves y domingo en el mercado municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque a parte de eso vende pollos y al mismo tiempo borda y vende delantales tipícos. Ella solicita el crédito pra invertilo en comprar más comales ya que los días que no va al mercado vende en su casa porque la gente ya la conoce y sabe donde vive, también comprar concentrado para sus animales. Sueña con tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Angelina, 30, is married and they have 4 children. Her husband is out of the country and sends her economic support. Angelina works to give her daughters an education so that they will be professionals one day. She sells comales [brick dishes for making tortillas] on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Sundays in the local San Martin Jilotepeque market. She also sells chickens and at the same time she embroiders and sells traditional aprons. She is requesting this loan to invest in purchasing more comales, as on the days when she does not go to the market she sells in her home, since people already know her and know where she lives. She also wants to buy concentrate for her animals. She dreams of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Fátima Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Fátima Lucia M. C., tiene 40 años y habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, su esposo labora brindando el sustento familiar, ellos tienen 2 hijos adolecentes que estudian la secundaria, la señora es doctora del centro de salud de Ticuantepe. 

Con el esfuerzo y apoyo de su esposo es que han podido construir y mejorar su vivienda, pero sus limitaciones económicas no le permitieron continuar con este proyecto de mejora a la infraestructura del hogar, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de hierro, zinc, cemento,  madera, bloque, etc. Con el objetivo de terminar con la edificación del muro del frente de su hogar, proyecto que se trazaron años atrás, para el desarrollo optimo y seguro de sus dos hijos, sobre todo la satisfaccion de los padres de brindarle a sus hijos las mejores condiciones socio economicas posibles.
texts.en:
Fátima is 40 years old and lives in the Medardo Andino barrio. Her husband works to provide for the family's sustenance, and they have two adolescent children who are in high school. Fátima is a doctor at a health center in Ticuantepe. With hard work and the support of her husband they were able to build a home and make improvements to it, but their limited economic resources did not allow them to complete their project of improving their home's infrastructure. It's for this reason Fátima is requesting a loan to purchase iron, zinc, cement, wood, bricks, etc., with the goal of completing construction of a wall at the front of the home, a project that was started last year to add security for their two children. Fátima and her husband put improving their children's socio-economic conditions above everything else.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase iron, zinc, cement, wood, bricks and other items to make improvements to her home

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
In order to generate additional income and to help her husband support the family, Karen M. ventured into making and selling food. She prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals.She has been in this business for 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. Karen and her family live happily in the village of Lalog 2, Luna, Isabela. At the age of 40, Karen and her husband are now blessed with 2 school-aged children.

In 2010, Karen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Karen is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to provide working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Karen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie E. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling onions in the local community.  She also has a little vegetable farm.  Rosie has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

--------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in a small city called Borewala which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan. She is a 39 year old lady who has spent most of her life in Borewala. She is the mother of four sons: two of whom are studying and the remaining two are running their businesses. The eldest one is a butcher and deals with chicken meat specifically while the second son has a business of hosiery. Sakina herself supplies baby pampers to different shops, on order. 

Sakina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her elder son. With the loan amount he will buy chicken in bulk because EID Season (Muslims' occasion for celebration, which comes after Ramadan) is near and after Ramadan, the wedding season will be starting and the demand for chicken will be increased. So Sakina is very sure that her son will be able to make good income in these seasons.  

Sakina is in her 2nd loan cycle. Earlier she invested loan money in her son’s business of hosiery, which resulted in increase of profits for him. She has proven herself to be a very responsible loan user of Asasah in her first year of loan.

loans.use: Purchase chicken in bulk for chicken meat selling business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa C. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 62 years old and is widowed with six adult children. Elisa owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like bread, other foods for snacks, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Santiago se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 19 años tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre está aportando lo mejor para mantener su negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento por lo que ha sido muy importante, para salir adelante. Por lo que el viaja a diferentes departamentos para buscar los diferentes productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y artículos para el hogar. El sueña con mejorar el servicio con sus clientes y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Santiago makes a living selling general merchandise. He has been supporting his three children for more than 19 years. He is always contributing his best to maintain his business. This is not the first loan that has been very important in his goal to get ahead. He travels to other departments to look for the differing products that his customers request. The loan is for the purchase of towels, sheets, cosmetics, shoes and home goods. He dreams of improving his service to his customers and making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Mrs. Navy L., 30, and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Van, 31, have been married since 2003 and have a young daughter. The famiL. lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Navy and her husband make a living working in a garment factory. They also raise cows when they are not at work, and earn extra income by selling their cows when they are grown. 

Navy is requesting her first loan, for $500, to buy a new cow to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise and sell

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Hing P., 48, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. P. is a farmer and raises cows, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 2.50 per day. The family has to spend USD 50.00 on food, USD 15.00 on children's education, and USD 10.00 on other necessary expenses every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to use to commute to work.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Hing appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.en:
Jacoba is a member of the Communal Bank "Heart of Jesus", located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 55 years old and a widow with nine children (all of whom are independent). She studied through the third year of primary school. 

Jacoba has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, and the money was used to increase the capital in her business selling livestock. She is now asking for a loan for 1,300 PEN, money that will be used to buy more animals. 

Her dream is to have her own house. Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: The purchase of more animals for her business selling livestock

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay V. is a 62-year-old farmer who lives in Battambang Province. Hay V.’s husband died many years ago and she has been living with her child who helps her in her farming business. She has a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. 

Hay V. uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer to make her crops grow well.

loans.use: To buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Claire Suzanne

texts.fr: A. O. Claire Suzanne est née le 12 août 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Claire Suzanne est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, avec qui elle vit. La famille vit à Sènadé 2, un quartier de Cotonou. Claire Suzanne supporte seule les besoins de ses enfants. Pour assurer les charges familiales, Claire Suzanne exerce comme activité depuis quinze ans, la vente de bombons, biscuits, conserves, etc. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Claire Suzanne s’approvisionne. Claire Suzanne est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. C’est dans le but d’accroitre son activité et fructifier ses revenus que Claire Suzanne sollicite un nouveau crédit.
texts.en:
Claire Suzanne A. O. was born on August 12, 1971 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. She is married, and her three children, who are all living with her, are in school. The family lives in Sènadé 2, a neighborhood in Cotonou. She alone meets her children's needs.

In order to pay her family's expenses, Claire Suzanne has been selling candy, cookies, canned goods, etc. for fifteen years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market.

Claire Suzanne is a loyal ALIDé customer who repays her loans. With the goal of expanding her business and increasing her income, she is seeking a new loan.

loans.use: Purchase of boxes of cookies, candy, and various other products

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Being a good mother, 38-year-old Mercedita is very concerned about the lives of her three children who still live with her and are dependent on her.

Instead of allowing herself to be trapped in the midst of insecurities, Mercedita joined a KIVA field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, to be able to access loans which will enable her to be productive and flourish. 

Through previous loans, she has supported her fishing business. Profits she will be getting will augment her husband’s income and as soon as they grow, she will be able to support her children’s education until they finish college and provide other needs in order to enjoy the gift of life.  Moreover, her role as a mother will be happy. 

Her membership in ASHI and the loans she has accessed since she became a member have assisted her in operating a business. Because of this, Mercedita has been performing very well in her repayment, attendance, and business thus making her qualified for a higher loan amount.

loans.use: To continue fishing business and expand it

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. Muhammad is married and a father of one daughter who is three years old. Muhammad and his small family moved to a new house with an extra room. The house needed painting and the water network needed fixing. Muhammad came to FATEN and received a loan to help him cover those expenses.  Muhammad is an employee and it will be easier for him to repay FATEN on a monthly basis than covering the expenses all at once.

Muhammad appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Home fixing and painting

loans.name: Ol

texts.en: Selling used motor bike is the main activity of Mr. Ol P.. He also buys used motorbikes at reasonable price from people in the village and then sells them to gain a profit. He started this selling business in early 1999 and he earns about $2.50 per day. This income mainly serves to meet his family’s daily expenses. His wife manages the household work and sells a few goods such as fast food, soft drinks, and other products. She earns an income of approximately $2 per day. They have two children; all of them are single and they are student in the local school. Presently, Mr. Ol P. wants to expand his selling business by purchasing more used good motor bikes for sales. This is the reason that Mr. Ol P. would like a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more used motor bikes for sales.

loans.name: Hamissah

texts.fr: Hamissah U. est commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire.  Elle a 1 enfant qui a 18 ans, et qui va à l’école.  Elle a aussi une personne en charge.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 paires de basins moins riches, 10 basins simples, 20 sacs a main, une douzaine paires de pantalons, et transport.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter le capital tout en augmentant la quantité et qualité de produits à vendre.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste dans le district de Rubavu, développer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour son enfant.
texts.en: Hamissah U. is a shopkeeper and has been a client of ACB since 2010. She is married, was born in Rwanda, and has completed six years of secondary schooling. She has a child who is 18 years old and attending school. She also has another person in her care. Hamissah is going to use her loan to buy 7 lengths of moins riches damask cloth, 10 lengths of plain damask cloth, 20 handbags, and a dozen pairs of pants and to pay for transport. Her strategy for growing her business is to increase her capital while increasing the quantity and quality of the products she sells. She would like to become a wholesale merchant in the Rubavu district, to improve her family's well-being, and to cover the cost of schooling for her child.

loans.use: Buying damask cloth, handbags, and pants; Paying for transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintenance of his mototaxi.

loans.name: Cruz Enrique

texts.es:
El joven C., de 26 años de edad, es originario de la Concordia una comarca localizada en la cuidad de Jinotega, es soltero, de oficio carpintero y agricultor, solo pudo llegar hasta primer año de la secundaria debido a que se había quedado si  trabajo y no tenia como seguir pagando sus estudios.
Inicio con su papa a la edad de 12 años, después se fue a trabajar a una empresa como carpintero donde la pagaban C$ 120 córdobas mas la alimentación, trabajo ahí durante un año  debido a que la empresa se traslado a otro lugar, dejo  ese trabajo y decidió independizarse por si solo y no continuo sus estudios, pues para poder acudir a su centro de estudio se tiene que caminar media hora todos los días.  Además tenia que ayudar a su padre llevar el alimento de todos los días, tiempo después se especializo en albañilería  mas su experiencia en agricultura ha podido sobrevivir y crear su propio negocio de siembra.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 bueyes que le ayuden en el arado de la tierra para cultivos, pues así no tendrá que prestar bueyes a otras personas y tener lo suyo propio, asi  poder producir mejor y sembrar cebolla, frijol, repollo.
El espera que con este crédito pueda permitirle aumentar su negocio, comprar herramientas de trabajo como una moto cierra, para afinar su trabajos de carpintería y desea tener un taller donde pueda elaborar todo tipo de muebles elaborados por, darle trabajo a otras personas y sacar adelante sus cultivos.
texts.en:
C. is 26 years old and is a native of Concordia, a district located in the city of Jinotega. He is single and is a carpenter and farmer. He only completed up to his first year of secondary school because he didn’t have a job and couldn’t continue paying for his studies.

He began working with his father when he was 12 and later went on to work as a carpenter at a company where they paid him 120 Nicaraguan Córdobas (NIO) and provided him with food. He worked there for a year until the company relocated to another area, so he left that job and decided to become independent. He didn’t continue his studies because he would have to walk a half an hour every day to reach the school. In addition, he had to help his father provide food for the family every day. Later, he specialized in building and his experience in farming allowed him to create his own business.

He is requesting the loan to purchase two oxen to help him plow his farmland so that he will have his own oxen and will not have to borrow them from other people. This way, he can have better crops and grow onion, beans, and cabbage.

He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to expand his business and buy tools like a chain saw to sharpen his carpentry jobs. He wants to have a workshop where he can make all types of furniture by giving work to other people and having his crops progress.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to help him plow his farmland

loans.name: Maria Dignidad

texts.es:
Maria tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia la cual está ubicada en un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Las actividades principales en dicho caserío son la agricultura, crianza de animales de engorde y comercio.

Maria posee una pequeña bodega en la cual vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años en su domicilio. Vende sus productos al contado y al crédito. También se dedica al engorde de aves de corral, cerdos y otros animales, los cuales luego comercializa. Ya ha ganado un gran número de clientes por su experiencia y variedad de productos.

Maria desea usar su crédito para surtirse la bodega de productos por la campaña escolar. Espera proveer sus clientes con los productos que han pedido y así generar mayores ingresos en esta temporada. Desea usar sus ingresos en gastos de educación para sus propios hijos. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She lives in her own home in a small rural village in the District of La Victoria, which is approximately thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. The main activities in this village are agriculture, raising animals for fattening, and trade.

Maria has a small store where she sells groceries and basic necessities. She has managed this business from her home for more than ten years. Maria sells her products for cash or on credit. She also fattens poultry, pigs, and other animals for eventual resale. Maria has accumulated a large number of customers as a result of her experience and offering a variety of products.

Maria wants to use her loan to stock her store with products for the school year. She hopes to provide her customers with the merchandise they have requested so that she can generate more income this season. Maria wants to use her earnings to pay for the educational expenses of her own children. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio B. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. He is 60 years old. Patricio is widowed. To make a living, Patricio owns and operates a mini-restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals, like bulalo, adobo, pinapaitan, and halang-halang, to customers in the local community. Patricio has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Patricio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients. Patricio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like pork, spices, and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Patricio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like pork, spices, and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Kukat

texts.en:
Kukat is 28 years old,  married to Nabulu who is a business lady, and together they have three children, Naserian aged 12 years in class seven, Job aged 10 years in class four, and Mary aged five years in class one. 

Kukat is a livestock trader and his business is located at Bisssil market which is a busy market where he receives customers from Kajiado, Kitengela and Nairobi. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client who is registered with KADET. 

He has applied for his second  loan amount of KES. 40,000  from KADET LTD,and intends  to purchase more livestock for trade. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to establish dairy farm. Kukat dreams of becoming a wholesaler of livestock. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for trade.

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Moun C., age 40, sells a few wares in front of her home. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets for children, shampoo, perfume, and some cooking supplies. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works in the garment industry for a salary. The couple has three school-aged children. 

Recently, part of Moun C.’s kitchen broke, and she doesn’t have funds to repair it. To deal with this problem, Moun C. is requesting a loan from Kiva to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: to repair her broken kitchen.

loans.name: Terre Promise Plus Group

texts.en:
Veronique, aged 42, is the manager of this Community Bank groupm named “Terre Promise Plus” which means “Promised Land”. The group is composed of 9 members, united in solidarity, for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Veronique operates a clothing store in one of the largest markets in the capital city of Kinshasa. She became a micro entrepreneur in 2003 with a beginning capital of US$50. Her business is located in the northern area of Kinshasa. She has already received five loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. 

Veronique intends to use this loan to buy dozens of cookware to resell at a profit, in order to increase her income. Currently she earns a profit of $200 per month. Her dream is to someday open several clothing stores in Kinshasa and to purchase items directly from China. Veronique is married and mother to six children, between the ages of 6 and 23. All of the children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of cookware to resell at profit in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de divers produits (porcelaine et pagnes…) depuis 1989  et mariée à un photographe professionnelle. Mme Afi a 46 ans et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’approvisionne de temps en temps au grand marché de Lomé et revend à domicile à toutes les couches sociales. Avec ce second crédit elle veut sortir son activité de la maison  pour se faire connaître de la population et  accroître son commerce.
texts.en: Seller of diverse products (porcelain and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)…) since 1989 and married to a professional photographer. Madame Afi is 46 years old and a mother of five. She stocks up from time to time at the grand market of Lomé and sells from her house. With this second loan she wants to get her business out of her house to get to know the population and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy porcelain and pagnes (colorful African cloths)

loans.name: Bienvenue

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 43ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant âgé de 21ans, elle a un niveau terminal e, en 2004,  par manque de soutient  elle avait préféré de  se lancer dans la vente de foufou en gros et détail avec un capital de 400.000Frs.

Ses recettes sont 150.000F à 425.000F après 2 jours  et elle vend non loin de son domicile ce qui lui permet de commencer très tôt son activité.

Avec le prêt de HOPE, elle veut renforcer le stock de son aliment en achetant des sacs de foufou 
Très gentille, son souhait est toujours de satisfaire ses clients en leur offrant des meilleurs prix.

Pour le bien de sa famille, elle compte construire une maison et voyager pour l’achat des marchandises.
texts.en:
A 43 year old woman, married with one child aged 21,she reached the end of high school  but in 2004  due to lack of support she chose to take up the sale of fufu wholesale and retail with a starting capital of 400.000Frs.

Her income is from 150.000F to 425.000F for two days and she has her commerce not far from her home which enables her to open her business very early.

With the loan from Hope, she wants to increase her stock of fufu by buying sacks of it.

She is very kind and she always does her best to satisfy her customers by keeping her prices as low as possible.

For her family’s well being, she intends to build a house and to travel to purchase her goods.

loans.use: purchase sacks of fufu.

loans.name: Honiwel

texts.en:
Honiwel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Honiwel has a shop that sells cell phone accessories & electronic loads (prepaid cell phone minutes). He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional cell phone accessories. In the picture is Honiwel, his wife, and their son. 

Honiwel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Honiwel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional cell phone accessories

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 years old and married to Agrippina. They are blessed with three children.

Julius owns a retail shop in Gitathuru, Nairobi, where he supplies tea leaves to the residents of that area. He has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of 8,400 KES a month.

Julius is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD which he will use to purchase more tea leaves. He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business and educate his children.

Julius is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more  tea leaves

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José es padre de familia de 34 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Reque que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace varios años José se dedica a la fabricación de estructuras metálicas como: puertas,ventanas y rejas para las casas, su negocio lo tiene en su domicilio,cuenta con su propia clientela y realiza trabajo a pedidos, con los ingresos que recauda solventa las necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Al observar que su negocio va creciendo ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar materiales y algunas herramientas para seguir realizando su trabajo y cumpliendo con sus pedidos,con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  José es una persona trabajadora de empuje que con mucho esfuerzo trata que su familia se supere cada día más.
texts.en:
José is a 34 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home which has water and electricity.  His home is in Reque district, in Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for its farming and livestock raising.

José has been making metal structures such as doors, windows and house grilles for several years.  His business is located in his home.  He has his own customers and works to order.  He uses the income that he makes to cover the daily needs of his household.

As he has noticed that his business is growing, José decided to request a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy materials and some tools so that he can continue carrying out his work and filling his orders.  His goal is to make more profits so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  José is a hard-working man with a lot of drive who puts a lot of effort into trying to ensure that his family does well in life.

loans.use: to buy materials and some tools so that he can continue working in his metal shop

loans.name: Iyali Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Iyali". Está ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Maria de los Angeles es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 31 años, estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, se dedica a la venta de pan, ella tiene 3 hijos, inició hace 4 años ya que su esposo tuvo un accidente grave y lo dejo paralitico por lo que emprendio este negocio para poder mantener a su familia, la señora piensa que apesar de todo puede salir adelante con el apoyo de su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar pan de dulce. Sus clientes son personas de su comunidad que la prefieren por su buen trato y por la calidad de su pan. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas de sobresalir. También espera con esto obtener mejores ganancias y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: This group is called "Iyali" and it is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has ten members.  Maria de los Angeles is the group's president.  She is 31 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She has three children and she sells bread for a living.  She started this business four years ago as her husband had a serious accident which left him paralyzed.  She started the business so that she could support her family.  Maria believes that, in spite of everything, she can get ahead in life with the help of her family.  She is requesting this loan to buy 'pan de dulce' (sweet bread).  Her customers are people from her community who prefer to buy from her because of her good customer service and the quality of her bread.  At the time of requesting this loan, she feels excited and has a great desire to do well.  She hopes that she will be able to make better profits and thereby be able to enjoy a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy bread and sweet treats

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 30 year old woman. She is married and she has 3 children. She lives in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her dream is to have a permanent house of her own and to buy more modern machines for her business. She is a tailor and basically gets tenders from schools to make school uniforms. Her major challenge is that business is seasonal. Jeniffer needs the loan to buy school uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of school uniforms.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim (in the photo), 27, is a garment worker. Her husband, 33, is a construction worker. They have two sons. One son is in school and another one is still young. The family is living in a village 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sim is applying for a loan of US $1,000 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en:
Earnest is a business man aged 39. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last 2 years, he has been managing a printing business to earn a living. Previously, he used to sell bread. In the next 5 years, he wants to open another outlet of his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a computer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy computer

loans.name: Ne'maa

texts.en:
Ne'maa is a religious, conservative woman, so her son, Mahmoud, who is 22 years old, was photographed in the picture instead.    

Ne'maa is 51. She is married and has five sons and two daughters. Some of her sons are employed and sharing her expenses. 

Ne'maa has a project of selling clothes, and she wants to purchase a large quantity of clothes for the coming winter season so she will have a better collection with which to compete. 

Ne'maa has some money, but it is not enough to pay for the clothes, so she needs to take a loan of $500 from FATEN. 

When Ne'maa gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to purchase new season clothes for sale. She hopes this will increase her income and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nabusoba Group

texts.en:
Jacklyne is the facilitator of Nabusoba group. Jacklyne and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
	
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Jacklyne and her group during Kenya’s next  planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture  package, which includes training, reliable input supply, such as fertilizer, seeds, credit and insurance.

Jacklyne takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre fund in order to get money and educate her children and also to buy livestock. In the recent 2011 season, Jacklyne had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on a one-acre piece of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jacklyne was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With the income from maize sales, Jacklyne intends to buy livestock and also to get food for her family.

In 2012 members of Nabusoba group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Santos Reniery

texts.es:
El sr Santos tiene 30 años de edad, es padre de 4 hijos y se dedica a la venta de pan blanco, su producto lo transporta en motocicleta y lo reparte en diferentes colonias y aldeas cercanas de la ciudad de Choluteca.
todos los dias sale a las 5 de la mañana para lograr terminar el recorrido de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para la moto que tiene malos y tambien para hacerle un mantenimiento, ya que esta motocicleta es el unico medio en que transporta sus panes.
en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
Santos tiene como meta graduar a sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is 30 years old and the father of four children. He sells white bread and transports his products by motorcycle to different neighborhoods and the surrounding areas of the city of Choluteca. Every day he leaves at 5am so that he can complete the deliveries to his customers.

This loan will be used to buy spare parts for his motorcycle that is in bad condition. He will also pay for maintenance. The motorcycle is the only means for him to transport his products. In his free time, Santos attends church. His goal is to see his children graduate and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to pay for parts and maintenance for the motorcycle he uses to deliver bread.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario sigue participando en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Nazario sigue con el negocio de venta de madera y también con el servicio de transporte. Nazario con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho con el capital del negocio. 

En esta oportunidad Nazario requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Nazario se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Nazario continues participating with Asociación Arariwa’s micro finance unit’s “San Isidro de Campone” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Nazario is still in the business of selling lumber and also with the transportation service.  Nazario did very well with his previous loan and obtained good results so is now asking for another loan because it’s very helpful for his business’ capital.  On this occasion Nazario needs the loan to buy lumber.  Nazario is grateful for the opportunity presented to him by this means and commits to make his installment payments according to the payment timeline.

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Umubano Group

texts.fr:
Dorothée est une commerçante âgée de 32ans qui habite au Quartier Ngangara de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle vend divers articles dans sa boutique (savons, souliers, bonbons, produits cosmétiques, haricots, riz, biscuits,…) depuis 11 ans. C’est un métier qu’elle commence alors qu’elle était élève. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Tharcisse et ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2étudient. 
 Elle demande le crédit Kiva de 250,000 francs burundais afin d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’articles divers de boutique (savons, souliers, bonbons, produits cosmétiques, haricots, riz, biscuits,…) à revendre  et réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Umubano»
texts.en:
Dorothée is a 32-year-old merchant who lives in the Ngangara neighborhood, in the Mairie district of Bujumbura. She is a member of the Umubano community group. She runs a shop where she has been selling various items such as soap, shoes, candy, cosmetics, beans, rice, cookies, etc. for 11 years. She started this activity when she was still a student. She completed five years of primary school. She is married to a man named Tharcisse, and together they have three children, two of whom go to school. 

Dorothée is seeking a loan of 250,000 Burundian francs to increase her capital. She will stock up on merchandise for her shop and make substantial profits from the sales.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise such as soap, shoes, candy, cosmetics, beans, rice, cookies, etc. for her shop

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña katupyry se llama el comité integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de encarnación, ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, cuyo objetivo principal es la ayuda a sus hijos y familiares. Quieren un futuro mejor para ellos y es por eso que se esfuerzan al máximo. 
Una de ellas es la señora Nancy, quien  es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella trabaja como peluquera hace ya un buen tiempo. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa y de esa forma puede sentirse útil. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tijeras, peines, tintes, esmalte para uñas y otros insumos, los cuales son indispensables para su trabajo. Está muy agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues la ayuda es muy importante.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank is comprised of ten women from the city of Encarnación.  They are hard-working and tenacious women whose main objective is to help their children and their relatives.  They want a better future for them, and that is why they put forth their maximum efforts.

Nancy is one of the members.  She is single and has no children.  She has worked as a hairdresser for some time now.  Thanks to this work she is able to help with the household expenses.  That way she is able to feel useful.

She is requesting the loan to buy scissors, combs, dyes, nail polish, and other supplies that are indispensable for her work.

She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving her.  This help is very important.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs, dyes, nail polish, and other supplies.

loans.name: Imelida

texts.en:
Imelida is a married woman with eight school going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Imelida has operated a tailoring business for the past twenty years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of materials. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of fabrics for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Frans

texts.en:
Frans is a 45-year-old man who is married to Petronela, a 42-year-old lady. Frans and his wife have been blessed with three children: Natrianus, 24 and married; Semri, 17, and working at Kalimantan; Nuryati, 14, and studying in the 3rd grade of junior high school.
Frans runs a kiosk business selling basic daily items such as sugar, tea, coffee, cooking oil, snacks etc. He also sells some kinds of vegetable. He started the business one year ago. Frans also set up a mini stall besides the kiosk to sell petrol. 
Frans dreams of enlarging the business but he has no more capital to make it happen. Therefore he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner TLM amounting to 7,500,000 IDR to buy kiosk items such as a greater variety of snacks and nine basic daily items. He also wants to purchase scrap metal from a collector to resell it. Through the loan, Frans really hopes to provide a better life for his beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase kiosk items such as a greater variety of snacks and nine daily basic items, plus purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Akur

texts.en:
Akur is a 32-year-old married woman with four children (two of them are in school). She has had a business of selling in a grocery store in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, sugar and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Raquel se dedica al perifoneo y su herramienta principal es su automóvil, pero su auto se descompuso y ya no quiso funcionar, por eso esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros para comprar un nuevo carro.
La señora Raquel tiene 25 años dedicándose al perifoneo, trabajo con el cual puede solventar los gastos de la casa ya que al estar separada su trabajo es fundamenta para pagar los gastos de la casa. La señora Raquel tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun están en etapa escolar y por quienes se esfuerza para darles lo mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Raquel works doing loudspeaker announcements. Her main piece of equipment is her vehicle, however, it broke down and will not function anymore. This is why she is requesting a loan with us to purchase a new car.

Raquel has worked doing loudspeaker announcements for 25 years. Her work allows her to pay for household expenses. Now that she is unable to work, it is essential in order to pay for the household expenses. Raquel is has three children who are school aged. She tries hard every day to give them the best.

loans.use: to buy a car to work doing loudspeaker announcements.
